story:
What is Ancient Fire?

Ancient Fire is the vision of Margot & Jason Phelps, the powerhouse duo behind a new line of products, taproom, and community, based in Manchester, NH. 

In 2003 Jason was diagnosed with cancer and afterwards Margot asked Jason if he thought he might want to spend his time differently post treatment. Taking the bait, Jason pursued learning how to brew his own beer. One thing quickly led to many others, and a few years later beverages made under the vanity brand Ancient Fire were being shared with family and friends. 

 

Upon getting involved in the home brewing, and home winemaking, communities the projects took off, and so did the travel and networking. All of these events resulted in a blossoming of so many precious relationships. Jason has been a speaker and writer for WineMaker and Brew Your Own magazines, is a BJCP certified Beer & Mead judge, featured guest on a number of beverage related podcasts and blogged on his own for several years, all of these activities created endless adventures for both of them. Through all of this it was clear to both Margot and Jason that they had found "their people”, and the Ancient Fire community was born. 

What Is Next?

Bringing the Ancient Fire brand to the masses will require the outfitting of a production space and tap room, marketing the brand publicly, developing relationships with local craft beverage shops and bars, and designing an entertaining experience for visitors. 

Pouring some delicious crushable Cherry / Lime mead. 

No taproom reaches its fullest potential without great products to keep people coming back, and no beloved brand ever reaches that status merely by following the pack. Drawing on the creativity, experience and award winning track record of the last 15 years, Margot and Jason have developed a line of "Crushable" meads that offer the balance of a casual format, with the diverse possibilities of a world of ingredients to create them with. With lower alcohol content, drier finishes and fanciful carbonation, these beverages can be enjoyed by the pint and are perfect to go in a growler. Adding seasonal ciders with similar profiles, our taps will frequently rotate with favorites as well as our "Science Fair" projects to keep things interesting. A line of dessert-wine style meads will also allow our mad scientist in residence (Jason) to use alcohol, sugar, wood and unusual ingredients in order to create limited release products that you will be talking about for years to come.

You may be asking yourself "what do I know about mead and cider?" If you don't think you know as much as you would like we've got your covered. Passion and education are two core values for Ancient Fire, and when you visit our taproom and production facility you will be able to learn more about the history of these beverages, how we make them, how to taste & enjoy them, how we keep our fingers on the pulse of beverage tastes, and the new frontiers we will be exploring. 

Will you take your place around the Ancient Fire?

With your generous support we will be decorating and outfitting our taproom to create a community space where stories and experiences are exchanged, laughter is promoted and fellowship is cherished, all over glasses of delicious beverages.

The success of this crowdfunding campaign is integral to creating the gathering space for the AF community. It will purchase the tables and stools you will sit at to swap stories and outfit the kitchen that will create the food that compliments your pints and flights which will be poured at the bar that you helped to build. All of this designed so that when supporters engage with our brand you can be proud that your support is visible and impactful.

Expressing your Ancient Fire Spirit!

By supporting our campaign you will become a member of our Ancient Fire Community. We want you to be able to display your pride of being a part of that community with some AF swag! Each funding level gives you a chance to show of your AF community support with Stickers, Coasters, Glassware, T-shirts and even an opportunity to create a mead or cider with the mad scientist himself!

Other Ways to Help

There are additional ways that you can help other than funding our campaign:

  • Use the Social Sharing links or copy and use this URL (https://igg.me/at/ancientfire) for the campaign to share it on Facebook & Twitter, encouraging your friends to fund Ancient Fire.
  • Send an email to your friends explaining why you support Ancient Fire and ask them to do the same. Be sure to include the url link!
  • Invite your friends to like the Ancient Fire Facebook page so they can get all our updates.

Thank you!

Margot & Jason Phelps

 

* Important Mead Club Perk Information

The Ancient Fire Mead Club is a quarterly membership program that affords members five (5) bottles in a shipment (taproom pickup is also available) that has been curated by Margot & Jason. Some products will actually be released to members before they become available to the general public. In addition to the five bottles each quarter the additional benefits below are included with membership:

  • Subscription to Insiders Email List - early notice on events, special releases/purchases, including taproom only
  • 10% discount in the Tap Room, including food, to go product and swag
  • 10% add-on bottles via Vinoshipper
  • 10% discount for online merchandise
  • Early and direct engagement on membership change/improvement over time

The Ancient Fire Mead Club will not ship the first membership package until Q3 of 2018. (Due to the timing of the crowd funding campaign and production starting we do not feel that we will be able to offer a proper member benefit until we have had time to age some of our small batch product to share.) 

You must be at least 21 years of age in order to be a member of the Mead Club. In order to extend membership beyond the selected perk level contact Ancient Fire when the membership certificate is received. Standard membership fee will apply for extended quarters. Membership can be cancelled at any time, and a schedule to cutoff for add-on ordering and cancellation will be published to members. 

Refer to this Vinoshipper link for more information on direct shipping restrictions before ordering a perk level that contains the Mead Club.

story:
Summary

Saunders Family Bakery started from a dream to excel beyond the normal, local bakery scene, with the belief that local first can be brought into the market and understanding that seasonal selections offer an amazing base to expand our customers ideas of baked goods. With that desire we started to dabble in new ideas, using Terry's 23+ years experience in the bakery industry with the last 16+ being spent along the lakeshore to develop new recipes and tweak some traditional items. We are committed to preserving old bakery techniques like using long fermentation times and our hearty sourdough starter to create a complex flavor profile and introducing new ideas that allow for continued development of existing goods.  We plan to be in restaurants, our storefront and farmers markets so that our bread is available to you any day of the week, year round.

It is our desire to bring a unique relationship that allows for personalized service for our customers and customized service for our retail partners while connecting with the vibrant (and growing) local food network in Western Michigan, thus Saunders Family Bakery was developed and has begun bringing our style to old and new friends weekly.

The Need:

We want to host a place where young adults can go to hang out but also to share our testimony. We want to provide music and entertainment for those who don't want to hang out at a bar or want a quiet place to gather with friends for board games or quiet conversations. We also want to help provide training, as it fits in, to those who need support standing on their own feet.

Financial Goals:

This is a $100,000 project. We have already bought most of the necessary equipment, with just a few more items to buy. We are looking to raise $25000 to help gather the balance of the needed supplies/equipment. If we hit or exceed our goal that would be a blessing and we will apply all of it to items needed for the bakery. We are also working to look into SBA loans for the balance that we do not achieve here.

Here is a list of items we are pursuing with this fundraiser:

Lighting

Furniture

Signage

Appliances

Coffee Bar needs

 

We believe that this is the path laid before us and ask for your support reaching this goal.

Our Amazing Perks:

  • Sponsor status on our website
  • Free Coffee/Pastry Coupon
  • Vinyl Car Sticker
  • Saunders Family Bakery T-shirt
  • Saunders Family Bakery mug
  • Personalized mug hung on the wall with free weekly coffee for a year!
  • Private Dessert party for you and a friend
  • Private Dessert board game Party at our Bakery for up to 15 people

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support goes beyond just a monetary contribution, it is planting the seed for a long lasting network of high quality local food in Western Michigan.  We realize that not everyone is able to make a contribution.  We would greatly appreciate if you would at least help us spread the word!  Please share with friends on Facebook if you think they might be interested.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read this campaign and we hope to put some amazing baked goods in your hands very soon! 

DAY 2:

We have scheduled our meeting with the architect to layout our floor plan and determine where specifics for electric, gas lines and plumbing will be. We are thankful for the prayers and unspoken support that we have seen in the last 24 hours. Please continue to pray for us and that we continue down the path laid out for us!

story:
Bringing new light to a different way of brewing.

While barley is highly regarded in the world of beer, corn is often disregarded as a brewing grain and even, at times, treated with disdain.  However, the history of brewing with corn goes back at least as far as that for barley, and is rooted right here in the Western Hemisphere.  At Dos Luces, we have explored the history behind some of the many styles of beer traditionally brewed with corn, and have embraced corn as our core grain.  The “Dos” Luces (Two Lights) represent our two core types of beer, a corn-based Chicha and a corn and agave-based Pulque.

Dos Luces. The sun and the moon. Inti and Meztli. Chicha and Pulque. We chose the name Dos Luces because it represents the duality of light – While you might be tempted to imagine this as light and darkness, we prefer to consider the bright light of day in contrast to the brightest beacon of light at night. Call it divine inspiration or simply the accumulation of ideas within two swirling brains, Dos Luces represents the idea that there is always light when you look for it.

Dos Luces is the result of when two people who love beer get together and start talking.

Judd Belstock, the owner and founder, has been in the beer industry since he was 23 years old. His interest in Chicha and Pulque began years before he was born, when his father spent time in the mountains of Peru, working with the Peace Corps around Cuzco. After childhood trips to various regions in Mexico, as well as rooted interest in the history of the Americas before the Conquistadors, Judd went onto a business career selling and marketing beer. That’s where he met Sam Alcaine, and eventually started asking the question, “What if we fermented something other than barley?”

Sam Alcaine, Co-founder, brewed his first beer in college, and has been hooked on fermentation ever since. Son of El Salvadoran and Cuban immigrants, he has always loved studying the unique fermented foods and beverages of the Americas. Sam has been a brewer, food microbiologist, and now is a professor of fermentations. Over the years he’s scoured the States for Pulque, malted corn in his apartment, and encouraged everyone to drink these bubbling brews. He and Judd met many moons ago, and now the sun has risen on the opportunity to follow in the footsteps of rich traditions and ferment something different.

Coming to Denver’s Historic South Broadway Neighborhood in 2018.

We are very proud to be located on Denver’s Historic South Broadway. What used to be a street filled with antique stores and car dealerships is now turning into a thoroughfare filled with restaurants, breweries, recreational marijuana shops, coffee roasters, and doggie day-cares. Our own location was originally used as a sales room for a supplier of instruments for school bands, and later became an antique store. As the street has changed over the decades, and continues to change, Dos Luces looks forward to being a part of its future. We are very happy to be on the same block as food and beverage innovators like Black Project Spontaneous and Wild Ales, Adelitas Cocina, Palenque Mezcal Bar, Chupaflor Ice Cream, and Maria Empanada. Within just a few blocks, you can also find Grandma’s House Brewery, brewing (among other things) Colorado’s first craft Sake Gaijan 24886, Alternation Brewing, La Chiva Columbian restaurant, and Azucar Peruvian Bakery. Can’t wait to see what comes next!

Your Funds Will Make the Brewery Truly Special

The $10,000 goal for this project will be used to put the finishing touches on the brewery, most notably furniture and glassware.  That said, construction is proving much more costly than anticipated, so we've had to cut some things out of the original plan.  If we raise more than the goal, it will help bring some of this things back, up to and including a full-fledged pilot brewery if we can raise $100,000 or more.

Dos Luces. The sun and the moon. Inti and Meztli. Chicha and Pulque. We chose the name Dos Luces because it represents the duality of light – While you might be tempted to imagine this as light and darkness, we prefer to consider the bright light of day in contrast to the brightest beacon of light at night. Call it divine inspiration or simply the accumulation of ideas within two swirling brains, Dos Luces represents the idea that there is always light when you look for it.
Dos Luces is the result of when two people who love beer get together and start talking.
Judd Belstock, the owner and founder, has been in the beer industry since he was 23 years old. His interest in Chicha and Pulque began years before he was born, when his father spent time in the mountains of Peru, working with the Peace Corps around Cuzco. After childhood trips to various regions in Mexico, as well as rooted interest in the history of the Americas before the Conquistadors, Judd went onto a business career selling and marketing beer. That’s where he met Sam Alcaine, and eventually started asking the question, “What if we fermented something other than barley?”
Sam Alcaine, Co-founder, brewed his first beer in college, and has been hooked on fermentation ever since. Son of El Salvadoran and Cuban immigrants, he has always loved studying the unique fermented foods and beverages of the Americas. Sam has been a brewer, food microbiologist, and now is a professor of fermentations. Over the years he’s scoured the States for Pulque, malted corn in his apartment, and encouraged everyone to drink these bubbling brews. He and Judd met many moons ago, and now the sun has risen on the opportunity to follow in the footsteps of rich traditions and ferment something different.

Coming to Denver’s Historic South Broadway Neighborhood in 2018.
We are very proud to be located on Denver’s Historic South Broadway. What used to be a street filled with antique stores and car dealerships is now turning into a thoroughfare filled with restaurants, breweries, recreational marijuana shops, coffee roasters, and doggie day-cares. Our own location was originally used as a sales room for a supplier of instruments for school bands, and later became an antique store. As the street has changed over the decades, and continues to change, Dos Luces looks forward to being a part of its future. We are very happy to be on the same block as food and beverage innovators like Black Project Spontaneous and Wild Ales, Adelitas Cocina, Palenque Mezcal Bar, Chupaflor Ice Cream, and Maria Empanada. Within just a few blocks, you can also find Grandma’s House Brewery, brewing (among other things) Colorado’s first craft Sake Gaijan 24886, Alternation Brewing, La Chiva Columbian restaurant, and Azucar Peruvian Bakery. Can’t wait to see what comes next!

Your Funds Will Make the Brewery Truly Special
The $10,000 goal for this project will be used to put the finishing touches on the brewery, most notably furniture and glassware.  That said, construction is proving much more costly than anticipated, so we've had to cut some things out of the original plan.  If we raise more than the goal, it will help bring some of this things back, up to and including a full-fledged pilot brewery if we can raise $100,000 or more.

story:
What is the Bulgarian Beer Church?

Born in December 2009 and since living at beer2beer.org*, the BBC is the biggest online beer community in Bulgaria, boasting 27 000 devotees. BBC was registered as an NGO by the Sofia City Court in November 2014 and has since been on a mission to baptize people into beer culture in general via online publications and off-line events. 

*beer2beer.org first appeared online back in 2005 as a forum for beer lovers.  

Do you have a pope or something?

The Bishop Maltman, also known by his secular name Chavdar Petrov, is currently doubling as a pope and taking charge of this campaign, of course, supported by a team of trusted cardinals. 

What do we want to do?

We want to brew a holy beer with holy water for the A-Men – the ordinary superheroes with daily superpowers, the followers of the Bulgarian Beer Church, the believers. Once the beer is ready, we will present it at a special event in Sofia. 

And to do that, we will need the support of our apostles – people like, you know, you.   

Apostle vacancy?

Yes, we are looking for apostles. And since we’ve been out of eternal life lately, we are offering fame – you know, just like the eternal life but without the no-death promise. 

The Church will embrace every supporter of this campaign with a certificate of honor and a special place in our Hall of Fame.  

Those special 10 apostles who are willing to back the project with as much as USD 500 or more will be present on the label of the A-Men beer and granted special places in our thoughts and prayers until the end of days.

Alelujah.

Other projects by the BBC

In 2018 the organization premiered beer yoga classes in Bulgaria – series of exercises and meditation practices elaborated by the team of the Church and a professional yoga instructor.

In 2017 BBC and the local fast casual chain SKAPTOBARA created the Preacher – the first burger with beer in the recipe.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word:)

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Mark Nesheim and I've been a chef for the last 30 years and am current owner of Wings Airport Cafe. My specialties are Northern European and Midwestern American Cuisine. I'm a native of Brainerd Minnesota. I have skills in fine dining but my interest is in family style, fresh homemade foods and baked goods using quality and locally sourced ingredients.
  • At my current location, Wings Airport Cafe, our growth has exceeded the kitchen's potential and inspired the concept of Sourdough Sam's Cafe and Bakery. A family style restaurant that serves high quality homemade foods, fresh made from scratch baked goods, soups and sauces as well as gluten free and vegetarian options. A moderately price dining experience for the whole family to enjoy. We are a community oriented business and try to be involved in various organizations that benefit our friends and neighbors. 
  • The contributions we seek will help purchase a variety of equipment to be used for a bakery and food prep kitchen as well as various costs associated with start up. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are in need of $50,000.00 which will be used to purchase a bakery oven, an industrial mixer, additional ovens and grills, a proof box, bread pans, bread slicer, sheet pans, cooling racks, etc.
  • Your contribution will qualify you for some really nice perks. But you're also going to get high quality, made from scratch, moderately priced foods, breads and baked goods in a  restaurant atmosphere that you and your family can enjoy year round! Dine in or just grab a loaf of our homemade bread to enjoy at home! 
  • If our goal isn't met, any funds gained will be going to the project no matter the outcome of this campaign.

The Impact

  • We are offering fantastic, high quality, made from scratch cooking like grandma used to make along with homemade breads, gluten free breads and baked goods. 
  • This is my first campaign, but I'm also the owner of Wings Airport Cafe out of Brainerd, MN. I have been there 5 years and have tripled the sales in this location. 
  • At Wings Cafe, our slogan is "Making friends one plate at time" and we want to carry that into our new location with an expanded kitchen and bakery as we break bread together at Sourdough Sam's! 

Risks & Challenges

  • I've been in the business my whole working life and I've overcome all hurdles along the way. I have complete confidence in my abilities as a chef and as a business owner to see through to a successful opening and durable lasting business that you and your family will enjoy for years to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Be sure to like us on Facebook and share with your friends and family.
  • Be sure to share our Indiegogo Campaign and help make Sourdough Sam's a reality!!

The Impact

We are offering fantastic, high quality, made from scratch cooking like grandma used to make along with homemade breads, gluten free breads and baked goods. 
This is my first campaign, but I'm also the owner of Wings Airport Cafe out of Brainerd, MN. I have been there 5 years and have tripled the sales in this location. 
At Wings Cafe, our slogan is "Making friends one plate at time" and we want to carry that into our new location with an expanded kitchen and bakery as we break bread together at Sourdough Sam's!

I've been in the business my whole working life and I've overcome all hurdles along the way. I have complete confidence in my abilities as a chef and as a business owner to see through to a successful opening and durable lasting business that you and your family will enjoy for years to come.

story:
Chasing my dream of starting Blended Acai

As you all may know I recently decided to open a Superfood Bar called Blended Acai. As some of you may not know is the why behind it. Shortly after Chris and I got married in 2011, I got really sick and in addition our infertility my body basically stopped digesting my food properly. And because I was very sick and didn't have any answers from doctors. They diagnosed me with IBS. And maybe that's what I had. I still am unsure. But I had to take a look at what foods I was eating and the food labels. My gut was so bad I couldn't even consume basic foods. That's when my passion for healthy foods started. I found and fell in love with acai and smoothies. And I decided if I can help myself and anyone else have a better quality of life through food then I just have to. And that's where the idea of Blended Acai began. But sadly because of unexpected increased construction costs and startup costs Blended Acai may not exist. So I am starting this campaign to help with costs and allow this dream to continue to reach more people. I am not asking for much or please do not feel like you have to contribute. But even the smallest amount will help.

We are hoping to raise between $3000-$5000 to help with startup costs such as payroll, cost of food, lease, and any other monthly expense associated with the business. With your contribution you will be helping Blended Acai stay not just a dream but existing to help people feel their best from the inside out! Because what you eat really does matter. And making one healthy decision at a time helps us be our best so we can do our best!

Even if you are not able to contribute financially you can help by sharing because spreading this campaign. Also stopping by and experiencing our delicious food helps us as well!

And thank you from the bottom of my heart! It means the world to me to have your such an amazing support system!

story:
From Ashes to Glasses

On October 9th, 2017, we bundled our kids into our mini-van and peeled out as the Nun’s Canyon wildfire bore down on our home and small vineyard. We bid a hasty goodbye to the house that had been our home for the past year, having moved to Kenwood in 2016 with the goal of raising our kids in a more natural environment, and the longer term dream of starting our own wine label. The next day we got confirmation of the news we were dreading, nothing was left of our home, or the vintage water tower next to it, but a smokey pile of ash.

A few weeks later, humbled by the outpouring of love and support we received from our new community, distraught by the destruction wrought on our beautiful, adopted valley, and needing to turn our personal tragedy into something positive, Hamilton Family Wines was born. Our mission from the start has been to shine a light on everything that makes Sonoma special: the people, the landscape, and the wines that are born of both. Working with Sonoma-native winemaker, Jess Wade, and sourcing only Sonoma fruit, our wines are indicative of the region’s unique terroir. 

Our initial release includes our 2017 Petaluma Gap Pinot Noir, a 2018 Indian Springs Ranch Sauvignon Blanc, and a 2018 Sonoma Coast Rosé of Pinot Noir, with a 2018 Deering Vineyard Grenache Syrah, Mourvedre (GSM), a 2018 Placida Vineyards Pinot Noir, and a 2018 Sonoma Valley Bordeaux blend aging on French oak until spring of next year. Our total annual production is between 600-800 cases.

Continuing the Dream

Our next step is to open a private-by-appointment tasting room on our property. Our goal is to convert the old steel barn into an inside/outside tasting space with a rustic, farmhouse chic feel. The approval process is going to take time, money, and commitment, which is why we've kept the funding goal open. But, our wines are already in bottle, so you can feel secure knowing your support will be rewarded. 

Community is very important to us, and as we grow we intend to continue to give back to our community by creating and supporting jobs, funding access to food for those in need, and advocating for, and donating to, equal access to great education and affordable housing. We're also passionate about the environment, and farm our vineyard organically. We're committed to sourcing our fruit from other sustainable, organic, and biodynamic vineyards whenever possible. So while you're sipping on some fantastic Hamilton Family wine, you can feel even better knowing your support is doing good.

What's in it for me?

In addition to helping a small family business, and our commitments above, we have some fun and original perks! From naming one of our vines to private, hosted winemaker dinners, we've tried to appeal to a range of tastes and budgets. We very much believe in the personal touch, so we'll be involved in everything here, but if you have ideas or suggestions for how to make a perk perfect for you, let us know!

Can't Contribute? You Can Still Help!

We understand that not everyone will be able, or willing, to contribute. But, you can still help us by spreading the word to your family, friends, and on social media. If you do, make sure you tag us on Instagram @hamiltonfamilywines or Facebook www.facebook.com/HamiltonFamilyWines so we can say thank you.

story:
Za tekst na hrvatskom klikni ovdje

 

"The beers of the ancient Egyptians were flavored with cardamom and coriander, for the Egyptians had no hops; their beers were rich and flavorsome and thirst quenching. You could build pyramids after drinking that beer, and sometimes people did."

 - Neil Gaiman

 

The beginning

 

Once upon a time two guys, humble homebrewers, were drinking beers comparing them to their home crafted projects, when the idea crawled in and sprouted a fairy tale that became our project.

 

We wanted to give everyone a possibility to become a homebrewer. To create your own beer and try out something you have never tried before. You can have your own beer for special occasions like a birthday or a bachelor party. For anniversary or as a present for your beer loving friend. Or maybe for every day cause you want to try out many flavors and combinations.

 

How all this works

 

Don’t be scared, it’s easy!

Your adventure starts with choosing one of four different beer styles on our website, lets say pale ale. Then you can get creative  and add some character to your style with a little lime for refreshing the hot summer day, or some coffee and chili to enjoy after a nice meal. How about adding some bacon, to give your beer a nice smoky flavor, or just because it’s bacon.

 

 

Now you have started drooling and are becoming impatient, but adventure is not over yet. Next you will decide on one of suggested  labels to make your bottles unique or upload a picture that you can always look upon and remember: this was my creation! But what kind of a masterpiece would it be without a name. Choose in how many bottles you want to enjoy and don’t forget:

 

You Name It, And We Brew It !

 

So, while all this works perfectly on a small homebrewing scale, we needed help to bring this idea to all of you.

Next logical step was starting this crowdfunding campaign and designing all these perks so you can have fun and enjoy our products while simultaneously helping us to start this one of a kind brewery. It’s a symbiotic relationship.

 

Brewtiful perks

 

You are a beer lover and you want to go to a pub or a bar. Don't go in some lame shirt :)

Women's and men's T-shirts in four different colors. Pick one!

Just to show you the rainbow of your teeth and lighter savers.

 

This is a beer coaster with a cool logo. And it will hold Your personalized beer on it!

If you are on a party, mark your bottle with this mustache bottle marker. You will get some laughs and avoid drinking from someones bottle with a warmed up beer.

Imagine that you are sipping beers and soaking up the sun on a prow of small boat. And when beer can't cool you enough, there is a transparent sea that will do the job amazingly. When you get hungry there will be snacks and a meal and you will realize that "pomalo", the dalmatian way of living, is becoming your way. Don't just imagine!

 

Timeline

 

 

The fundamental idea of homebrewing is trying out new recipes, pushing the borders in creating beer, adding ingredients restricted only by your imagination.

While homebrewing is pushing the borders in creating different and unusual beer, Brew my Beer team is pushing the borders of homebrewing itself.

Help us fund this project and together we can start brewing.

 

Ways to help

For those that have will but not the funds there are other ways to help :

- spread the word among your friends

story:
Hi there,

I am Jeri Warlick, the founder of Chakra Love. I am a Texas native which grew up making mud pies and climbing trees far away from the design world. Yet, helping my grandmother sew and my father build our home, a love of design and architecture would inevitably develop. I have a background in interior architecture, energy work and a deep love for the simplicity and handcrafted elements in all things. I strongly feel cannabis is the future and can help many with physical and mental ailments. My mission is to educate others on the healing benefits of cannabis, as well as offer a well-made, affordable CBD oil to all.

I realized early on that the world is made up of energy. This energy can be harnessed for healing and wellness. Chakra Love™ debuted in 2012, and has since grown from handcrafted talismans to accessories, apparel, books and workbooks. In summer 2018, with a mission to educate and raise cannabis awareness, the holistic brand launched Chakra Love Elevated Essentials™ and Chakra Love Cannabis™. This elevated division of Chakra Love™ features hand-forged cannabis tools by designer and founder Jeri Warlick, crafted to evoke a sense of sacredness to the cannabis ritual. A monthly subscription box chock-full of finely curated CBD goods—including Chakra Love™ branded oils, tinctures and more—delivered to your doorstep is now available. In addition, a newly revised Chakra Love™ workbook—the cannabis edition—provides chakra-specific meditation practices and CBD goods designed to holistically restore balance in the body’s energetic chakra system.  

After years of conducting one-on-one chakra balancing sessions and workshops, I recognized how powerful an understanding of one’s own chakra system can be and created Chakra Love™ to empower people to take control of their energetic health. Chakra Love Elevated Essentials™ and Chakra Love Cannabis™ are a natural continuation of the (r)evolution that is Chakra Love™.

Jeri Warlick Jewelry & Chakra Love are proudly crafted by hand in Seattle in a small production studio in the International District. Slow living & slow loving!

My goal:

The manufacturing cost to launch my CBD good is more than I can do alone. This is where I need your help. Help support my campaign and be first to receive my CBD oil at a discounted cost.

After researching for a year or two, I found a manufacturer in the USA which uses only non-gmo, organic and American grown hemp for my CBD goods.

I am hoping to raise $25-50K to cover the initial cost of production, packaging, marketing and a new website design. I also will be working on developing additional CBD goods curated for the entire chakra system.

I am offering two different perks for folks which choose to support my launch. A discounted pre-sell of my CBD oil. Save 20% now for an estimated September delivery. Wholesale purchases are welcome. Please contact me at chakraloveseattle@yahoo.com

The product:

Chakra Love 500mg CBD oil

PreOrder now for late August delivery!

Chakra Love™ CBD Oil 500mg of CBD

2 ounces of full-spectrum hemp derived oil

containing beneficial cannabinoids and terpenes. *It does contain trace amounts of

THC. The concentration is far below what is necessary to

produce a psychoactive effect, meaning users will not get “high.”

<0.3% THC, complying with federal guidelines. Our oil contains 500mg of

full-spectrum CBD and is unflavored. It can be used as a sublingual (under the tongue drop or added to any drink.)

Made of American, organic, non-gmo hemp with no fertilizers, pesticides or chemicals.

Third party tested by Pro Verde Labs. Lab results available upon request.

The purification process creates a concentrated oil that is up to 40% CBD, with no pesticides, solvents, heavy metals, mold, or bacteria. Carbon dioxide extraction

process to produce a rich phytocannabinoid-rich oil.

2 ounce amber glass bottle with dropper. 18 years of age only. Keep away from children and pets.
story_txt: Hi there,I am Jeri Warlick, the founder of Chakra Love. I am a Texas native which grew up making mud pies and climbing trees far away from the design world. Yet, helping my grandmother sew and my father build our home, a love of design and architecture would inevitably develop. I have a background in interior architecture, energy work and a deep love for the simplicity and handcrafted elements in all things. I strongly feel cannabis is the future and can help many with physical and mental ailments. My mission is to educate others on the healing benefits of cannabis, as well as offer a well-made, affordable CBD oil to all.I realized early on that the world is made up of energy. This energy can be harnessed for healing and wellness. Chakra Love™ debuted in 2012, and has since grown from handcrafted talismans to accessories, apparel, books and workbooks. In summer 2018, with a mission to educate and raise cannabis awareness, the holistic brand launched Chakra Love Elevated Essentials™ and Chakra Love Cannabis™. This elevated division of Chakra Love™ features hand-forged cannabis tools by designer and founder Jeri Warlick, crafted to evoke a sense of sacredness to the cannabis ritual. A monthly subscription box chock-full of finely curated CBD goods—including Chakra Love™ branded oils, tinctures and more—delivered to your doorstep is now available. In addition, a newly revised Chakra Love™ workbook—the cannabis edition—provides chakra-specific meditation practices and CBD goods designed to holistically restore balance in the body’s energetic chakra system.  After years of conducting one-on-one chakra balancing sessions and workshops, I recognized how powerful an understanding of one’s own chakra system can be and created Chakra Love™ to empower people to take control of their energetic health. Chakra Love Elevated Essentials™ and Chakra Love Cannabis™ are a natural continuation of the (r)evolution that is Chakra Love™.Jeri Warlick Jewelry & Chakra Love are proudly crafted by hand in Seattle in a small production studio in the International District. Slow living & slow loving!My goal:The manufacturing cost to launch my CBD good is more than I can do alone. This is where I need your help. Help support my campaign and be first to receive my CBD oil at a discounted cost.After researching for a year or two, I found a manufacturer in the USA which uses only non-gmo, organic and American grown hemp for my CBD goods.I am hoping to raise $25-50K to cover the initial cost of production, packaging, marketing and a new website design. I also will be working on developing additional CBD goods curated for the entire chakra system.I am offering two different perks for folks which choose to support my launch. A discounted pre-sell of my CBD oil. Save 20% now for an estimated September delivery. Wholesale purchases are welcome. Please contact me at chakraloveseattle@yahoo.comThe product:Chakra Love 500mg CBD oilPreOrder now for late August delivery!Chakra Love™ CBD Oil 500mg of CBD2 ounces of full-spectrum hemp derived oilcontaining beneficial cannabinoids and terpenes. *It does contain trace amounts ofTHC. The concentration is far below what is necessary toproduce a psychoactive effect, meaning users will not get “high.”<0.3% THC, complying with federal guidelines. Our oil contains 500mg offull-spectrum CBD and is unflavored. It can be used as a sublingual (under the tongue drop or added to any drink.)Made of American, organic, non-gmo hemp with no fertilizers, pesticides or chemicals.Third party tested by Pro Verde Labs. Lab results available upon request.The purification process creates a concentrated oil that is up to 40% CBD, with no pesticides, solvents, heavy metals, mold, or bacteria. Carbon dioxide extractionprocess to produce a rich phytocannabinoid-rich oil.2 ounce amber glass bottle with dropper. 18 years of age only. Keep away from children and pets.

story:
OUR STORY

Bristol Station Brews & Taproom was founded with the passion to make great beer.  Our goal is to provide a beer for everyone, whether you're a novice or a beer aficionado.  The dream started between two home-brewers with ​the idea to operate a brewery in Downtown Bristol.  Believe In Bristol's first Entrepreneur's contest gave us the initial motivation to move forward with the idea.   After spending several months looking for the right location, we found the Historic Greyhound Bus Station in downtown Bristol.  The brewery opened with a 10 barrel brewing system which is one of the largest in the area. Beer production began in 2015, and we carry 12 beers on tap at any given time.  Due to our quaint taproom and relatively small size, we are able to brew  seasonal beers and even fulfill requests from our customers.  We then started to distribute our beers throughout the Tri-Cities TN/VA area.  Very quickly we started winning awards and medals for our great beers!! The can is the next step for us.

 

CAMPAIGN PURPOSE

We fill lots of growlers in the taproom, but they are heavy and bulky, made of glass and not very portable.  They don't fit very well in coolers!  We have had lots of requests to put our great beers in aluminum cans.  A vessel that is light and portable, easily recyclable, and can easily be taken to many different venues.  Also, cans can be distributed throughout the Tri-Cities, nay the WORLD, very easily.  We will put four of our award winning beers in cans immediately.  But we need your help!  There are significant hurdles to cross before we can do that, all of which are expensive.  Once we get the first run completed, future runs are much easier.  And we intend to continue to can our flagship beers and our limited seasonal beers all year long.  Thus giving you the opportunity to enjoy our beers anywhere - but just as if you were in the taproom!!

We here at Bristol Station listen to our customers.  We want to make great craft beer that you want to enjoy.  Whether you enjoy it here, there or anywhere, we are here to make you happy!  That's what makes our jobs so rewarding! 

 

What We Need

With your financial backing, we can take the next step toward fulfilling your requests, and get our beer into a can, which would help us get more fresh great-tasting beer to you.  We are striving to raise $5,000.00 to start our first canning run.  This money will go towards label design, ingredients, and canning supplies and production. 

 

What You Get

We only focus on one product here - beer!  And this whole project is about getting beer in a can to you.  So we only have one perk - beer!  Your $50.00 donation will get you four (4) packs of award-winning Bristol Station beer.  We are canning four different beers, so if you want a pack of each, go for it!  If you want all one beer that's great too!  Mix and match however you like.  This beer is for you!

Every penny helps and we really need every penny.  But if we do not reach or goal of $5,000.00 we will still start canning, it will just take a little longer.  If we reach our goal immediately, we will start the canning process immediately.  Current estimate is mid-January.  If not, we will can this summer once we have sufficient funds.

 

Why We Need Your Help

We have always been a small brewery, paying for everything as we go, not incurring huge debt.  We focus on the beer and our customer's experience.  Our beers have a proven track record as multiple award winners in multiple contests and festivals.  We are confident that you will enjoy our beers.  However, putting that beer in cans is expensive.  This will be the hardest challenge we've faced since we've opened.  And it's a long process to complete.

In order to fulfill our customers' request we have decided to utilize a mobile canning company to achieve our goal.  This limits our up-front costs and allows us to get to market more quickly.  This also allows us to be flexible with the beers that we put into cans.  Our Strawberry Pail Ale is our most sought after seasonal beer, and for many of you our most requested canned beer.  By using a mobile canning line we are able to change up and do this very easily when strawberry season arrives.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hopefully you can support our efforts in making this canning dream become a reality. If you can't at this time, there are still opportunities for you to assist us!

Something as simple as sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and your community can bring awareness to this campaign.  Together we can make our dream a reality! 

Please take a minute to share this campaign on your social media channels or invite folks via email.

Thanks again for your support of Bristol Station Brews & Taproom!

story:
It's our LAST FULL DAY! It's your last chance to get in on the 'early bird special'... 

Who wants to go on a fabulous foodie tour

with Chef Dan & Laurie?!

For every $25 you contribute in ANY FORM, you'll get one ballot to be entered in a fun fabulous food tour with Chef Dan & Laurie!!

 

We're ALSO bringing back PATIO DOLLARS for the final weekend - Friday - Sunday

** NOW Extended to Midnight Monday June 4! **

 

When you purchase $50.00 in PATIO DOLLARS (valid ONLY for use on the PATIO, and ONLY one per person) we will give you an extra 50% FREE! You'll get $75 for $50!!

 

We're taking it outside!

We want to build a beautiful destination patio right outside Twisted Lemon's front doors and take our Sustainable Garden Dining experiences to the next level! We need your  help to make these two amazing initiatives a success!

We've designed AWESOME PERKS and experiences to give you equal and greater value for your dollar at every level of contribution!  There are dollar-for-dollar-plus rewards for cash contributions from $25 and UP and we keep going with unique and special  Experiential Perks that we think you're going to love! Keep reading to the bottom to learn about a Special 'Business to Business' Perk for our local and fellow businesses!

The easy click perk FOR GIFT CERTIFICATES allows for a $25 contribution only.  For ALL other contribution amounts (as you wish) simply enter your $$ value in the DONATION AMOUNT by clicking the top pink BACK IT button beside the sharing icons.  We'll prepare your equal value GCs + a bag of twists for every contribution up to $200.  You can pick up at Twisted Lemon (or mail - just let us know)!   If you don't specifically choose a PERK from the list on the right, we'll assume you're purchasing GCs.  Your certificates may be gifted and used for ANY Twisted Lemon service! TL regular GC policy in effect: max $300 per reservation/ table.

 

Flashback to 2004

When we (Chef Dan Megna & Laurie Lilliman) set out on a journey to find a home for our young family and a place to realize our dream.  It was in Cayuga that we found the location and community to start growing our business of quality food and service, and Twisted Lemon Catering was born.   After a few exciting years catering and teaching cooking classes out of our home kitchen, it was time to evolve. We listened when you said you wanted a restaurant.

Nearly a decade ago, Twisted Lemon Restaurant & Flavour Junkies first welcomed you through our doors. Since that exciting day, you’ve welcomed us in to your communities, businesses, homes and celebrations.

 

As we begin our 10th year as a restaurant, and destination location, we can’t think of a better way to celebrate our time together, than by building the patio that you've been asking for and we’ve all been dreaming of!  

 

We’re looking to our communities for support to raise $28,500.00.

 

At this number we will make magic happen.  If we exceed this goal, we have a wish list that will 100% go back in to making your experiences at Twisted Lemon even better!

 

Every funded dollar will go into:

 

1. Building a destination patio.  Enjoy Twisted Lemon’s award-winning creations from the   kitchen and the bar in an idyllic partially covered twenty-seat dining space, just outside our front door.  Sip and savour with your face to the sun, surrounded by flowers and herbs, and gaze into the star-lit sky at dinner. 

2. Renovations.  We’re going to knock down a wall or two, add a door and a couple of windows.  This is not only essential for patio service and access but will allow more natural light in to the restaurant.

3. Chef’s Garden Dining.  After an initial test season in his sustainable garden, Chef Dan’s in-ground cooking and earth-to-table dinners are off to a great start.  This year's plans are to take these remarkable foodie experiences to the next level by adding structural & aesthetic improvements to the outdoor dining and cooking areas.

These initiatives will allow us to continue to grow and provide you with truly unique, exceptional food and drink EXPERIENCES that you will be proud to share with your friends, families and business associates.

 

Why Partner With Us?

We've been walking the walk for over ten years.  Our commitment to supporting and promoting like-minded businesses, services and philosophies in our greater community has earned Twisted Lemon much recognition over the years.   In addition to receiving Haldimand County’s Tourism Award (2017), we were honoured to receive the Ontario’s South West  “Business Innovation Award” in Leamington, Ontario (March 2018).   As a business, it is our welcome responsibility to give back to our community as well as help drive tourism to the beautiful town of Cayuga, Haldimand County and beyond! 

 

When It’s All Happening

 

Renderings are drawn, permits are approved and talented tradespeople are ready to go!  We’ve designed and dreamt, plotted and planned.  Our mini greenhouse already has hundreds of baby seedlings reaching for the sun, just waiting to be planted.  Now, all we need is YOU!  

 

Our Funding Campaign will run for 6 weeks, then we’ll break ground and start construction inside, and out by mid June, with plans to be fully operational on the patio by the first week of July.   Garden Construction begins in May with scheduled Garden Dinners & Events running from July through September.

All rewards, including Gift Certificates, Twist Bag Vouchers and Receipts will be available for pick up during regular business hours at the front desk at Twisted Lemon 48 hours after making your online contribution.  If you prefer to have them mailed,  just let us know. Note that Twisted Lemon is closed on Sundays and Mondays.

 

SPECIAL OPPORTUNITY FOR OUR BUSINESS CONTRIBUTORS

Christmas comes early in Cayuga!  Businesses partnering with us at the $1,000.00 level or higher, will receive 10% off of their food bill when they book their Staff Holiday Season 2018/19 party at Twisted Lemon.  Valid from November 1 2018 - January 31  2019.

*** You'll get all the other stuff too! This is just a little extra bonus from one business to another.***

From all of the Twisted Lemon Family, THANK YOU to EVERYONE who have supported, inspired and dreamed with us for more than a decade, and we look forward to continuing to grow, live & laugh with you for many years to come!

story:
STORY

The Product

We are bringing to you an innovative way to enjoy your favorite spirits. Cloud Buzz shots are pressurized into pre-mixed alcohol mists with almost all of your favourite spirits and served in specially-designed balloons.

To consume, simply inhale the mist from the balloon and receive an instant buzz while also enjoying an aromatic and pleasant experience. A Cloud Buzz shot brings out the true flavour of the drink. Inhaling anything from strawberry vodka or spiced rum to any flavor of gin or whiskey provides an incredible level of flavor enhancement. Imagine the possibilities of experiences.

 

Want to explore something new while you are out in a club or a bar? Cloud Buzz gives you an opportunity to change your entire drinking experience. Imagine inhaling your favourite spirit from a balloon that gives you a buzz straight away.

Features:

  • Brings out the true flavour of the spirit
  • Gives you an instant buzz
  • Brand new experience to try most spirits in the form of a mist.

We need your help to introduce Cloud Buzz to your area. We believe everyone deserves a chance to try Cloud Buzz, SO GET US GOING and help us to bring us to your area!

Cloud Buzz technology has been tested and approved by professionals in the drinks industry, and we see incredible potential in the product as well as the innovation behind it, as we have developed the ONLY transportable alcohol vaporizer that can be used pretty much anywhere - nightclubs, bars, beaches, festivals, house parties and more!

We are looking forward to receiving interest from various regions worldwide, so we can deliver the balloons to the right place at the right time! In order to make that happen, we need your support!

By backing this campaign you will receive a voucher. You will be able to redeem the voucher for your selected perks starting from February 2019 onwards. If you are unable to claim your perk within 12 months of purchase, we will offer a full refund upon request.

Next Steps

Once the crowdfunding campaign has successfully concluded, all backers will receive their vouchers and full details as to where and how they can be redeemed.

Cloud Buzz has a network of highly skilled and fun individuals and promotion agencies who can attend events ranging from bars, clubs, concerts, sporting events, and festivals to private functions. As there is no set up required, once our team members arrive, they’re ready to start serving our special premixed inhalable shots so you can enjoy the party.

We have developed a working machine called the Spirits Mystifier that we are looking forward to bringing to all of you. We are very much looking forward to implement our operations in all the regions that have shown demand!

Technology: Spirit Mystifier

We have developed the ONLY portable spirit vaporizer, that can be used anywhere – nightclub, beach, festival, bar, private party. As you know by now, Cloud Buzz shots offer a pleasant experience of your favourite spirits that you won’t ever forget.

Having spent time developing our prototype machine we were finally ready this year to take it to one of Europe's best event for the alcohol industry. We showcased our Cloud Buzz machine prototype at Imbibe Expo where it was extremely well-received by the industry, including everyone from bar and club owners to event organizers, drinks manufacturers, and drinks distributors. We were hoping to release our first machine in the summer of 2018, but realized that we could make a few improvements, which is why we have delayed until now.

Operations

Cloud Buzz's initial team consists of four creative and enthusiastic members that are capable of bringing the necessary skill-set to achieve the Cloud Buzz vision: to create a fun and entertaining alternative to traditional alcohol consumption that will take the drinks industry by storm.

Having developed international experiences throughout the years, we are capable of launching the product in various regions worldwide. We believe that the key thing that will bring Cloud Buzz to success is our passion for the product we have built. Our team shares the same vision and the same goals, and we are ready to invest our energy and time in getting where we all want to be!

Risks and challenges

We believe it is a great bonus that we already have a well-established business. As a result, we understand the process behind successful product development and delivery and, in turn, all of the possible risks.

To create the Cloud Buzz devices, we have to partially rely on outside suppliers to receive all the required components on time and within a price range to keep the finished product from being too expensive for the user (though not at the expense of quality). We have already gathered a trusty network of suppliers with whom we have worked from the very early stages of the Cloud Buzz project. Still, we are aware that bringing fully functional Cloud Buzz devices to all backers it requires handling orders of a much larger quantity, and we are already in talks with suppliers that could accommodate these requirements. Possible hindrances that we could face are the speed at which we and the supplier can handle these orders and the possibility of some faulty components (which are bound to happen to some degree in orders of such sizes).

Manufacturing

Thus far, we have outsourced production to an engineer with over 30 years of experience in the field. Since this process is handled by professionals, it puts a certain stranglehold on the quantity produced and the production time. With the success of this campaign, we intend to bring this process to mass production, decreasing the production time and of each machine. Our eventual goal will be to have all machines produced in-house at our own purpose built manufacturing facilities.

Disclaimer

There are possible health and safety risks of inhaling alcohol vapor. Inhalation devices make it "substantially easier to overdose on alcohol" than drinking. Absorption through the lungs provides almost instant delivery of the alcohol to the bloodstream and the brain; the effects of the alcohol are felt very quickly. Small amounts of inhaled alcohol may make a person much more drunk than drinking the alcohol instead, and the user does not have a reliable way of determining how much alcohol they have taken in. Inhaled alcohol cannot be purged from the body by vomiting, which is the body's main protection against alcohol poisoning. Inhaled alcohol can dry out nasal passages and make them more susceptible to infection. There is also a potential increased risk of addiction.

NHS alcohol risks

Reference:

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/alcohol-misuse/ri...

You will be able to redeem the voucher for your selected perks starting from February 2019 onwards. If you are unable to claim your perk within 12 months of purchase, we will offer a full refund upon request.Next StepsOnce the crowdfunding campaign has successfully concluded, all backers will receive their vouchers and full details as to where and how they can be redeemed.Cloud Buzz has a network of highly skilled and fun individuals and promotion agencies who can attend events ranging from bars, clubs, concerts, sporting events, and festivals to private functions. As there is no set up required, once our team members arrive, they’re ready to start serving our special premixed inhalable shots so you can enjoy the party.We have developed a working machine called the Spirits Mystifier that we are looking forward to bringing to all of you. We are very much looking forward to implement our operations in all the regions that have shown demand!Technology: Spirit MystifierWe have developed the ONLY portable spirit vaporizer, that can be used anywhere – nightclub, beach, festival, bar, private party. As you know by now, Cloud Buzz shots offer a pleasant experience of your favourite spirits that you won’t ever forget.Having spent time developing our prototype machine we were finally ready this year to take it to one of Europe's best event for the alcohol industry. We showcased our Cloud Buzz machine prototype at Imbibe Expo where it was extremely well-received by the industry, including everyone from bar and club owners to event organizers, drinks manufacturers, and drinks distributors. We were hoping to release our first machine in the summer of 2018, but realized that we could make a few improvements, which is why we have delayed until now.OperationsCloud Buzz's initial team consists of four creative and enthusiastic members that are capable of bringing the necessary skill-set to achieve the Cloud Buzz vision: to create a fun and entertaining alternative to traditional alcohol consumption that will take the drinks industry by storm.Having developed international experiences throughout the years, we are capable of launching the product in various regions worldwide. We believe that the key thing that will bring Cloud Buzz to success is our passion for the product we have built. Our team shares the same vision and the same goals, and we are ready to invest our energy and time in getting where we all want to be!Risks and challengesWe believe it is a great bonus that we already have a well-established business. As a result, we understand the process behind successful product development and delivery and, in turn, all of the possible risks.To create the Cloud Buzz devices, we have to partially rely on outside suppliers to receive all the required components on time and within a price range to keep the finished product from being too expensive for the user (though not at the expense of quality). We have already gathered a trusty network of suppliers with whom we have worked from the very early stages of the Cloud Buzz project. Still, we are aware that bringing fully functional Cloud Buzz devices to all backers it requires handling orders of a much larger quantity, and we are already in talks with suppliers that could accommodate these requirements. Possible hindrances that we could face are the speed at which we and the supplier can handle these orders and the possibility of some faulty components (which are bound to happen to some degree in orders of such sizes).ManufacturingThus far, we have outsourced production to an engineer with over 30 years of experience in the field. Since this process is handled by professionals, it puts a certain stranglehold on the quantity produced and the production time. With the success of this campaign, we intend to bring this process to mass production, decreasing the production time and of each machine. Our eventual goal will be to have all machines produced in-house at our own purpose built manufacturing facilities.DisclaimerThere are possible health and safety risks of inhaling alcohol vapor. Inhalation devices make it "substantially easier to overdose on alcohol" than drinking. Absorption through the lungs provides almost instant delivery of the alcohol to the bloodstream and the brain; the effects of the alcohol are felt very quickly. Small amounts of inhaled alcohol may make a person much more drunk than drinking the alcohol instead, and the user does not have a reliable way of determining how much alcohol they have taken in. Inhaled alcohol cannot be purged from the body by vomiting, which is the body's main protection against alcohol poisoning. Inhaled alcohol can dry out nasal passages and make them more susceptible to infection. There is also a potential increased risk of addiction.NHS alcohol risksReference:https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/alcohol-misuse/ri...

story:
Our Story:      

As passionate juice consumers, we at Local Juice Company have created a product that is exceptional in quality, taste, and appearance. We saw the positive changes happening in the food & beverage industry and wanted to be an integral part of building a healthier new landscape. Authenticity, Fresh Ingredients, and Purity. 

We have enhanced and elevated not only our product, but our entire process, with a focus on consistently delivering a higher quality service. We represent not just a brand, but a lifestyle built on vital nutrients and enzymes essential to physical vitality. For the past five years, we have put all of our passion and commitment into every single bottle we've poured, and the outcome? The best tasting juice on the planet!

Our products immediately gravitated to the health-conscious consumers and businesses. In our early days, Local Juice Company did everything to grow our grass roots base and create a whirlwind of positive buzz in the juice world. We focused on quality (organic produce, cold-pressed nutrients, glass bottles, no processing) and we have never wavered from that. It's who we are; it's in the fabric of our integrity.

In 2016, we ended up in the clubhouse for The San Diego Padres, and the rest of the story began taking on a great new meaning. In a short period of time, players, coaches, and owners were raving about this product. We’ve developed a Performance Nutrition Service that’s focused on aiding professional athletes in hydration, nutrition, recovery, and weight management. More players and more teams became interested.  

Here we are today, with our base in Southern California growing strong. We're ready to show the rest of the world who we are, what we do, and how we do it.
 

Our Team:

Justin Gittelman (Founder) – My first passion, as an executive coach in organization development, kept me busy for 15 years. In 2007, I opened my first corporate development company and used the profits to invest in my long term potential. The idea behind starting my next endeavor, Local Juice Company, was to create a product that would inspire me, as well as its consumers. After a lot of hard work, I feel fortunate to be realizing my dream.

JJ Cooney (Partner) - After spending 20+ years in IT sales, I realized that your career should be more than just your income.  I wanted to be a part of a company that was giving back and nourishing their customers’ well being.   In 2016, Justin and I began our partnership and started looking at national expansion.  For the past three years, my passion, and energy for our juice and its benefits have changed my life, and I’m excited to help change the lives of so many more.

Our Mission:

With our campaign, we are raising funds to open up our next two regions in Southern California and Northern Virginia. Our goals of expansion within Major League Baseball continue in the form of partnering with the Los Angeles Dodgers, Anaheim Angels, Arizona Diamondbacks, Philadelphia Phillies, Baltimore Orioles, and Washington Nationals.   Along with our desire to expand our partnership with Major League Baseball, other professional sports organizations and collegiate athletics, we are excited and focused on growing our home/business customer base within these local communities. 

Our mission is create a culture around corporate social responsibility (Corporate Good) with a focus amongst our employees, customers, and our communities we serve, on giving back and raising awareness on the importance of nutrition and an overall healthy well being. Whether it's working with local organizations, helping our veterans return to the workforce, or partnering with our local schools and youth sports programs.  We're finding creative ways to "spread the juice" here in San Diego and Southern California.

Customer Inspiration has become a hallmark of why we do, what we do!

We are honored and humbled that you are joining us on this exciting and game changing journey.

Thank you so very much for your support,

Local Juice Company

story:
Our Story

Our Story truly begins with you. Because Love Muffin was created with the belief that when we connect talented youth to both technical and interpersonal skills, not only do we build a formidable workforce, we help rebuild communities long overlooked due to food and employment desserts. 

The food service industry has been the beginning place for many unplanned hospitality professionals throughout the years. The best journeys begin with proper training and a job. As young adults’ transition, they remember who trained them and who gave them a job. We expect our students not only to remember the training and job placement but the community that cared enough to financially support the program.

Our goal is to create a pipeline of talent for restaurants, bars, and other businesses. Team members graduate with industry certifications and emotional intelligence training, uniquely positioning them as a valuable asset to any business.

So How Do We Do It

Our students are provided with a curriculum that earns them their national food handlers license, food managers license, customer service license, and a CPR certificate, along with job placement upon completion of the program. The hands-on training is conducted at Culture Coffee Too (CCT).  Through our partnership with CCT each Love Muffin team member not only learns the day-to-day operations of CCT, but they received barista training experience. One of DC's most vibrant and community engaging coffeehouses, CCT serves as a vital anchor of bringing delicious coffee and diversity to Washington, DC.

 

Through your support, we are able to cement our foundation with helping move forward the lives of so many talented young adults who have a passion to serve their communities.
Providing on-demand continental breakfast inclusive of baked pastries, muffins, coffee, juices and teas, all of Love Muffin's items come made fresh daily and locally. On-site concierge service is also available for those seeking a more personal touch.

Targeting areas with prominent food and employment deserts, we provide a holistic approach to supporting our employees, through wrap-around social services ranging from housing to mental health support.

Through private-public partnership agreements with local employment services, Love Muffin will partner with young adults looking to level up.

 

Who We Serve

Love Muffin serves local businesses, government agencies, non-profit organizations and small business owners in  Washington, DC.

You can experience a wonderful muffin and a delicious cup of coffee 7 days a week at Culture Coffee Too. This coffee shop provides a warm environment for everyone to engage in community activities while helping a young adult to learn and earn. Meaning, learn a skill set in the hospitality industry and earn wages that will make a difference in their lives

We Thank You for your support, contributions and overall LOVE as we help bring the best luxury ​continental breakfast to an office near you. Don't want to wait, stop by Culture Coffee Too anytime to meet our amazing team members and to try out our fresh baked goods and premium coffee.

Our Concierge Team reflects the love, dedication, and pride we have for food, our community and each other. Together we make a difference in our community, one love muffin and one cup of coffee at a time.

 

    How You Can Support

    Fundraising Goal of $50,000

    Assist Love Muffin with expanding their impact:

    Funds raised will go towards:

    Training & Certifications 

    Food Safety Handlers License

    Customer Service Certificate

    CPR Certifications 

    Training Facilitators 

    Uniforms

     

    SPONSOR OPPORTUNITIES

    Love Muffin Team Players

    Donation of $50

    • Receive a 'Thank You' email

    Love Muffin Cheerleader Sponsor

    Donation of $100 

    • Receive a 'Thank You' Email 
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • 1 Love Muffing Breakfast Voucher

    Love Muffin Friends Sponsor

    Donation of $500 

    • Receive a 'Thank You' Email 
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • One Continental Breakfast for a group of 5

    Love Muffin Biggest Fan Sponsor

    Donation of $1000

    • Receive a 'Thank You' email
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • 1 White Glove Continental Breakfast Service for Group of 10 or less
    • 1 Love Muffin Pin

    Love Muffin Partner Sponsor

    Donation of $2,500

    • Receive a 'Thank You' email
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • 1 White Glove Continental Breakfast Service for Group of 15 or Less
    • 1 Love Muffin Pin

    Love Muffin Community Partner Sponsor

    Donation of $5,000

    • Receive a 'Thank You' email
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • 1 White Glove Continental Breakfast Service for Group of 20 or Less
    • 1 Love Muffin Pin
    • Custom Coffee Brew
    • Your company logo printed on napkins

    Love Muffin Corporate Partner Sponsor

    Donation of $10,000

    • Receive a 'Thank You' email
    • Love Muffin Shirt
    • 1 White Glove Continental Breakfast Service and Boxed Lunch for Group of 20 or Less
    • 1 Love Muffin Pin
    • Custom Coffee Brew
    • Logo on Love Muffin website for one year

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't make a donation, no problem! You can still help us get the word out by sharing our campaign and following us on Instagram @DC_Love_Muffins to stay up to date.

    Thank you in advance for helping DC Love Muffin serve Love & Purpose through Food to our Washington, DC community.

    Order your Luxury Continental Breakfast

    Pre-Orders going Live on January 1, 2019

    Price Listing

    • $5 per Person: Continental Breakfast (Muffins and Pastries)
    • $1.75 per Person: Drip Coffee
    • $2 per Person: French Pressed  
    • $2 per Person: Assorted Fruit
    • $15 Delivery Fee
    • $25 per Hour White Glove Service - On-site Love Muffin Team Member

    Love in Action

    Our Young Adults in Action Connecting Food with Love

     

     

     

     

     

    Friends in Action

    Grateful for our Friends in Action  showing their support for Connecting Food with Love

     

     


     

     

    Our Partners 

    Snapshot of Public-Private Partnerships

    Love Muffin is honored to have partnered with a number of amazing public and private organizations to help make our vision of creating a dynamic hiring pipeline into the culinary and hospitality industries from food and employment desert communities a reality.

story:
The "Mead"-Cute

Matt Loch moved to Nashville with a dream - to brew amazing meads using local honey.  He was still a hobby-brewer, making two gallons at a time since his college days.  After asking around, he was pointed in the direction of Ross Welbon - professional beer brewer with a penchant for beekeeping.  Matt jumped straight to the chase and asked to buy some of Ross's honey - and Ross refused!  The honey was a gift so long as they could brew together - and the seed of the Honeytree was planted!  Two years and many more gallons of honey later, Matt and Ross are ready to open their doors!

What We Need & What You Get

We're nearly done with the production facility and ready to start producing!  However, that's only half the story - we need your help to build out the taproom!

Proceeds from this kickstarter will go to:

  • Building a fantastic bar top!
  • Putting in a truly unique floor!
  • Buying seating and tables from local craftsfolk!
  • Cleaning up the outside of the building including (but not limited) to an awning, sign, and jaw-dropping mural!

What we're offering:

The Impact

Without the bees, there is no honey to make mead.  Honeytree Meadery is committed to environmental stewardship through ecologically balanced business practices.  We will accomplish this goal through spurring growth in local apiaries through adding value to an existing agricultural product, and introducing ways to meet the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to do the same.

Your support will push us ahead towards this lofty goal!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge has been (and will continue to be) introducing people to mead.  It had fallen out of vogue and is only recently beginning to come back.  There's currently no other meadery producing in Nashville, so a lot of our time is going to be spent talking about mead in general.  Can't tell you how many of y'all have thought we were opening up a butchershop (i.e. 'meat-ery') along the way.  However, we're more than up for the challenge!

  • We've already been hard at work having tasting events at bars, restaurants, beekeeping meetings, and other events
  • We currently have over a dozen presale accounts - folks excited to serve our mead and support the bees!
  • We've also been using social media and platforms (like this one) to help promote the product and what it means to sip the nectar of the gods!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute - you can still help!

  • Like, share, tweet, post, and spread the word!
  • Ask for mead at your favorite bar or restauraunt!
  • Hug a bee! (or better yet, a beekeeper!)

And that's all there is to it.
