story:
Meet the Maker

Heyyy.... My name is Amber, I like to tell people that I am the cake designer of your wildest dreams! I started baking cakes 6 years ago for a non-profit called "Birthday Cakes 4 Free" I would bake and deliver cakes to children and seniors who could not afford a cake on their special day. It was a way for me to include my family in giving back to our community.  To let them feel in their hearts the love and joy they could give someone less fortunate than them.  It started as a passion project, that turned into what I know I'm meant to be doing. Bringing joy into the lives of many by providing one of a kind custom designed cakes, with the best ingredients, a little bit of my heart and soul, and a whole lotta love.

I am a Veteran of the United States Air Force. My service taught me that we are stronger together than by ourselves.  Along with Birthday Cakes 4 Free, I donate cakes to Military families. I know how hard it is transitioning back into civilian society and I will do everything in my power to continue helping our large Veteran community.

A Few Things You should Know

Sift and Gather was brought to life with the idea that when you gather and surround yourself with like minded people, only great things can happen. Add in the cake, and it's bound to be an unforgettable experience that you remember forever. This campaign is being crafted with good intentions. Allowing me to represent something I am so sooooo passionate about.  I want to be that person, whose place you come to for positive vibes that brings the community together. Whether it be workshops, cake tutorials, networking events, drinking margaritas, or just eating cake! Creating cakes, that create moments, that's what I do. Allowing people to gather together in happiness and love, all while looking at a piece of art that you can also EAT!  Starting a business is a roller coaster... What started off as an idea with a budget, grew into a magical unicorn that needs a way bigger budget. And that is why I need your help. The community of Olympia has been great to me. I have done my best to return the love and want to continue the best way I know how, CAKE. 

I provide happiness, and nostalgia, along with new memories through the celebrations that happen gathered around  my cakes. After all, cake always helps make these moments just a little bit sweeter! Another special part of making cakes is enjoying it with my 7yr old son Levi, who was suddenly diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes 9 months ago. My menu will have a focus on exact and easily accessible ingredients and carbohydrate ratios. Diabetes affects millions of people, there is no cure, and it is a life long disease that is centered around food. Diabetics are not able to sit down and eat whenever they feel like it, and my heart breaks every day for my son and all the others affected by Type 1 Diabetes. I want my son and all diabetics to be able to know how many carbohydrates are in their food, so they can enjoy it whenever and wherever, just like you and me.  Sift and Gather is that special place for a Type 1 Diabetic! #levistrong There will be menu items at Sift and Gather where proceeds will go to helping find a cure for Type 1 Diabetes every single day. It's time to find a cure, and you can be a part of that.

The Space

With your help, I will be able to finish this project and it will be 100% self sufficient. 299 square feet of modern marble counter tops, concrete floors, gorgeous lighting, and a farmers market like atmosphere. All located in the heart of downtown Olympia inside an artisan gathering place, the 222 Market Place!  Initially we thought the place was move in ready, with the exception of me having to put in the oven and share the three compartment sink and a dishwasher.  Then I found out I will need my own and in order to get it I need to make some major cosmetic renovations. This also includes an architect which was not in my budget. As a new business owner my budget is spandex tight and these additions and upgrades have to be done. I have built a great following and an anticipation for my opening through donating cakes, as well as collaborating with people from Olympia, all the way to Idaho.  The business is there and I am ready to soar.  I want it so bad I can taste it and the only thing sweeter than it's success will be my cakes.

What is Needed

  • Architect $1500.00+
  • Oven $6000.00
  • Renovation to fit the oven in the space $1000.00+
  • Dish washer and 3 compartment sink: This includes electrical work that needs to be updated for the equipment. Cutting the marble countertop to fit the three compartment sink. $1000.00+
  • Under counter Refrigerator x2 $2800.00
  • Initial startup materials such as ingredients, packaging, and other unexpected expenses $1500.00
  • Health Department $2000.00

All of the funding from this campaign will go to ensuring the space it ready to shake n' bake the minute the Health Department gives their stamp of approval.

Sift and Gather isn't the typical bakery you picture in your head. It's a creative space that will allow all those who come in contact with it to be happy and ohhhh so inspired. Not just because the cakes are amazing, but because it's a space that will motivate others to push the industry limits, find a guy/girl gang and collaborate with each other, and always stay learning. My purpose in this space is to lead by example, to show you and all that stop by, that you are irreplaceable at your craft, unique in your own way, and worthy of greatness.

Things to look forward to at Sift and Gather

Workshops

  • Buttercream + Booze
  • Pinterest + Margaritas
  • Calligraphy + Cake

Styled photoshoots

  • Collaborations with other local vendors to create magical moments on camera for web/social media content.

Styled gatherings

  • Sit around a gorgeous styled dinner table and enjoy the company of other like minded creatives.

Internships

  • Create a program for young entrepreneurs in the greater Olympia area to learn the skills needed to be a successful cake designer.

Networking Events

  • Meetings/gatherings
  • Vendor meetups
  • Collaborations

Giving back to the community

  • Birthday Cakes 4 Free Olympia Chapter
  • Donated cakes to organizations to raise money for other local charities
  • Cake Auctions: Highest bidder gets a gorgeous cake and they decide where their money goes.

The cakes I create, are not just cakes. They are an important part of the story... Whether it's to celebrate grandmas 100th birthday, to welcome a new sweet addition to the family, to honor someones legacy, the milestone of a church baptism, or the beginning of a new chapter with the love of your life. I will be there to create something memorable and equally delicious. Let me be an integral part of your journey, by creating something you'll remember forever.

My cakes, and your moments have been published & featured on the most influential wedding blogs and magazines seen around the world.

  • Green Wedding Shoes
  • June Bug Wedding
  • Wed in the Wild
  • 100 Layer Cake
  • Bride and Tonic
  • Wedventure Magazine
  • Apple Brides Magazine
  • Aisle Society and many more...

Thank you

Your love and support throughout this magical cake journey has already been amazing! I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for believing in me, encouraging me, and loving me. This space is just the beginning for Sift and Gather, and I cannot wait to continue our journey together and make cake dreams come true all over the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to invest at this time, that's okay!! You can still spread the word about your favorite cake maker & her dopeAF cake studio in downtown Olympia! Share my campaign link, share pictures of my cakes, comment on my posts, or just stop by the studio and say HELLO!!
story_txt:
Meet the Maker
Heyyy.... My name is Amber, I like to tell people that I am the cake designer of your wildest dreams! I started baking cakes 6 years ago for a non-profit called "Birthday Cakes 4 Free" I would bake and deliver cakes to children and seniors who could not afford a cake on their special day. It was a way for me to include my family in giving back to our community.  To let them feel in their hearts the love and joy they could give someone less fortunate than them.  It started as a passion project, that turned into what I know I'm meant to be doing. Bringing joy into the lives of many by providing one of a kind custom designed cakes, with the best ingredients, a little bit of my heart and soul, and a whole lotta love.
I am a Veteran of the United States Air Force. My service taught me that we are stronger together than by ourselves.  Along with Birthday Cakes 4 Free, I donate cakes to Military families. I know how hard it is transitioning back into civilian society and I will do everything in my power to continue helping our large Veteran community.

A Few Things You should Know
Sift and Gather was brought to life with the idea that when you gather and surround yourself with like minded people, only great things can happen. Add in the cake, and it's bound to be an unforgettable experience that you remember forever. This campaign is being crafted with good intentions. Allowing me to represent something I am so sooooo passionate about.  I want to be that person, whose place you come to for positive vibes that brings the community together. Whether it be workshops, cake tutorials, networking events, drinking margaritas, or just eating cake! Creating cakes, that create moments, that's what I do. Allowing people to gather together in happiness and love, all while looking at a piece of art that you can also EAT!  Starting a business is a roller coaster... What started off as an idea with a budget, grew into a magical unicorn that needs a way bigger budget. And that is why I need your help. The community of Olympia has been great to me. I have done my best to return the love and want to continue the best way I know how, CAKE. 
I provide happiness, and nostalgia, along with new memories through the celebrations that happen gathered around  my cakes. After all, cake always helps make these moments just a little bit sweeter! Another special part of making cakes is enjoying it with my 7yr old son Levi, who was suddenly diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes 9 months ago. My menu will have a focus on exact and easily accessible ingredients and carbohydrate ratios. Diabetes affects millions of people, there is no cure, and it is a life long disease that is centered around food. Diabetics are not able to sit down and eat whenever they feel like it, and my heart breaks every day for my son and all the others affected by Type 1 Diabetes. I want my son and all diabetics to be able to know how many carbohydrates are in their food, so they can enjoy it whenever and wherever, just like you and me.  Sift and Gather is that special place for a Type 1 Diabetic! #levistrong There will be menu items at Sift and Gather where proceeds will go to helping find a cure for Type 1 Diabetes every single day. It's time to find a cure, and you can be a part of that.

The Space
With your help, I will be able to finish this project and it will be 100% self sufficient. 299 square feet of modern marble counter tops, concrete floors, gorgeous lighting, and a farmers market like atmosphere. All located in the heart of downtown Olympia inside an artisan gathering place, the 222 Market Place!  Initially we thought the place was move in ready, with the exception of me having to put in the oven and share the three compartment sink and a dishwasher.  Then I found out I will need my own and in order to get it I need to make some major cosmetic renovations. This also includes an architect which was not in my budget. As a new business owner my budget is spandex tight and these additions and upgrades have to be done. I have built a great following and an anticipation for my opening through donating cakes, as well as collaborating with people from Olympia, all the way to Idaho.  The business is there and I am ready to soar.  I want it so bad I can taste it and the only thing sweeter than it's success will be my cakes.

Architect $1500.00+
Oven $6000.00
Renovation to fit the oven in the space $1000.00+
Dish washer and 3 compartment sink: This includes electrical work that needs to be updated for the equipment. Cutting the marble countertop to fit the three compartment sink. $1000.00+
Under counter Refrigerator x2 $2800.00
Initial startup materials such as ingredients, packaging, and other unexpected expenses $1500.00
Health Department $2000.00

All of the funding from this campaign will go to ensuring the space it ready to shake n' bake the minute the Health Department gives their stamp of approval.

Sift and Gather isn't the typical bakery you picture in your head. It's a creative space that will allow all those who come in contact with it to be happy and ohhhh so inspired. Not just because the cakes are amazing, but because it's a space that will motivate others to push the industry limits, find a guy/girl gang and collaborate with each other, and always stay learning. My purpose in this space is to lead by example, to show you and all that stop by, that you are irreplaceable at your craft, unique in your own way, and worthy of greatness.

story:
Welcome

Hello and welcome to our Indiegogo fundraiser. We are Laura and Ruairi and we own a BBQ sauce and BBQ dry rubs manufacturing company called Great Northern Larder. We are based in Dundalk, which is a former industrial and railway town just north of Dublin in Ireland. We both have backgrounds in retail and business, and we have been making and sell our sauces in shops and supermarkets for over 3 years now.

We are both deeply passionate about BBQ and we have spent the last few years cooking over wood almost daily to perfect BBQ techniques and flavours from the USA, Germany, Portugal, South America, and South Africa. We have combined this learning with a deep knowledge of local Irish meats and ingredients. We now want to bring proper low and slow wood smoked BBQ to Ireland. We intend to build a BBQ joint from an upcycled shipping container and to commission bespoke offset smokers (barbecues) from Smokin Soul in Co. Wexford. Then we will serve freshly cooked pork, beef, chicken, lamb, fish, and vegetables from our BBQ joint every weekend.

Laura is the founder of Great Northern Larder and a passionate lover of BBQ. Like many great food pioneers Laura is a pharmacist by trade and loves the science behind food and fire.

The Great Northern Larder BBQ Joint will be a community focused project. We will buy all our meat and ingredients from local producers and we will showcase the best Irish food and ingredients. We will teach people how to BBQ, we will support local communities, we will promote local businesses, and we will contribute enormously to BBQ culture in Ireland. But we need your help. Traditional sources of funding are hard to raise during the current recession and traditional banks do not understand the concepts behind BBQ. They cannot think past fish and chips. We need a better way of funding the BBQ Joint. We need you to help. We need you to be part of the BBQ revolution in Ireland.

Our signature sandwich is marjoram rubbed pork neck smoked over local silver birch and served on a bed of homemade sauerkraut and homemade Belfast style "vita" rye bread. Served with brown sauce and mustard with a garnish of pickles.

How it Works

We need approximately €40,000 to build a high-quality BBQ Joint. The smokers alone cost €10,000 and there are lots of legal and regulatory issues. The container is coming in at about €20,000 including fixtures and fittings. Then finally we need site works and drainage. We have raised about €20,000 so far from our own funds and we need your help to raise the rest. But we are not looking for a freebie. We want to give you something in return.

We have some unique perks for you. You can throw us a small few bob in return for your name on the wall of fame, but for a little extra you can grab some really exiting merchandise and vouchers. We have really cool Great Northern Larder socks from the Irish Sock Society, we have premium fitted t-shirts, and we have a lovely swag bag for 2. We also have vouchers for meals in the new BBQ joint, and if it turns out you can’t make it you can spend them all on our sauce and condiments website instead. So you can’t lose. One incredibly special perk you might like is our BBQ training session. With a maximum of 6 attendees and a trainer who is a qualified instructor and expert BBQ chef this is an opportunity not to be missed. You even get to eat everything you cook!

This Peking Duck is a Great Northern Larder specialty. It takes 2 days to make and the colour is exactly as you see it - no filters used here!

We are hoping to raise €25k which will give us enough money to cover costs and bring the BBQ Joint to life. If we don’t make it, we will bank the money safely and continue to raise capital elsewhere until we can make our dream a reality. Your perks will be delivered no matter what – merch will be posted, BBQ lessons will go ahead (you will have loads of dates options), and vouchers will be honoured at greatnorthernlarder.com or can be held onto for when we do get up and running. But anyway, that will not be an issue, as we know you will support us and make this happen! Thank you!

What is the Traffic Light all About?

Up until now the way BBQ restaurants work in Ireland is that the food is cooked in ovens overnight and then kept warm all day until you place your order. Sometimes they even use microwaves. This is not how BBQ should work, and for purists like us it is sacrilege. We only cook over wood and when the meat is ready it is ready. That might take 10 hours, or it might take 14. It is then rested for a couple of hours before it is at its most juicy, tender, and flavoursome. Every cut of meat is different every cut of wood is different, and every day is different due to wind and weather.

A platter of baby back ribs, pork belly, and beef ribs coated in our Scotch BBQ sauce. This photo was taken by an amateur on a mobile phone - and it still looks juicy enough to eat off your screen - imagine it in real life!

So how do we perfectly serve meat when and only when it is ready to eat? We do what real BBQ pit masters insist on doing across the southern states of the USA. We open when it is ready, and we close when it is all eaten and gone. But we don’t want people hopping in their car to drive to us and find we are sold out, so we will have an online reservation system where you can put your name on your meat in advance. We then have the traffic lights.

Red means we are closed. No meat for sale, nothing to see here, call back later.

We went a little Northern Irish with red and amber on together which means we are about to change to green. Hang around, it won’t be long now. Your meat is resting and almost ready to serve.

Green means we are open and serving. Come in, order some brisket or baby back ribs, take a seat, listen to the music, enjoy life for a while.

Amber means last orders. Sometimes in BBQ these are the nest bits – they have been rested the longest and the server is usually eager to get home so you 200g of beef can easily become 250g.

But wait, I said this saves you a drive? How do I see the traffic lights from my home? We thought of that – with a little magic we will make sure that the colour of the lights is reflected across all our social media and online presence.

The Great Northern Larder Paradise BBQ Bus

A couple of years ago forest fires decimated Paradise in California. The city was a blackened char with almost everything burnt to the ground. If you look closely on Google satellite images from after the fire you can see a tiny patch of green – a spec in the middle of the devastation. This was the garden of a Volkswagen loving BBQ enthusiast. For reasons known only to the universe his garden and his VW bus were the only part of Paradise that was not taken. Unfortunately, he did lose his house but like most of the residents he was safely evacuated.

The BBQ Bus is a 1971 "micro-bus" which was the 70s equivalent of a modern SUV. Note the melted indicator on the right hand side and the laminate (plastic) on the windscreen has also melted.

Great Northern Larder had been on the lookout for a BBQ bus when we got a call telling us that there was a fire damaged bus available for sale in America. We exchanged photos and quickly realised this wasn’t an engine fire - it was something much more interesting. The fire had not damaged the bodywork at all, but it has melted the windows, the lights, and the dashboard. This machine was rad looking and just screamed BBQ bus. We imported it and right now it is being gently restored and converted by a company called Retro Food Trucks in County Meath.

Although the BBQ Joint is a shipping container and technically mobile, the BBQ bus will allow us to move a little faster. We will be able to do off-site BBQs, promotions, and events. None of your money is required for the BBQ Bus – it is paid for already, but we thought it was important to mention as it will be a valuable contributor to the success of this project.

Why is this a Good Investment?

By helping us you are supporting a small Irish business and the jobs it provides. You are helping to bring real BBQ to Ireland. You are supporting one of the most unique food ideas we have seen on this island in a long time. Probably the best reason to support this BBQ joint is so as you can eat there!

Our range of sauces - when you back this project remember that we are already well established in the food industry and we are putting our own reputation and money on the line in an big way.

Laura and Ruairi have a good track record in the food industry. We have a large range of products that are for sale in the likes of Avoca and the big supermarkets. We have collaborated with many local businesses on e-commerce projects, menu designs, and product development. Last year we competed in the KCBS Irish barbecue championships and managed to come 2nd out of the Irish teams.

How Can I Help?

We need your financial support, but if you can’t do that then please help us by sharing this fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages. Send it to your local BBQ friends. Email it to your rich uncle. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My coffee shop, Kamilah's Koffee, will offer the best quality coffee at affordable pricing for any class of customer that walks in the doors. We will work closely will local roasters to supply our coffee so that we can bring a sense of community to our shop. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking a total investment of up to $100,000. These funds will be entirely used to:

  • Purchasing a fixture that will be converted into a drive-thru/walk-up coffee shop with optional deck seating. This would also include the land purchase, permits, etc.
  • Equipment - everything from espresso machines and grinders, to cleaning supplies and floormats
  • Beginning inventory - mainly ingredients such as wholesale coffee, milk & milk alternatives, syrups, etc.
  • Working capital - enough to leave a buffer for unexpected expenses that may come up in the first few months of operation
  • Payroll

The Impact

I want to bring a sense of community to my town and I plan to do this by working with local roasters and suppliers to enforce this idea. I, Jasmine, the Owner, have an exclusive history working in retail and customer service, totaling about 7 years experience. Since the day I started drinking coffee I have wanted to own my own coffee shop. When I moved up to Vancouver, WA in 2016 I started to pursue a business degree because I knew opening my coffee shop was the ultimate goal for me. I offer a great insight to customer service, sales and building a lasting rapport with customers and building trust for lasting relationships. We will be able to build a great team of reliable, hard-working and trustworthy team members who can help in creating personable lasting relationships with our customers - on top of serving delicious coffee.

Risks & Challenges

I plan to put in all of my blood, sweat and tears into this business. Quitting my 9-5 job where I have a reliable income stream is risky in itself, but I fully intend to invest every minute of my time working at the shop to ensure things are running smoothly. The biggest challenge I anticipate facing is staffing - with COVID, it's hard to find people willing to work long hours and I will need at least 1 other person to be in it for the long run with me. Financially, I have a plan to make sure we can stay in business regardless of economic crises.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that is OKAY. It would be just as helpful if you could please spread the word and share this campaign with everyone you know! :) Thank you in advance.

Payroll


The Impact
I want to bring a sense of community to my town and I plan to do this by working with local roasters and suppliers to enforce this idea. I, Jasmine, the Owner, have an exclusive history working in retail and customer service, totaling about 7 years experience. Since the day I started drinking coffee I have wanted to own my own coffee shop. When I moved up to Vancouver, WA in 2016 I started to pursue a business degree because I knew opening my coffee shop was the ultimate goal for me. I offer a great insight to customer service, sales and building a lasting rapport with customers and building trust for lasting relationships. We will be able to build a great team of reliable, hard-working and trustworthy team members who can help in creating personable lasting relationships with our customers - on top of serving delicious coffee.

Risks & Challenges
I plan to put in all of my blood, sweat and tears into this business. Quitting my 9-5 job where I have a reliable income stream is risky in itself, but I fully intend to invest every minute of my time working at the shop to ensure things are running smoothly. The biggest challenge I anticipate facing is staffing - with COVID, it's hard to find people willing to work long hours and I will need at least 1 other person to be in it for the long run with me. Financially, I have a plan to make sure we can stay in business regardless of economic crises.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, that is OKAY. It would be just as helpful if you could please spread the word and share this campaign with everyone you know! :) Thank you in advance.

story:
Short Summary

Ricardo's story

I was born in Tucson, AZ, and I used to help my grandfather at fairs and such when I was a young buck and he would give me cash to play on some rides or games! As I got older, I noticed that it was hard to find churros made fresh and saw the potential we had immediately. I shared these feelings with my dad, and we got to work. My passion and motivation comes from the urge to continue my family tradition and to share fresh churros with the world!

About Just Churros:

Take a grandfather’s one-of-a-kind authentic churro recipe. Add a father’s legacy of passion and hard work. Blend in a grandson’s dedication and service. Sprinkle with just the right amount of cinnamon and the result is churros that are out of this world. That is how reviewers describe Just Churros: “out of this world fresh,” “absolutely the best churros on the planet. Mind blowing,” and “cinnamon heavenly goodness.”

As some might know I started Just Churros with my Dad August of 2012 with a dream to continue this legacy in our family alive for generations to come. He passed away October of 2019 due to a rare cancer called Neuroendocrine with many plans for this business. This was devastating news, both to the family and Just Churros. Our faith keeps us strong and even though it was our loss, it was heavens gain! (I love you and miss you Dad, thank you for all the life lessons you taught me)

This campaign is important to me because as the 3rd generation churro maker in the family, I feel a responsibility to keep this legacy alive for my children and community of churro fans!

I am currently raising $30,000 for a new food truck designed specifically how we need it to be able to run things more efficient and safe so we can get around town with less worry and to better keep up with the demand at high traffic events. For every 22 dollars contributed, you can choose a perk for 2 dozens on your next visit to the current food truck in Tucson, AZ! You can also choose from Just Churros merch as well! If I don't reach the entire goal I will save the funds till I reach my current goal! I would like to keep this campaign open as long as it seems beneficial to my churro fans!

Thank you so much for the love and support as we bring fresh back to the word churro! 
justchurrostucson.com

PLEASE SHARE

story:
Introduction

Hello, my name is Zohair Bajwa. I was born and raised in Lahore, Pakistan, and have been in Missoula since 2006. My friends and family will all tell you how much I enjoy sharing my culture through food – sharing the distinct tastes and smells of home with the people I love. Because of this, I have decided to embark on a new, exciting, and delicious endeavor – bringing the tastes of authentic Pakistani food to the Missoula community.

 

I hope to bring Lahore’s authentic street food to the streets of Missoula and the surrounding area. My wife Megan and I are looking into securing a food trailer in which to prepare and serve up some delicious Pakistani food to tantalize your taste buds and keep you coming back for more. This is where your support and generosity comes in, and please allow me to thank you up front.

 

Community and Food

 

Ever since I came to Missoula in 2006 as a student at the University of Montana, there has always been something missing for me – good curries, and, more specifically, Pakistani food.

 

I was deeply honored to have the chance to cook for my community through the United We Eat (“UWE”) program through Soft Landing Missoula last year. It was such a humbling experience – to see the excitement the Missoula community displayed for authentic Pakistani food. We ended up selling out 150 meals!

https://bit.ly/2YY7Y25

 

I plan to bring the same love and passion to my food trailer as I did for the UWE program, and you can expect no compromises when it comes to using authentic spices and recipes, resulting in a whole new world of flavors for you to enjoy.

 

Eventually, once we are up and running and have firm footing in the Missoula food scene, we plan to give back to our Missoula neighbors, either by specials or discounted/free meals for various ones in the community.

 

What Foods to Expect

 

Megan and I have had several conversations about a menu we believe would best bring the tastes of Lahore to the people of Missoula. During our trip home earlier this year, we explored different flavors that we think would work best to introduce to our community here. We will initially be serving:

 

Chicken Karahi: traditionally cooked in a wok with tomatoes and spices, simmered to a thick sauce. Served best with naan and kachumar* (keto-friendly)

Daal: orange lentils perfectly cooked to a stew-like consistency. Prepared with spices and served best over rice or naan (vegan, vegetarian friendly)

Samosa: everyone knows about these delicious, fried concoctions!

Paratha Rolls: a traditional grab-and-go street food from Pakistan. Chicken or vegetables cooked in spices, mixed with kachumar*, mint and tamarind chutneys, wrapped in a crispy paratha (fry bread).

Shakar Qandi: My wife’s favorite snack in Lahore! Sweet potato mixed with freshly squeezed orange and spices. Traditionally served over newspaper (we won’t be doing that here, obviously – hello health code violation), and toothpicks.

*Kachumar: sliced raw onions, raw tomatoes mixed with fresh lemon/lime juice, cilantro, salt and black pepper. A perfect accompaniment to any of the above-listed meals.

Chutneys: Spicy mint chutney and a sweet and tangy tamarind chutney.

 

What You Get for Helping Fund This Project

 

Besides having a local spot where you can try the delicious tastes of traditional and authentic Pakistani food, adding to Missoula’s food and cultural diversity, you can expect the listed rewards.

For any donations received from outside of Missoula area and if you cannot visit us when we're open, we will do our best to get your T-shirts mailed to you as soon we are able to. Also, if and when you're in Missoula, please come say hi and we will take care of you the only way we know- Pakistani hospitality style. For catering donations, we can certainly schedule a date where you will be in Missoula and would like to take advantage of that perk.

 

Risks and Challenges

 

Obviously, there is always a risk of failure, and to be honest, that risk is part of the reason why I have shied away from this endeavor until now. But I believe now is the time to make my dream a reality – now is the time for Missoula to experience authentic Pakistani food that is rich in flavor, made with love, and warms the soul.

 

During these extraordinary times in which we find ourselves, I understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially to this project. However, I would be very thankful for your support, encouragement, and patronage when we do open. I hope the people of Missoula are as excited as Megan and I are for this project, and I hope you will show your support by opening your hearts and your wallets to make this a success and help us add something new to your dining options!

story:
As we near our first official year as the owners of Skipper’s Brew Coffee House, Karen and I have some very exciting news we want to share.   We are in the process of looking for a 2nd location to spread the Skipper’s Brew love to another local community.  This means there could be a Skipper’s Brew even closer to you! 

In just one short & crazy year, Karen and I managed to build a small yet mighty community filled with so much love here in Morro Bay, CA.  If 2020 has shown us anything, it’s that it absolutely takes a village.  Because of you, our community and family/friends, we made it through our first year with only a few hiccups (darn that COVID-19) along the way. 

It’s because of our community, our common passion for coffee, dogs and people, and our desire to share our passion with others, that we have all of the confidence in the world that our 2nd location with be an absolute success. 

We have created this IndieGoGo campaign because we want and need your help to make this happen.  So, how can you help, you ask?   

This is where you come in.  We have our own funds to make most of this venture happen, but we still need help.  Based on the donation amount, we have a variety of amazing perks for you to choose from.

If you could support our IndieGoGo campaign by making a donation and then sharing it with your network, we would greatly appreciate it. We know that money can be tight, so please know that even $5 helps us get closer to our goal!

Let us know if you have any questions.  Karen and I can’t thank you enough for your continued love and support of Skipper’s Brew. We can’t wait to share our passion with more communities.

Cheers,

Shari & Karen (& Olive)

story:
From the company that revolutionized cooking with the first at-home sous vide, the original SousVide Supreme, comes the next chapter in sous vide cooking.

With your help our new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will revolutionize sous vide cooking once again.

We’re the company who brought sous vide cooking to home kitchens around the world. We want to make some amazing upgrades to our SousVide Supreme that will elevate the sous vide cooking experience to a whole new level.

The new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will have a similar look and feel to the iconic original SousVide Supreme, but with some innovative upgrades that will make it not only the most convenient sous vide machine to use, but the most advanced at-home sous vide machine there is. The Touch+ will include ingenious features such as:

  • Responsive Touch Technology – The new Touch+ has a control screen that you can navigate even with wet fingers. When your hands get wet from cooking—as they most surely will do—no problem! The new Touch+ will still respond perfectly. You can easily change the temperature, set the timer, or power it on or off.
  • A Clear View Lid - SousVide Supreme users have never had to struggle with using ping-pong balls or aluminum foil tents or other extreme measures to keep in the heat. Our patented lid handled that beautifully. But now, that lid is fashioned of a single piece of molded clear plastic to let you see what’s going on, without lifting the lid and wasting valuable heat. All you have to do is look inside.
  • Energy Efficiency - The Touch+ retains the energy efficient, cool-touch double-wall insulation of the original, so the water stays hot, but the machine stays cool to the touch. Once at temperature, the Touch+ uses only about the energy of a 20W light bulb. Safer for kids; better for the environment.
  • Integrated Wifi - You can control your Touch+ from anywhere with the newly integrated wifi. You can start and set your machine right from your phone and have the water bath at temperature and ready to go by the time you get home!
  • A new state-of-the-art app - Connect with people who love cooking as much as you do. You can program your new Touch+ with recipes you find on social media, and then upload pictures of your finished dish to your favorite social platforms to show everyone how it all turned out!
  • Alexa compatibility - Unlike circulator sticks, the counter-worthy SousVide Supreme Touch+ is always ready to go! It’s there, sitting pretty on your countertop, right at home next to your espresso machine and with water already in it. All you have to do is tell Alexa to turn it on! You don’t even have to push a button.

 

 

 

 

Sous vide? We’re glad you asked. The words literally mean “under vacuum” in French and they describe a cooking technique, first developed in France  in the 1970’s by Chef Georges Paulus; it relies on precise temperature control rather than great skill and perfect timing to achieve chef-worthy results. Food is vacuum-sealed and immersed in a precisely heated water bath to cook gently and perfectly. When you cook sous vide, your food develops deep flavors and textures that no other cooking method can duplicate.

While the term sous vide means “under vacuum”, you might just as well define it as “stunningly simple” especially when you use the Sous Vide Supreme Touch+. The sous vide cooking process boils down to three steps:

1. Season - Season foods with your favorite herbs or spices.

 2. Seal - Vacuum seal food in a food-grade cooking pouch.

3. Sous Vide - Drop the sealed packages into the SousVide Supreme. No need for office clips, extra pots, Styrofoam coolers or ping-pong balls. The water oven does most of the work. Just set it and walk away!

 

We are the original innovators, who brought sous vide cooking to home kitchens around the world and our patented technology is unique. SousVide Supreme's award-winning technology and product design features a PID-controlled edge-to-edge heating element that blankets the bottom of the water oven. A perforated convection plate generates thermal currents for even temperature distribution. Our patented lid contains heat for energy efficiency, contains steam to prevent evaporation, and even serves as a tray for transporting pouches from the water oven to the stove or grill. It’s also a sleek and beautiful and counter-worthy machine.

The natural thermal circulation created by the design works with the basic physical properties of water to evenly heat the water to the target temperature throughout the bath, from top to bottom and corner to corner, without the need for a circulating propeller or pump. The precise temperature control gently brings the food to its ideal doneness and cooks it perfectly from edge to edge. Once brought to temperature, the efficient heat transfer capacity in our enclosed, self-contained system uses only about the energy of a 20 watt light bulb to precisely maintain the target temperature for hours or even days.

 
 

And now with integrated wifi and Alexa capabilities powered by our new app, the SousVide Supreme Touch+ will be the most technologically advanced sous vide water oven on the market. 

It's time to ditch your "science project" and step up to a state-of-the-art, serious sous vide appliance. Unlike circulator sticks, there is no remembering to put a hot pad down so your pot doesn't burn your counter, connecting a circulator to a pot, using an office clip to fasten a flimsy plastic bag to the side, and then creating a lid out of ping pong balls or foil to keep the heat in. No need to set the alarm to remember to add water lest the pot boil dry.

The revolutionary SousVide Supreme Touch+ is an all-in-one cooking appliance that will make it easier for cooks—from beginners to top chefs—to consistently prepare gourmet quality food at home and have more time do the other things they really love.

Learn more about the differences between an all-in-one SousVide Supreme and an immersion circulator:

 

Advantages of Sous Vide Cooking

It goes without saying that the sous vide cooking technique will make you the envy of your friends, but the benefits go far deeper than mere peer adulation and they all come down to three things: better nutrition, free time, and more money. Here’s what’s in it for you!

  • Perfectly cooked food every time. No more undercooked or overcooked food. The precise temperature control gently brings food to its ideal serving temperature and holds it there, so it stays perfectly cooked and ready to serve when you are ready to eat. Even if you get distracted. Even if you’re held up in traffic. Even if your guests are an hour late!
  • Simple to do. Everything you need is in the box. No assembly required. Just add water and get cooking! Dial in edge-to-edge perfection at the push of a button and cook gourmet quality meals in three simple steps: Season – Seal - Sous vide.
  • Healthful, more nutritious meals. The sous vide pouch locks in the flavor and lets the food cook in its natural juices, retaining all the water-soluble vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Important nutrients aren’t boiled off or steamed away like in conventional cooking. And vacuum sealing also protects the delicate, healthful essential fats from damaging oxidation. What you cook not only tastes better, it actually is better.
  • Consistent, reproducible results. Effortlessly cook food just the way you like it every time – perfectly cooked steak, juicy chicken, tender-crisp vegetables bursting with flavor. Once you discover your preferences, just dial them in again and again for the same results. It’s the secret of the world’s top chefs that lets them make fabulous dishes, consistently delicious, night after night, for diner after diner and now it can be yours, too.
  • Save money! Sous vide cooking lets you turn inexpensive, but flavorful, cuts of meat into gourmet delights as tender as filet mignon. You’ll never ruin a good steak again. You can make your own infused spirits and syrups for retro cocktails instead of buying expensive ones off the shelf. The savings go on and on!

10 Things You Didn't Know You Could Cook with a Sous Vide Supreme

1. Ricotta Cheese/Yogurt - The precisely-controlled water temperature makes cheese and yogurt-making effortless. Because the bath is unstirred, you can make them right in the water oven basin without a pouch.

2. Condiments - Use your imagination to develop your own condiments! Grainy mustard, Worcestershire sauce, hot dill pickles, pickled summer veggies, and more. 

3. Cheesecake - An unstirred sous vide bath is already the perfect bain marie for cooking traditional oven recipes requiring a water cushion and constant temperatures, like cheesecake, crème brûlée, or flan! Using a SousVide Supreme eliminates the challenge (and danger) of sloshing hot water onto the floor when filling or removing a pan from a traditional oven.

4. The perfect egg - Just set the temperature and put eggs in their shells directly into the water bath to cook and BAM—perfect poached eggs! And best of all, they’ll hold just as perfectly cooked for hours!

5. Soup stock - Use an unstirred water bath to make luscious bone broth or stock right in the water bath basin—no pouch required—to use for homemade soup or just to drink for good health!

6. Custards and ice cream base - No need for constant stirring to keep from scorching your custard on a stovetop. With sous vide you’ll be able to make perfect custard for homemade ice cream, crème brûlée, or flan, just like a pro.

7. Overnight oatmeal - Drop a pouch of oatmeal into the water oven at bedtime and it will be ready when you wake up. Say goodbye to that ‘no time for breakfast I’m just grabbing coffee’ excuse as you’re running out the door for work in the morning!

8. Epic Bloody Mary - Use the sous vide technique to create the perfect pickled vegetables—asparagus, okra, or green beans – for an epic Bloody Mary! You can even infuse the horseradish right into vodka in a matter of hours in a water oven.

9. Gourmet vinegar - Precise cooking temperatures help to quickly transfer flavor from herbs, spices, and berries without holding your kitchen hostage with that vinegar smell!

10. Infused alcohols and syrups - Traditionally made limoncello takes weeks or months to make. With sous vide, that timeline drops to hours or in some cases even minutes! The gentle heat speeds up the process of transferring natural flavors to the alcohol, helping you create old school cocktails on short notice for an impromptu dinner party!

 

It all started with a pork chop. We (The Drs. Eades, pere and mere) had arrived late to a medical meeting in Las Vegas and were extraordinarily tired and hungry. We ordered a double-cut pork chop off the room service menu (in truth, with some slight reservations, because you’d expect a room service chop to be dried out and overcooked.) But when we took a bite, it was like no pork chop we had ever eaten: juicy and perfectly cooked from edge to edge with a golden crust on the surface. Simply divine! We were so surprised, we asked at the dining room how it was cooked and they told us ‘sous vide’. We vowed to find a machine that would replicate that chop.

We know food and cooking. We’ve owned a restaurant, written and hosted a 26-episode PBS television cooking show, authored a NY Times best-selling diet book, as well as being nutritional experts and physicians by trade. But it was through our quest to recreate that perfect pork chop that we discovered our passion for sous vide cooking. 

Our first stab at cooking sous vide at home involved a DIY makeshift contraption that consisted of a large stock pot, balanced over the gas burner atop a simmering ring from an old wok, with a candy thermometer hooked to the side. The two of us kept watching minute-by-minute, adding ice cubes or hot water as needed throughout the hour-long cooking process to keep the temperature steady. Suffice it to say it wasn’t the most convenient method, but it worked and the steak we cooked was delicious! 

We were convinced we had to have more of this sous vide cooked food, but neither of us willing to stand over the pot with ice cubes for an hour, so we scoured the internet trying to find a home sous vide machine. To our dismay, we found that the only sous vide cooking machines on the market were made for industrial labs or commercial kitchens, and the least expensive device was around $1,500 to $2,000. At the time, there was no device for the home cook, so we set about to make one. We assembled a team of designers, manufacturers, and culinary professionals and launched our dream to develop the first home sous vide machine, our original SousVide Supreme water oven, and to fulfill our mission to bring sous vide cooking to our home and to the masses.

Our SousVide Supreme has received international acclaim - check out what others have said:

 

Our customers love their original SousVide Supreme. We're excited to see how much they’ll love the SousVide Supreme Touch+! 

Professional chef's like Top Chef All-Star Richard Blais love the SousVide Supreme too:

Product Specifications:

Estimated Availability: May 2018

Product Price: $599

Finish: Stainless steel exterior and interior

Performance:

  • Double-wall insulation with cool-touch exterior means it is safe in your kitchen. 
  • The Touch+ will be ETL certified for household use. 
  • The SousVide Supreme Touch+ will cook approximately 20 four-ounce portions. 
  • Precise temperature control results in perfectly cooked food, every time. 
  • High-efficiency "Edge to Edge" heating system 
  • Cooks everything from meat, seafood, poultry and eggs to desserts, yogurt, and even infused syrups and liquors. 
  • Patented design with double wall insulation retains heat, making it highly energy efficient. 
  • Because food is vacuum-sealed in food safe pouches, juices and nutrients are preserved during the cooking process.
  •  Easy to use—just set it and walk away. Low and slow, extended cooking times ensure food won’t ever be over- or under-cooked. 
  • Even temperatures are maintained throughout the water bath without the need for a circulator motor. Totally silent operation and no moving parts. And a tight fitting lid contain s steam and prevents water loss.

Estimated Weight 12.8 lbs / 5.6 kg

Estimated Dimensions: 14.2 x 11.4 x 11.9 inches / 36 x 29 x 30.2 cm

Sensors:

  • PID controller ensures temperatures are maintained within 1 degree Fahrenheit (0.5 degrees Celsius). Heat sensors located in the basin walls

Display and Controls:

  • Convective touch user interface with touch recognition technology
  • LCD digital display

Materials: Silver brushed stainless steel casing with a clear plastic lid

Cleaning:

  • Clean, clear water can be left in the machine for future uses. If water has developed a film of oil on the surface, or is cloudy or has an odor, do not leave it sitting in the machine after use.
  • Allow water to cool before emptying. Remove racks, and using the offset handles for stability, pour the water into the sink. Dry the interior with a soft, clean cloth.
  • Never immerse the appliance in water or other liquid for cleaning or rinsing. Never use abrasives or harsh chemicals to clean it. Never put the appliance in the dishwasher.

In the Box:

11-liter all-in-one sous vide appliance in either 110-120v or 220-240v AC, plus: 

  • Detachable power cord 
  • Thermal convection plate 
  • Lifting rack Universal pouch rack 
  • User's guide 
  • Concierge Customer Service invitation and warranty card

Timeline

We have been working on a redesign of the original SousVide Supreme since September 2016. We have built a physical prototype without the wifi capabilities.

Our next steps are to design and develop the application and wifi technology, including Alexa integration.

Our whole family is passionate about sous vide cooking. Our passion became a fledgling company that originated the home sous vide category and became the global market leader. Now we want to build on that dream to make sous vide cooking easier, sexier, and more fun! In short, we want to revolutionize sous vide cooking once again. Our new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will offer a simpler and more connected cooking experience for you and our whole global sous vide foodie community. The money that we raise will go toward the engineering, design, and development of the new hardware and software of the product.

Help us take your sous vide cooking to the next level! Join us to become a part of the SousVide Supreme community!
story_txt:
From the company that revolutionized cooking with the first at-home sous vide, the original SousVide Supreme, comes the next chapter in sous vide cooking.

With your help our new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will revolutionize sous vide cooking once again.

We’re the company who brought sous vide cooking to home kitchens around the world. We want to make some amazing upgrades to our SousVide Supreme that will elevate the sous vide cooking experience to a whole new level.

The new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will have a similar look and feel to the iconic original SousVide Supreme, but with some innovative upgrades that will make it not only the most convenient sous vide machine to use, but the most advanced at-home sous vide machine there is. The Touch+ will include ingenious features such as:


Responsive Touch Technology – The new Touch+ has a control screen that you can navigate even with wet fingers. When your hands get wet from cooking—as they most surely will do—no problem! The new Touch+ will still respond perfectly. You can easily change the temperature, set the timer, or power it on or off.

A Clear View Lid - SousVide Supreme users have never had to struggle with using ping-pong balls or aluminum foil tents or other extreme measures to keep in the heat. Our patented lid handled that beautifully. But now, that lid is fashioned of a single piece of molded clear plastic to let you see what’s going on, without lifting the lid and wasting valuable heat. All you have to do is look inside.

Energy Efficiency - The Touch+ retains the energy efficient, cool-touch double-wall insulation of the original, so the water stays hot, but the machine stays cool to the touch. Once at temperature, the Touch+ uses only about the energy of a 20W light bulb. Safer for kids; better for the environment.
Integrated Wifi - You can control your Touch+ from anywhere with the newly integrated wifi. You can start and set your machine right from your phone and have the water bath at temperature and ready to go by the time you get home!

A new state-of-the-art app - Connect with people who love cooking as much as you do. You can program your new Touch+ with recipes you find on social media, and then upload pictures of your finished dish to your favorite social platforms to show everyone how it all turned out!

Alexa compatibility - Unlike circulator sticks, the counter-worthy SousVide Supreme Touch+ is always ready to go! It’s there, sitting pretty on your countertop, right at home next to your espresso machine and with water already in it. All you have to do is tell Alexa to turn it on! You don’t even have to push a button.

Water Resistant Touch Screen
 
See-through Lid
 
Programmable Recipes
 
Alexa Enabled
 

Sous vide? We’re glad you asked. The words literally mean “under vacuum” in French and they describe a cooking technique, first developed in France  in the 1970’s by Chef Georges Paulus; it relies on precise temperature control rather than great skill and perfect timing to achieve chef-worthy results. Food is vacuum-sealed and immersed in a precisely heated water bath to cook gently and perfectly. When you cook sous vide, your food develops deep flavors and textures that no other cooking method can duplicate.
While the term sous vide means “under vacuum”, you might just as well define it as “stunningly simple” especially when you use the Sous Vide Supreme Touch+. The sous vide cooking process boils down to three steps:

1. Season - Season foods with your favorite herbs or spices.
 2. Seal - Vacuum seal food in a food-grade cooking pouch.
3. Sous Vide - Drop the sealed packages into the SousVide Supreme. No need for office clips, extra pots, Styrofoam coolers or ping-pong balls. The water oven does most of the work. Just set it and walk away!

 

We are the original innovators, who brought sous vide cooking to home kitchens around the world and our patented technology is unique. SousVide Supreme's award-winning technology and product design features a PID-controlled edge-to-edge heating element that blankets the bottom of the water oven. A perforated convection plate generates thermal currents for even temperature distribution. Our patented lid contains heat for energy efficiency, contains steam to prevent evaporation, and even serves as a tray for transporting pouches from the water oven to the stove or grill. It’s also a sleek and beautiful and counter-worthy machine.
The natural thermal circulation created by the design works with the basic physical properties of water to evenly heat the water to the target temperature throughout the bath, from top to bottom and corner to corner, without the need for a circulating propeller or pump. The precise temperature control gently brings the food to its ideal doneness and cooks it perfectly from edge to edge. Once brought to temperature, the efficient heat transfer capacity in our enclosed, self-contained system uses only about the energy of a 20 watt light bulb to precisely maintain the target temperature for hours or even days.
 
 

And now with integrated wifi and Alexa capabilities powered by our new app, the SousVide Supreme Touch+ will be the most technologically advanced sous vide water oven on the market. 
It's time to ditch your "science project" and step up to a state-of-the-art, serious sous vide appliance. Unlike circulator sticks, there is no remembering to put a hot pad down so your pot doesn't burn your counter, connecting a circulator to a pot, using an office clip to fasten a flimsy plastic bag to the side, and then creating a lid out of ping pong balls or foil to keep the heat in. No need to set the alarm to remember to add water lest the pot boil dry.
The revolutionary SousVide Supreme Touch+ is an all-in-one cooking appliance that will make it easier for cooks—from beginners to top chefs—to consistently prepare gourmet quality food at home and have more time do the other things they really love.

Learn more about the differences between an all-in-one SousVide Supreme and an immersion circulator:

 

Advantages of Sous Vide Cooking
It goes without saying that the sous vide cooking technique will make you the envy of your friends, but the benefits go far deeper than mere peer adulation and they all come down to three things: better nutrition, free time, and more money. Here’s what’s in it for you!


Perfectly cooked food every time. No more undercooked or overcooked food. The precise temperature control gently brings food to its ideal serving temperature and holds it there, so it stays perfectly cooked and ready to serve when you are ready to eat. Even if you get distracted. Even if you’re held up in traffic. Even if your guests are an hour late!

Simple to do. Everything you need is in the box. No assembly required. Just add water and get cooking! Dial in edge-to-edge perfection at the push of a button and cook gourmet quality meals in three simple steps: Season – Seal - Sous vide.

Healthful, more nutritious meals. The sous vide pouch locks in the flavor and lets the food cook in its natural juices, retaining all the water-soluble vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Important nutrients aren’t boiled off or steamed away like in conventional cooking. And vacuum sealing also protects the delicate, healthful essential fats from damaging oxidation. What you cook not only tastes better, it actually is better.

Consistent, reproducible results. Effortlessly cook food just the way you like it every time – perfectly cooked steak, juicy chicken, tender-crisp vegetables bursting with flavor. Once you discover your preferences, just dial them in again and again for the same results. It’s the secret of the world’s top chefs that lets them make fabulous dishes, consistently delicious, night after night, for diner after diner and now it can be yours, too.

Save money! Sous vide cooking lets you turn inexpensive, but flavorful, cuts of meat into gourmet delights as tender as filet mignon. You’ll never ruin a good steak again. You can make your own infused spirits and syrups for retro cocktails instead of buying expensive ones off the shelf. The savings go on and on!


10 Things You Didn't Know You Could Cook with a Sous Vide Supreme
1. Ricotta Cheese/Yogurt - The precisely-controlled water temperature makes cheese and yogurt-making effortless. Because the bath is unstirred, you can make them right in the water oven basin without a pouch.
2. Condiments - Use your imagination to develop your own condiments! Grainy mustard, Worcestershire sauce, hot dill pickles, pickled summer veggies, and more. 
3. Cheesecake - An unstirred sous vide bath is already the perfect bain marie for cooking traditional oven recipes requiring a water cushion and constant temperatures, like cheesecake, crème brûlée, or flan! Using a SousVide Supreme eliminates the challenge (and danger) of sloshing hot water onto the floor when filling or removing a pan from a traditional oven.
4. The perfect egg - Just set the temperature and put eggs in their shells directly into the water bath to cook and BAM—perfect poached eggs! And best of all, they’ll hold just as perfectly cooked for hours!
5. Soup stock - Use an unstirred water bath to make luscious bone broth or stock right in the water bath basin—no pouch required—to use for homemade soup or just to drink for good health!
6. Custards and ice cream base - No need for constant stirring to keep from scorching your custard on a stovetop. With sous vide you’ll be able to make perfect custard for homemade ice cream, crème brûlée, or flan, just like a pro.
7. Overnight oatmeal - Drop a pouch of oatmeal into the water oven at bedtime and it will be ready when you wake up. Say goodbye to that ‘no time for breakfast I’m just grabbing coffee’ excuse as you’re running out the door for work in the morning!
8. Epic Bloody Mary - Use the sous vide technique to create the perfect pickled vegetables—asparagus, okra, or green beans – for an epic Bloody Mary! You can even infuse the horseradish right into vodka in a matter of hours in a water oven.
9. Gourmet vinegar - Precise cooking temperatures help to quickly transfer flavor from herbs, spices, and berries without holding your kitchen hostage with that vinegar smell!
10. Infused alcohols and syrups - Traditionally made limoncello takes weeks or months to make. With sous vide, that timeline drops to hours or in some cases even minutes! The gentle heat speeds up the process of transferring natural flavors to the alcohol, helping you create old school cocktails on short notice for an impromptu dinner party!

 

It all started with a pork chop. We (The Drs. Eades, pere and mere) had arrived late to a medical meeting in Las Vegas and were extraordinarily tired and hungry. We ordered a double-cut pork chop off the room service menu (in truth, with some slight reservations, because you’d expect a room service chop to be dried out and overcooked.) But when we took a bite, it was like no pork chop we had ever eaten: juicy and perfectly cooked from edge to edge with a golden crust on the surface. Simply divine! We were so surprised, we asked at the dining room how it was cooked and they told us ‘sous vide’. We vowed to find a machine that would replicate that chop.


We know food and cooking. We’ve owned a restaurant, written and hosted a 26-episode PBS television cooking show, authored a NY Times best-selling diet book, as well as being nutritional experts and physicians by trade. But it was through our quest to recreate that perfect pork chop that we discovered our passion for sous vide cooking. 
Our first stab at cooking sous vide at home involved a DIY makeshift contraption that consisted of a large stock pot, balanced over the gas burner atop a simmering ring from an old wok, with a candy thermometer hooked to the side. The two of us kept watching minute-by-minute, adding ice cubes or hot water as needed throughout the hour-long cooking process to keep the temperature steady. Suffice it to say it wasn’t the most convenient method, but it worked and the steak we cooked was delicious! 
We were convinced we had to have more of this sous vide cooked food, but neither of us willing to stand over the pot with ice cubes for an hour, so we scoured the internet trying to find a home sous vide machine. To our dismay, we found that the only sous vide cooking machines on the market were made for industrial labs or commercial kitchens, and the least expensive device was around $1,500 to $2,000. At the time, there was no device for the home cook, so we set about to make one. We assembled a team of designers, manufacturers, and culinary professionals and launched our dream to develop the first home sous vide machine, our original SousVide Supreme water oven, and to fulfill our mission to bring sous vide cooking to our home and to the masses.

Our SousVide Supreme has received international acclaim - check out what others have said:
 
 
Our customers love their original SousVide Supreme. We're excited to see how much they’ll love the SousVide Supreme Touch+! 

Professional chef's like Top Chef All-Star Richard Blais love the SousVide Supreme too:

Product Specifications:
Estimated Availability: May 2018
Product Price: $599
Finish: Stainless steel exterior and interior
Performance:

Double-wall insulation with cool-touch exterior means it is safe in your kitchen. 
The Touch+ will be ETL certified for household use. 
The SousVide Supreme Touch+ will cook approximately 20 four-ounce portions. 
Precise temperature control results in perfectly cooked food, every time. 
High-efficiency "Edge to Edge" heating system 
Cooks everything from meat, seafood, poultry and eggs to desserts, yogurt, and even infused syrups and liquors. 
Patented design with double wall insulation retains heat, making it highly energy efficient. 
Because food is vacuum-sealed in food safe pouches, juices and nutrients are preserved during the cooking process.
 Easy to use—just set it and walk away. Low and slow, extended cooking times ensure food won’t ever be over- or under-cooked. 
Even temperatures are maintained throughout the water bath without the need for a circulator motor. Totally silent operation and no moving parts. And a tight fitting lid contain s steam and prevents water loss.

Estimated Weight 12.8 lbs / 5.6 kg
Estimated Dimensions: 14.2 x 11.4 x 11.9 inches / 36 x 29 x 30.2 cm
Sensors:
PID controller ensures temperatures are maintained within 1 degree Fahrenheit (0.5 degrees Celsius). Heat sensors located in the basin walls
Display and Controls:

Convective touch user interface with touch recognition technology
LCD digital display

Materials: Silver brushed stainless steel casing with a clear plastic lid
Cleaning:

Clean, clear water can be left in the machine for future uses. If water has developed a film of oil on the surface, or is cloudy or has an odor, do not leave it sitting in the machine after use.
Allow water to cool before emptying. Remove racks, and using the offset handles for stability, pour the water into the sink. Dry the interior with a soft, clean cloth.
Never immerse the appliance in water or other liquid for cleaning or rinsing. Never use abrasives or harsh chemicals to clean it. Never put the appliance in the dishwasher.

In the Box:
11-liter all-in-one sous vide appliance in either 110-120v or 220-240v AC, plus: 

Detachable power cord 
Thermal convection plate 
Lifting rack Universal pouch rack 
User's guide 
Concierge Customer Service invitation and warranty card

Timeline
We have been working on a redesign of the original SousVide Supreme since September 2016. We have built a physical prototype without the wifi capabilities.
Our next steps are to design and develop the application and wifi technology, including Alexa integration.
Our whole family is passionate about sous vide cooking. Our passion became a fledgling company that originated the home sous vide category and became the global market leader. Now we want to build on that dream to make sous vide cooking easier, sexier, and more fun! In short, we want to revolutionize sous vide cooking once again. Our new SousVide Supreme Touch+ will offer a simpler and more connected cooking experience for you and our whole global sous vide foodie community. The money that we raise will go toward the engineering, design, and development of the new hardware and software of the product.

Help us take your sous vide cooking to the next level! Join us to become a part of the SousVide Supreme community!

story:
The only mobile espresso maker
powered by CO2 technology: the result is in your cup.

MAKÉ is like a jewel whose purity of design is embedded in its high precision mechanics, a feat that Italy has always been famous for. The portable coffee machine requires two patents: a safety relief valve and a stopper plate for back-pressure.

The result is in your cup: perfect extraction leaving the quality of the coffee aroma unaltered  with a silky crema that is robust enough to remain as you drink the last drops of your espresso. 

 

One-Touch. Perfect Extraction.

Just press a button. No need to be a musician or professional barista to prepare espresso with Maké. One-touch, perfect extraction. 

Hot water, Maké, and a coffee pod. And just one touch. That's all you need.

You can choose between two versions of Maké: Classic, hot water is poured in; Smart has the function to heat water using a power supply or a power bank up to the right temperature for espresso.

How to prepare espresso with Maké Classic

 

 

How to prepare espresso with Maké Smart

 

* Plastic or aluminum coffee capsules are not compatible with Maké by choice, in order not to contribute to non-recyclable waste in the environment.

 

Technically speaking, but not too technical

Through the CO2 technology, Maké is able to produce the same 9 bars pressure of a professional espresso machine.

Thanks to the high-pressure relieve valve and the back pressure disc, Maké transforms the pressure of carbon dioxide bubbles contained in the cylinder from 70 to 9 atm bars. This innovation has surpassed the old standard of pump + boiler + filter.

The air is like music for espresso. It makes it vibrate like sax in a jazz band, producing the crema of a perfect Italian espresso.

You can make up to 25 coffees with one CO2 Cylinder. 

 

It all started in Fermo, in Italy

It all began with a cosmopolitan engineer, who came from China to Italy to earn his Ph.D. at the Polytechnic University of Turin, at the precise moment when his face lit up at his first taste of Italian caffè and he fell in love with it. He dreamed of bringing his true love home, but also on the train, in the park, to work...

He embarked on adventures in new technology and espresso and picked himself back up after every fall, never losing sight of his dream.

He took a trip to the East-Central region of Marche in Italy in the search of an artisan who would help him realize his dream. Here he found a “design inventor” who lived in the world of mechanics and used his mastery in creating tools of absolute precision that put perfection at the service of daily pleasures.

Together, they created blueprints and prototypes, found the beauty in detail, celebrated their ingenious and revolutionary ideas and breakthroughs.

And today, after three years of research and development, we can all drink a MAKÉ espresso with Yujun Wu and Emiliano Bracalente, the two fathers of Maké.

-

Made in Italy Design

MAKÉ is to the espresso machine as the tablet is to the computer. A revolution.

 

The production is in progress

 

The biggest challenge has been to guarantee the consistency of quality, always, and with any coffee pods. We were able to solve the problem thanks to the back-pressure and the high-pressure CO2 safety valve.
 
  • The project team has now turned the prototype into the final product.
  • Production started for the Maké Classic model and the first batch will be ready to be shipped by end of November.
  • Maké Smart, the product version able to warm the water comes with a supply charge and a power bank. It is only available in 50 pieces at first. We will start mass production as soon as the funds have risen.
  • So, if you want Maké able to warm the water you have to run to reserve the first pieces.

     

As seen on


Shipping

Where We Ship

We are able to ship Maké Classic worldwide. 

The first batch of Maké Smart will only be available to be shipped in Europe. From second batch on, Maké Smart will be available to be shipped worldwide. The worldwide safety certification is in process.

Shipping Cost

We're offering international shipping in Europe included in the final price. Shipping charges for other countries may vary depending on the country it is shipped to. Please note that we're not responsible for duty and taxes that may apply to your local importation laws.

When We Start Shipping

First batch will start to be shipped by the end of November. Yes you can make a holiday gift with Maké. We will keep you notified of your product ship date and expected delivery date.

Why Order Now

By backing now, you'll be one of the first to experience Maké at a very convenient price. You'll also have exclusive access to provide valuable feedback that will shape future generations of the product.

 

Don't keep the secret.

The aim of this campaign is to raise funds to start mass production of Maké Smart (w/ power bank), to market at a larger scale in different countries and languages; and finally to develop future generations of Maké.

Just 30 seconds of your time could make the difference to build the Maké global community.

Help us getting the word out and make other coffee lovers aware of our campaign.

Share our Indiegogo campaign!

 

Thanks to all our backers.
We love you!

 

www.makespresso.com

story:
About this project

For You

Sugar Trek a mobile app game played in the real world that allows you to play for free stuff from bars and restaurants. You can also team up with friends to get more free stuff at once and earn badges to level up more quickly. Happy hour and going out in general just got sweeter.

For Bars and Restaurants

This is your chance to join the new social revolution. If you would buy a drink for a patron that brings friends and spends time in your restaurant or bar this is for you. We provide you with a button that when touched gets people in the door and you can create your own badges for people to earn — you are finally in control without the broken promises and frustrations of social coupon and review companies.

Risks and challenges

The success of Sugar Trek hinges on our ability to market. We have analyzed several strategies from Groupon, Open Table, and others, and have formulated a plan to introduce Sugar Trek to players and businesses, city by city. Sugar Trek also incorporates several viral behavioral levers to ensure that the system will work on its own. Meaning, a player can recruit other players, and nudge businesses to play the game, independent of our marketing efforts.

story:
Craft beer has been nothing short of a cultural revolution. It single handedly changed the way we drink....and more importantly, view beer. The camaraderie that goes along with it will never change and will always be a key ingredient to the crafts ethnology. But the game has to keep evolving to uphold interest and to avoid the monotony of flooding markets. The key is knowing when to ride the flow and when to present big change to an industry that's thrived so well.
           HopWins plans on re-revolutionizing the world of artisanal brew. All the while pumping the local economy with the shrapnel of all that comes from our brand and more.  The hallmark of our logo will have dual meaning. 
           HopWins is a  farm brewery. Having a farm license means that most of our ingredients need to be purchased within the local market. And we believe that a brewery should not be judged solely on their ability to make the perfect double IPA . There's hundreds of beer varieties and our pride comes in teaching the public about as many of them as possible and enjoying a few in the process. 
       
       It's gonna be a long journey, but we feel that New York and especially Long Island deserves a spot light in the National Craft beer scene and we will work arduously until this dream comes to life.
      One of our goals is to show the world that there is a beer for everyone...even those who think they don't like beer.

Having a farm license means that most of our ingredients need to be purchased within the local market. And we believe that a brewery should not be judged solely on their ability to make the perfect double IPA . There's hundreds of beer varieties and our pride comes in teaching the public about as many of them as possible and enjoying a few in the process.               It's gonna be a long journey, but we feel that New York and especially Long Island deserves a spot light in the National Craft beer scene and we will work arduously until this dream comes to life.      One of our goals is to show the world that there is a beer for everyone...even those who think they don't like beer.
