story:
About the Brewery

Eluvium Brewing Company will be Weaverville's first tap room with an outdoor patio. We're on a mission to put session-style beers on the map. We don't think beer needs to be big on ABV to be big on flavor. With our beers, our goal is on bringing our community together and providing a place for people to gather, be social, and enjoy a pint. 

Who we are

Hey! We're Jon and Shea, the founders and owners of Eluvium Brewing Company and as you may have guessed, we love beer! We also love the awesome community of Weaverville and everything this great, little town has to offer. Shea is a North Carolina Native, born and raised in Sylva, and Jon is originally from Ohio and decided to settle down in the Asheville area almost two and a half years ago after years of nomadding around. Now, we not only call Weaverville our home but, home to Eluvium brewing company.

What is Eluvium?

Picking a name for a brewery is tough. Since we didn't think Varner Brewing Company was very catchy, we decided to look to history to help us find a name. North Carolina is rich in history and one thing that caught our attention was that North Carolina had its own gold rush. In fact, the North Carolina gold rush predates the California gold rush by almost 50 years. According to most accounts, it all started at Reed's Mine in Carbarrus County, North Carolina when a 12-year-old boy discovered a 17-pound gold nugget while out fishing one day. North Carolina went on to be the leading producer of gold in the country until the discovery in California in 1849. People even had more faith in coins from the Bechtler Mint, North Carolinas premier mint, than that of the U.S. Government mints.

What does this have to do with Eluvium? Well, eluvium or eluvial gold placer deposits are gold deposits that derive from in place weathering where the surrounding soil and sediment is washed away leaving the rich heavy gold deposits behind. These deposits are typically closer to the source where you would find the larger gold nuggets.  

So, in our own little quest for gold, or in our case, gold medal worthy beer, we chose to call ourselves Eluvium Brewing Company. And we want to make beer that people not only enjoy drinking but, beer that our supporters and community can call their own. We hope you can stop in and claim your beer soon!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help for our final push to opening. With all of the delays to finishing the brewery construction it has really become a burden financially and our credit cards can only go so far. While we have and will continue to do as much of the work as we can ourselves we've put a lot of money into our build out and we're driving on but, contractors are expensive. The money we raise with this campaign will go towards the final build out costs, pint glasses and tap room supplies, and first batch ingredients for our beers. We've come a long way since this adventure started and your support will get us across the finish line and open our doors so we can share our joy of beer with you! Here are a few pics of where we're at and where we've been with the brewery.

Please check us out on Instagram and Facebook to see more !

The Perks

The Eluvium Brewing Company Key chain bottler opener. The key chain is double sided with the our logo on both sides.

Eluvium Brewing Company T-shirts. These are just a few color options that will be available. We'll provide everyone with a list of color choices after the close of the campaign.

Eluvium Brewing company Hats. This also just example, the real thing will look even cooler. Just as with the shirts, we will provide everyone with a list of color choices after the close of the campaign. These are trucker style hats on which we will have our custom woven patches (also above) sewn on.

Risks & Challenges

As in any adventure, there are plenty of hurdles and challenges we all face, opening a brewery is definitely no exception. This becomes especially challenging when you take on the venture of opening a brewery with just two people. The various permits at almost every level of government, construction, building inspections, sourcing equipment, sourcing ingredients, and all of that is before you can even brew a single barrel of beer! All of these can add delays and push our opening back and delays cost money.

We have already acquired our Federal Brewer's Notice which is typically a big hang up for a new brewery. Unfortunately, we can't get the others until the building is ready and inspected (which this campaign will help us do!). Building delays have not only pushed back our time line but, have taken a huge toll on our bank account. Finance costs, loan payments, equipment leasing, and contractor payments add up fast. And then of the unexpected expenses are another battle. We are doing our best to predict every little expense, down to the ounce of hops, but, you never can predict everything.

We're putting everything we have into this brewery, just the two of us. We've opted against investors because we don't want to have to answer to anyone but our beer drinking supporters. Because of this dedication to you and the beer we must stretch our resources as far as they can go and not be afraid to reach out for help when we need it. Fortunately, Weaverville is a great community and we've had a lot of help from our friends. Now we just need your help to push us across the finish line and help us get our doors open so we can start pouring pints to supporters like you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? It's ok, we still love you and you can still help! Share, share, share! Please plaster this all over your social media and if you have friends (I'm sure you have at least one), get them to share it as well.

story:
Meet Christian, meet eden-a vegan cafe, and meet our Storybook, Vegan Guidebook and Cookbook project!


Hi!  My name is Christian.  I was born in 1972.  I became vegan in 1997.  eden-a vegan cafe came to life in 2008 in Downtown Scranton, PA.  With your help, eden-a vegan cafe's Storybook, Vegan Guidebook and Cookbook will be created and published NOW!  

In my almost 18 years of veganism, I have learned so much from so many.  I have taken everything I have learned and spent my life sharing it with others.  The opportunities I have had to help others with their health, their compassionate journey towards veganism, and simply helping people learn about all things vegan and how they can incorporate them into their life has been a blessing that I am truly grateful for and I embrace any and every chance to promote a better way of living! 


The opportunities that have come through eden-a vegan cafe have been amazing.  Of course we have been able to serve 100% vegan food to so, so, so many people, the majority of whom are not vegan or vegetarian, and we have been able to open so many eyes and hearts by way of the belly!  The cafe has also opened doors for me to speak to so many groups about all things vegan, from elementary students to high school students, colleges and universities, church groups, large corporations, small businesses, health clubs and many other organizations.  It's been a wonderful experience.  I have appeared many times on a local lifestyle show "PA LIVE!" doing cooking segments and talking about vegan foods, and did a cooking demo for a "Vegan Thanksgiving 101" at the Scranton Cultural Center that was very well attended and also televised.  

I want to share the story of my journey and the story of eden with all of you, and incorporate that into the eden cookbook that so many folks have been asking me to put out for a few years now.  We have 6 years of recipes from eden-a vegan cafe, 18 years of recipes from me personally, a wonderful story to tell about how I came to veganism and how eden came to be, and also so much vegan info and knowledge, advice, tips and tricks to share with everyone through this three part book!!    All of us at eden believe in sharing everything that is good with everyone, so it is time to share our story, our knowledge and our recipes, with everyone!  


How we can make this happen together

  • We set a funding goal that we feel can not only be easily reached, but can be easily surpassed.  We want to make a fantastic product for you and it will be as simple, or as extravagant, as it needs to be based on the funds that we all raise together!  The more we raise, the bigger and better the book will be!  So it is key not only to contribute, but to share this campaign far and wide, with everyone in every way, to  help market the idea and get as many people involved as possible!  We have customers and friends who have already offered their time, expertise and services to edit, illustrate, and help publish our book!   We are so excited that at the end of this project, we will have a product that is tangible evidence of the good work that we do at eden, and of the work that we all did by pulling together to make this happen!  An eden-a vegan cafe Storybook, Vegan Guidebook and Cookbook that will forever tell our story and share our recipes for New American Vegan Comfort Food!  We are so excited to bring this to everyone, both local and outside the area!  What a great way to spread the message of how all things vegan can work any and everywhere!  :-)


  • We feel we have come up with several amazing perks that will inspire and make it easy for people to get involved!  Check them out and claim your perks!


  • If we don't reach our goal, we will make the best book we can with the funds that are raised.  So on the low side it could be a self-published paperback sort of book, with more writing and less photos, and published slowly in very small batches.  On the high side, it could be a snazzy, glossy professionally published, gorgeous three part book that ends up on the shelves of major bookstores, Amazon, etc.! We set the goal low so that it can easily be reached, and easily surpassed, as we want to stretch this out as much as possible to make the book the best it can be!  It all depends on YOU, your contributions and your sharing of this campaign so many others can get involved!  We need you to "Street Team" this for us, and your reward will be a great product that you can always say you were a big part in making happen!  :-) 


A little bit about eden-a vegan cafe

We opened our doors in November 2008, bringing New American Vegan Comfort Food to Downtown Scranton and all of NEPA for the first time ever.  People lined up to check out what we do.  Vegans and vegetarians were thrilled.  Omnivores were pleasantly surprised.  People of all ages and walks of life liked what we do, loved our food and appreciated the warm, friendly environment we created in our space. 


 We have a sign that reads "Enter as strangers, leave as friends" and it could not be more true.  Over these past 6 1/2 years, we have made so many friends with so many regular customers, watched children grow up, watched families take shape, watched couples and their relationships grow,  have helped so many with their health by offering more than the healthy food itself, but by offering information on where and how to shop for vegan ingredients, helpful advice, cooking lessons, books to read and so much more.  


We truly love what we do and I guess that shows, because people have taken to us as a business as well as personally, and we love that feel of community that we have here at our place.  By creating this book, a book that tells our story and vegan journey, as well as offers advice, tips and a guide to help you in your vegan journey, and of course the cookbook section which offers loads of easy recipes that you can make at home for yourself, and to wow family and friends with vegan food that you can create, we are creating an everlasting document of sorts that solidifies forever what we do, what we have meant to you, and what you have meant to us.  It feels very special to us and we are grateful for the opportunity to continue doing what we do at eden-a vegan cafe, and now to spread the word farther and reach more people through this book project.  


Risks & Challenges

Publishing a book is not without challenges, and while we hope to have this ready for Christmas, 2015, that is tentative and based on many factors.  As we stated above, this project will be as big or as small as the funds raised through this campaign, so it is up to all of us to push this out there and get as many people involved in making it happen as possible.  So many of our customers, friends and fans already spread the word daily about our place, now we are asking you to spread the word about this book project and crowdfunding campaign!  We will rise to any and all challenges and make this happen, whether it is a small project or a large project, and it all depends on you, just like our continued existence in Downtown Scranton depends on you, our customers, as we would be nothing without all of your love and support.  <3 


Ways You Can Help

  • Contribute!  Every dollar counts!  Whether you can contribute $1 or $100, it all matters so we thank you for each and every dollar you can contribute to this project!
  • Share this campaign on your Social Media pages!  Encourage others to get involved!
  • Share this with your friends, family and co-workers and encourage them to be a part of it!
  • Have connections to animal rights related causes, health care, or anything related to veganism, or environmental concerns?  Spread the word of this project through those connections!
  • Are you a writer?  Have a blog?  Write for a magazine, newspaper or work with any major media source such as local television?  Use your voice to make some noise and put this out there to encourage people to check it out and get involved!

story:
WHO IS ROOTED DELIGHTS?

Greetings Rooted Family!! My name is Janay Jones, founder of Rooted Delights, a local vegan cheez and cuisine company. When I became vegan in 2016, the hardest thing to give up was cheese. It was something that I loved, but it didn't quite love me. I knew if I was struggling, then others had to be too! This is when Rooted Delights was created! With a lot of late nights, trials and errors, and lots of tears, we finally perfected our first product, 'Mild Cheddah Cheez'. Shortly after the release of our ‘Cheddah’, we began working on a mozzarella style cheese which we call our 'Creamy Mozzah Cheez'. With the continuous rise and awareness of veganism, we are hoping to shift minds and take this local vegan cheez company to the next level.

 

 

Check Out The Melt Of Our Oat Milk Cheez!

 

 

 

What Makes Us Different From Other Vegan Cheese Companies?

We took things like delicious home-made oat milk, sweet potatoes, roasted red peppers, assorted spices, & love and created something magical! Allergens? No worries! With no dairy, soy, gluten, or added tree nuts this is the perfect cheez for everyone to enjoy! Both of our cheez wheels comes in an 8 ounce wheel that can shred, slice, and melt.

 

 

The Impact We Can Make

With dairy farms contributing to the slaughter of more than 245,000 dairy cows per year, this vile industry where animals are neglected, caged, and abused is far from humane. The sole purpose of cows milk is to turn a 65-pound calf into a 700 pound cow as fast as possible, dairy milk isn't intended for us to consume. No other species of the planet consumes the milk of another species, except humans. Not only that, but a whopping 75% of the people of the planet are lactose intolerant, wow! In the US, 750 million pus cells are allowed in every liter of milk, in some countries the amount of pus allowed is limitless. These facts are astonishing and shows the importance of making a change.

By cutting back your consumption of meat and dairy, not only are you helping save these animals but also reducing your carbon footprint here on Mother Earth. There are plenty of dairy free alternatives, from oat milk to almond milk to coconut yogurt to Rooted Delights cheez wheels. 

By funding our project it will help us bring more plant based vegan cheese options to people all across the United States in an ethical and loving way. 

 

Why We Need You!

 

Business is growing rapidly, forcing us to scale to the next level. We have been approached by major retail grocers and restaurants but with our limited shared kitchen space and residential style equipment, we aren't able to mass produce and keep up with the demand. But with your help, we can purchase commercial equipment and secure a building space for our own co-packing facility. By funding Rooted Delights, you are not only helping us with the purchase of equipment and space, but also helping us with the production of more vegan cheez flavors! We plan on releasing our locally loved and over anticipated  'O-Queso' along with pepper jack, swiss, and smoked gouda cheez wheels.

 

Risk & Challenges

 

Some major challenges we have faced throughout our journey thus far is mass production. We have not successfully been able to mass produce the cheez at a fast enough pace to keep up with the demand.  We have looked at co-packing and manufacturing facilities, however majority of these spaces also produce or may contain eggs, nuts, soy and wheat all on the same equipment which is a huge risk for cross contamination. Our goal is to scale this business but we also want to keep our products consistent and completely allergen free. Due to the high demand, we would like to allocate our day to day tasks so that we can focus on marketing, networking and expansion. This too has become a challenge since we aren't able to produce more product, however if we were, it would bring in more revenue to benefit, develop and expand our team. Even though we are faced with these challenges and risks, we know we can overcome majority of these problems with proper funding and space to maintain a quality grade product in an allergen free environment.

 

What We Need 

 

We need approximately $47,000 USD to take our business to the next level! Below is a breakdown to where your funding will go. 

  • Equipment - We need large commercial blenders, refrigerators, racks, molds, shredders and slicers which cost around $20,000.00. With this equipment we can produce at a much faster speed and adequately distribute all over the U.S. 
  • Space- We have looked at countless small buildings to call home but with the overhead fees being so expensive we have struggled with currently committing to an actual facility.  We would love the opportunity to eventually create our own co-packing facility right here in Richmond, VA. However in our development stages, we would feel more comfortable beginning our journey with a trial facility until finding the perfect home to build our business.  We anticipate leasing a facility to average approximately $15,000 for a year.
  • Marketing, Research & Development - In order to get the word out, it is vital to hire and partner with a team of people that can promote and engage others from all over the world regarding our brand and to help increase revenue. We plan on utilizing our early adopters to assist with our target audience and assist with expanding our market.  We also plan to improve our shelf life so that our cheez can be enjoyed with longevity. We have found the perfect Marketing team to partner with, however it will cost approximately $10,000 to get started.
  • Product Design & Packaging- With releasing more products we will need to hire a team who can assist in developing quality packaging designs and materials that can be sustainable and environmentally friendly yet sturdy. This may cost our team approximately $2,000-$3,000. 

Enjoy Your Favorite Foods Like Mac N' Cheez With Our Mild Cheddah Cheez Wheels!

Melts Just Like The Real Deal and Tastes Great! Perfect For All Your Favorite Dishes Like Pizza!

 

 

We Are More Than Just A Typical Vegan Cheez Company

While we supply a few local restaurants and grocery stores our oat milk cheez, we also travel all over the East Coast vending our vegan eats! We have been to NYC, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Lousiana etc to spread the love of plant based foods. We are determined to raise funds to scale this business in the right direction. Being able to vend has helped us accumulate more funds while meeting some pretty great people along the way.

Below you will find photos of some of us in action along with our famous loaded vegan nachos. Vegan, Dairy Free, Soy Free, Gluten Free, and Tree Nut Free!  Follow us on social media to see where we are popping up next! 

We also host an event called 'Get Rooted Wednesday' once a month at Urban Hang Suite in Richmond, VA where we provide a free vegan cooking demo to the public along with poetry and amazing vibes. We know the importance of giving back and educating the community about healthier yet safer food options.

 

Some Cool Perks You Get

Just to give you an idea of some perks you will be getting for your contribution by meeting the goals on our Perks Packages. 

Exclusive Rooted Delights hoodies, t-shirts and tote bags

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to be vegan to help spread the word! Tell your friends, family, and coworkers about this one of a kind campaign. Help us bring more healthier vegan alternatives to the world! 

Follow us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram to keep up with our campaign and to see how you have helped us reach our next level goals!
story_txt:
WHO IS ROOTED DELIGHTS?
Greetings Rooted Family!! My name is Janay Jones, founder of Rooted Delights, a local vegan cheez and cuisine company. When I became vegan in 2016, the hardest thing to give up was cheese. It was something that I loved, but it didn't quite love me. I knew if I was struggling, then others had to be too! This is when Rooted Delights was created! With a lot of late nights, trials and errors, and lots of tears, we finally perfected our first product, 'Mild Cheddah Cheez'. Shortly after the release of our ‘Cheddah’, we began working on a mozzarella style cheese which we call our 'Creamy Mozzah Cheez'. With the continuous rise and awareness of veganism, we are hoping to shift minds and take this local vegan cheez company to the next level.

 
 
Check Out The Melt Of Our Oat Milk Cheez!
 

 
 
What Makes Us Different From Other Vegan Cheese Companies?
We took things like delicious home-made oat milk, sweet potatoes, roasted red peppers, assorted spices, & love and created something magical! Allergens? No worries! With no dairy, soy, gluten, or added tree nuts this is the perfect cheez for everyone to enjoy! Both of our cheez wheels comes in an 8 ounce wheel that can shred, slice, and melt.

 
 
The Impact We Can Make

With dairy farms contributing to the slaughter of more than 245,000 dairy cows per year, this vile industry where animals are neglected, caged, and abused is far from humane. The sole purpose of cows milk is to turn a 65-pound calf into a 700 pound cow as fast as possible, dairy milk isn't intended for us to consume. No other species of the planet consumes the milk of another species, except humans. Not only that, but a whopping 75% of the people of the planet are lactose intolerant, wow! In the US, 750 million pus cells are allowed in every liter of milk, in some countries the amount of pus allowed is limitless. These facts are astonishing and shows the importance of making a change.
By cutting back your consumption of meat and dairy, not only are you helping save these animals but also reducing your carbon footprint here on Mother Earth. There are plenty of dairy free alternatives, from oat milk to almond milk to coconut yogurt to Rooted Delights cheez wheels. 
By funding our project it will help us bring more plant based vegan cheese options to people all across the United States in an ethical and loving way. 
 
Why We Need You!
 
Business is growing rapidly, forcing us to scale to the next level. We have been approached by major retail grocers and restaurants but with our limited shared kitchen space and residential style equipment, we aren't able to mass produce and keep up with the demand. But with your help, we can purchase commercial equipment and secure a building space for our own co-packing facility. By funding Rooted Delights, you are not only helping us with the purchase of equipment and space, but also helping us with the production of more vegan cheez flavors! We plan on releasing our locally loved and over anticipated  'O-Queso' along with pepper jack, swiss, and smoked gouda cheez wheels.

 

Risk & Challenges
 
Some major challenges we have faced throughout our journey thus far is mass production. We have not successfully been able to mass produce the cheez at a fast enough pace to keep up with the demand.  We have looked at co-packing and manufacturing facilities, however majority of these spaces also produce or may contain eggs, nuts, soy and wheat all on the same equipment which is a huge risk for cross contamination. Our goal is to scale this business but we also want to keep our products consistent and completely allergen free. Due to the high demand, we would like to allocate our day to day tasks so that we can focus on marketing, networking and expansion. This too has become a challenge since we aren't able to produce more product, however if we were, it would bring in more revenue to benefit, develop and expand our team. Even though we are faced with these challenges and risks, we know we can overcome majority of these problems with proper funding and space to maintain a quality grade product in an allergen free environment.
 

What We Need 
 
We need approximately $47,000 USD to take our business to the next level! Below is a breakdown to where your funding will go. 


Equipment - We need large commercial blenders, refrigerators, racks, molds, shredders and slicers which cost around $20,000.00. With this equipment we can produce at a much faster speed and adequately distribute all over the U.S. 

Space- We have looked at countless small buildings to call home but with the overhead fees being so expensive we have struggled with currently committing to an actual facility.  We would love the opportunity to eventually create our own co-packing facility right here in Richmond, VA. However in our development stages, we would feel more comfortable beginning our journey with a trial facility until finding the perfect home to build our business.  We anticipate leasing a facility to average approximately $15,000 for a year.

Marketing, Research & Development - In order to get the word out, it is vital to hire and partner with a team of people that can promote and engage others from all over the world regarding our brand and to help increase revenue. We plan on utilizing our early adopters to assist with our target audience and assist with expanding our market.  We also plan to improve our shelf life so that our cheez can be enjoyed with longevity. We have found the perfect Marketing team to partner with, however it will cost approximately $10,000 to get started.

Product Design & Packaging- With releasing more products we will need to hire a team who can assist in developing quality packaging designs and materials that can be sustainable and environmentally friendly yet sturdy. This may cost our team approximately $2,000-$3,000. 


Enjoy Your Favorite Foods Like Mac N' Cheez With Our Mild Cheddah Cheez Wheels!


Melts Just Like The Real Deal and Tastes Great! Perfect For All Your Favorite Dishes Like Pizza!
 

 
We Are More Than Just A Typical Vegan Cheez Company
While we supply a few local restaurants and grocery stores our oat milk cheez, we also travel all over the East Coast vending our vegan eats! We have been to NYC, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Lousiana etc to spread the love of plant based foods. We are determined to raise funds to scale this business in the right direction. Being able to vend has helped us accumulate more funds while meeting some pretty great people along the way.
Below you will find photos of some of us in action along with our famous loaded vegan nachos. Vegan, Dairy Free, Soy Free, Gluten Free, and Tree Nut Free!  Follow us on social media to see where we are popping up next! 



We also host an event called 'Get Rooted Wednesday' once a month at Urban Hang Suite in Richmond, VA where we provide a free vegan cooking demo to the public along with poetry and amazing vibes. We know the importance of giving back and educating the community about healthier yet safer food options.
 
Some Cool Perks You Get
Just to give you an idea of some perks you will be getting for your contribution by meeting the goals on our Perks Packages. 
Exclusive Rooted Delights hoodies, t-shirts and tote bags


 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
You don't have to be vegan to help spread the word! Tell your friends, family, and coworkers about this one of a kind campaign. Help us bring more healthier vegan alternatives to the world! 
Follow us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram to keep up with our campaign and to see how you have helped us reach our next level goals!

story:
The Story

I love almond butter. I’ve probably tried every almond butter brand out there, but I had never found one that I quite loved. Some are almost flavorless while others are way too sugary and oily. And the brands that offer exciting flavors are filled with too many unnatural ingredients and artificial sweeteners.

Fast forward to the summer of 2020. In the midst of quarantine and Corona lockdowns, I decided to take on a project: create the perfect nut butter – one that is delicious and fun yet also nutritious. I took out my parents’ Cuisinart food processor, started grinding (no pun intended), and Made By Blu was born.

Four months and two food processors later, I have now created the most unique nut butters out there, including flavors like S’mores Almond Butter and Animal Cracker Crunch Cashew Butter. I decided my creation was simply too good to keep to myself. I started selling locally to friends and family, and eventually expanded to selling nationwide via Instagram and my website (MadeByBlu.com). Operating as a one-woman show out of Cleveland, Made By Blu generated over $8,000 in sales and reached the hands of over 200 customers in just three short months.

 

Our customers love us. In fact, some customers even re-ordered SIX times in the span of three months, but don’t take my word for it…hear it from them!

 

I want everyone to feel this passionate about Made By Blu and try just how delicious our nut butters are, but we need your help.

 

What is Made By Blu?

This delicious nut butter spread is unlike any other almond butter or cashew butter on the market. Most brands are either too bland and boring or too artificial and unhealthy. Made By Blu combines the best of both worlds, creating nut butters that consist of transparent, nutritious ingredients in the base product and then mixing in fun and exciting add-ins.

Other competing brands are filled with unnatural, unhealthy, and unnecessary ingredients, such as whey protein, palm oil, and xylitol sweetener (how do you even pronounce that?!). Some of these competitors can’t even legally call themselves nut butters as their products are made of only 45% nuts…imposters! Not Made By Blu though! Each Made By Blu nut butter is carefully crafted with your well-being and taste buds in mind. For example, our Animal Cracker Crunch Almond Butter only consists of almonds, a drizzle of honey, a dash of vanilla extract, and crushed up pieces of your favorite childhood snack – frosted animal crackers.

We aim to eventually certify each Made By Blu spread as gluten-free and non-GMO.

Made By Blu nut butters are a great source of vitamin E, magnesium, potassium, and healthy fats with a side of FUN. Eating healthy doesn’t have to be boring. With Made By Blu you can:

  • Spread it on toast
  • Eat it on top of yogurt or oatmeal
  • Drizzle it on pancakes
  • Blend it into smoothies
  • Bake it into cookies, breads, and muffins
  • Make fun treats with it
  • Eat it by the spoonful!

The possibilities are endless with Made By Blu! No matter how you choose to enjoy it, it will leave you 100% satisfied and coming back for seconds…or even thirds.

 

Risks & Challenges

Made By Blu is a viable business. We have a plan for manufacturing and fulfillment, and now all we need is your donations to start production! While we may experience some logistical challenges and certain nuances during this first round of production, by working with a professional co-packer, if any issue happens to arise, we have plans in place to mitigate and minimize any potential disruptions.

As a shelf-stable product, shipping Made By Blu nut butters is not risky. The Made By Blu team is dedicated to ensuring that each customer receives their chosen perk. In the case of any unexpected delay, we will certainly keep you updated and informed. No matter what, we promise that our bakers will receive their jars of Made by Blu as soon as they are ready.

 

Where You Come In

Launching a new food startup is not easy, but we are determined to see this through. With your help and support, we will be able to finance:

  • Recipe testing to perfect the current Made By Blu recipe
  • Ingredient sourcing
  • Nutritional analysis
  • Water Activity Level Testing to ensure shelf-life stability
  • Creating FDA compliant packaging

This behind the scenes stuff may seem boring, but it is critical in getting Made By Blu off the ground. Before we officially launch our first Made By Blu nut butter, we want to make sure that it is crafted to perfection. That means we are working hard to perfect the taste, the flavor, the ingredients, the certifications, the nutrition facts  - everything! We want our customers to fall in love with Made By Blu!

 

About Fiona

I have always had this go-getter attitude, so when I told my parents that I wanted to turn this summer hobby of mine into a real business, they were not surprised in the slightest.

In all honestly, being a full-time business student at Washington University in St. Louis and starting up my own company all at the same time has not been easy, but I’m confident that it will be 100% worth it. As a young female, I’ve realized that most of us are far too consumed with our diets. Over the last few years, I’ve come to understand just how important it is to find a balance between nourishment and enjoyment. There have been periods of my life where I’ve gone too far on either side of the spectrum – either eating only fruits, veggies, and lean proteins (BORINGGG!) or eating solely junk food and sweets (Was I asking for a sugar crash!?). After much experimentation and soul-searching, I realized that being too far on either side of the spectrum is neither a sustainable nor healthy lifestyle. What I had been looking for all along was balance.

My love for nut butters coupled with this new-found realization of mine ultimately led to the creation of Made By Blu Nut Butters. I wanted to create a nut butter that truly encapsulated this idea of balance. In my opinion, I achieved just that – with each Made By Blu nut butter containing both nourishing ingredients and indulgent mix-ins! Maybe I won’t change the world with my go-getter attitude, but I might be onto something when it comes to the nut butter industry.

 

To Say Thank You...

To show you just how much we truly appreciate your support, we will send you some Made By Blu nut butters! The more you contribute to the campaign, the more Made by Blu you will receive! This will be Made By Blu’s first round of production with a co-packer, which means YOU will be some of the first customers to try Made By Blu’s new and improved recipe. As an avid Made By Blu consumer, I promise you WON’T want to miss this opportunity. By selecting certain perks, not only will you be among the first to try Made By Blu, but you will also receive discounts, and gain entry to the Blu club. By being a part of the Blu Club, you will have exclusive benefits, such as special promotions and early access to new flavors. We want you to know how much we truly appreciate your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to donate but sharing this campaign and spreading the word about Made By Blu is just as valuable! Please do us the favor of sharing this campaign on Facebook and with your friends, following us on Instagram (@MadeByBlu_), and liking us on Facebook. The more support and awareness we have from you, the more we can grow the business!

story:
I’m raising $7,500 from the community to round out my own personal investment opening a new farm to table restaurant and retail space in Union, KY. The funds will be used to purchase equipment for the kitchen, retail shelving and equipment and signage.

 The Farmstand Market and Cafe will offer:
● A café menu supporting local farmers and food sources in a beautiful eat-in location
● Daily “grab and go” meal options for the surrounding community
● Healthy cooking classes for individuals, groups, and nonprofit partners
● Catering services
● A retail store featuring local meats, jams and jellies, spices, soaps, textiles and so much more

A brick-and-mortar home base means a central location for our services, support of more local farms and culinary entrepreneurs, and more culinary education opportunities for folks seeking to enhance their kitchen skills and knowledge of what local farms and producers have to offer.
 

PASSION drives The Farmstand Market and Cafe. (Which creates some really delicious food.)
It’s what motivates me every day.  

As often as possible I use seasonal, local ingredients from farms and food producers that practice sustainability.  And since the best-quality, cleanest food creates the best flavors, deliciousness is guaranteed.  I’m proud of my personal relationships with local farms, cottage producers and food entrepreneurs.  By visiting their farms and kitchens, keeping on top of seasonal trends, and shopping at local farmers markets, I source the freshest local food and incorporate it into our menus.

We believe good food is more than a meal.

Where our food comes from, the impact it has on the environment, who has access to it - these are all issues that are central to everything I do. That’s why my new location will be more than just an cafe, it will also serve as a culinary hub for community outreach and education programs as well as a retail market for local farms and cottage industries.  This includes cooking and food sourcing classes, canning classes, and healthy eating partnerships with local nonprofits. 

Slow food for today’s frantic pace.

As a longtime advocate and promoter of the slow food movement, I know how important this is to our physical and economic health. Sourcing locally keeps money here in our community by supporting local businesses with common goals and uncommon commitment.

Thank you for investing in my labor of love and the collective health of our local farms and community.

Tricia Houston

Tricia uses her 30 + years in the hospitality industry, her culinary skills and her knowledge of food and farming to create wholesome, delicious food. Tricia actively advocates and supports local farming and sustainability. She is thrilled to expand her personal chef business to the entire community to offer the same quality and care to customers with a broader scope of services and products.

story:
Our Mission

Welcome to Naturel Juicing! At our juicery we plan to focus on your health in ways never done before. We take pride in educating the public about the importance of healthy eating; and promote organic juicing as one of the key ways to master our nutrition and health. Hence, we aim to provide our customers with the most nutritious  juices made with the freshest fruits, vegetables, nuts and flavors from all corners of the world (Caribbean, Latin America, Africa & Asia) to support the body and mind. 

Why is juicing good for you?
Juicing is the alternative to the consumption of certain foods as it is a very effective way to get 100% of all of the nutrients in a produce that your body needs. Unless you are eating your produce completely raw, unprocessed, and uncooked you’re not obtaining 100% of the nutrients that exist in that produce.  Juicing is essentially converting these produce into something that is drinkable, easy to store, and have on-the-go whenever you need it. Cold pressed juicing is even more beneficial than traditional or centrifugal juicing because, cold pressed juicers generates very little to no heat as it juices therefore, it doesn’t break down any of the nutrients in the produce; hence, you are able to obtain close to 100% of the nutrients.

Background

As the founder of Naturel Juicing, there are various reasons why i started this business. My first reason goes back to my love for natural produce. Ever since i was a little girl in my native country, Haiti, i've always loved eating all kinds of fruits and vegetables straight from the local farmers. My love for it grew even more when my mother started making  fresh juices and smoothies for the family.  The flavors of these juices  alone were so amazing that they have remained  ingrained in my mind and in my taste palette. Thus, I wanted to share with others all of the different flavors that Haiti and other areas of the Caribbean have to offer through opening a juicery.

My second reason for wanting to establish a juicery is, i had a vision to educate society primarily the American society about the importance of changing what we eat, how we eat, and promote  juicing as a beneficial way to consume produce. It is a fact that in today's world, healthy eating and dieting is no longer the norm. Instead, what has become the standard is, consuming processed foods with artificial additives, harmful ingredients and preservatives. Consequently, the consumption of these chemicals have been proven to have detrimental effects on the body which can lead to many preventable illnesses and diseases. In order to reverse the damages caused to our body by eating these unhealthy foods, and prevent illnesses we need to make our health a priority by making healthier food choices and Naturel Juicing will definitely help pave the way. 

Our Goal
The success of this campaign will give us the opportunity to finally open a juicery in Boston.  We plan to start out with a small juice lounge to minimize our costs. Then as we grow and make our mark in the community, we plan to relocate to a bigger space in order to accommodate our  larger  volume in sales. Overall, one of our long term goals is to eventually source most of our produce straight from my home country, Haiti by partnering with local farmers and vendors. This will not only empower local communities and provide financial support to local farmers, it will also create jobs in these areas and enable the locals to improve their social and economic wellbeing through the earned income. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share. Spread the word.  Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, text and good ole fashion email. All form of support will move us one step closer to our goals.

Cheers!
story_txt: Our MissionWelcome to Naturel Juicing! At our juicery we plan to focus on your health in ways never done before. We take pride in educating the public about the importance of healthy eating; and promote organic juicing as one of the key ways to master our nutrition and health. Hence, we aim to provide our customers with the most nutritious  juices made with the freshest fruits, vegetables, nuts and flavors from all corners of the world (Caribbean, Latin America, Africa & Asia) to support the body and mind. Why is juicing good for you?Juicing is the alternative to the consumption of certain foods as it is a very effective way to get 100% of all of the nutrients in a produce that your body needs. Unless you are eating your produce completely raw, unprocessed, and uncooked you’re not obtaining 100% of the nutrients that exist in that produce.  Juicing is essentially converting these produce into something that is drinkable, easy to store, and have on-the-go whenever you need it. Cold pressed juicing is even more beneficial than traditional or centrifugal juicing because, cold pressed juicers generates very little to no heat as it juices therefore, it doesn’t break down any of the nutrients in the produce; hence, you are able to obtain close to 100% of the nutrients.BackgroundAs the founder of Naturel Juicing, there are various reasons why i started this business. My first reason goes back to my love for natural produce. Ever since i was a little girl in my native country, Haiti, i've always loved eating all kinds of fruits and vegetables straight from the local farmers. My love for it grew even more when my mother started making  fresh juices and smoothies for the family.  The flavors of these juices  alone were so amazing that they have remained  ingrained in my mind and in my taste palette. Thus, I wanted to share with others all of the different flavors that Haiti and other areas of the Caribbean have to offer through opening a juicery.My second reason for wanting to establish a juicery is, i had a vision to educate society primarily the American society about the importance of changing what we eat, how we eat, and promote  juicing as a beneficial way to consume produce. It is a fact that in today's world, healthy eating and dieting is no longer the norm. Instead, what has become the standard is, consuming processed foods with artificial additives, harmful ingredients and preservatives. Consequently, the consumption of these chemicals have been proven to have detrimental effects on the body which can lead to many preventable illnesses and diseases. In order to reverse the damages caused to our body by eating these unhealthy foods, and prevent illnesses we need to make our health a priority by making healthier food choices and Naturel Juicing will definitely help pave the way. Our GoalThe success of this campaign will give us the opportunity to finally open a juicery in Boston.  We plan to start out with a small juice lounge to minimize our costs. Then as we grow and make our mark in the community, we plan to relocate to a bigger space in order to accommodate our  larger  volume in sales. Overall, one of our long term goals is to eventually source most of our produce straight from my home country, Haiti by partnering with local farmers and vendors. This will not only empower local communities and provide financial support to local farmers, it will also create jobs in these areas and enable the locals to improve their social and economic wellbeing through the earned income. Other Ways You Can HelpShare, share, share. Spread the word.  Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, text and good ole fashion email. All form of support will move us one step closer to our goals.Cheers!

story:
Our Belief

Life is too short not to pursue what we believe in. And what we believe is that Wild Peeta can make a positive contribution to the community we operate in. Just like we did when we first opened, by empowering people to pursue what they believe in.

We all have a personal, sometimes irrational, belief that propels us forward. It ejects us from our seat, carrying us on tsunami-like waves, up colossal mountain ranges, and through thunderous skies, moving us from one unfamiliar path to the next. It's the consequence of pursuing our wildest dreams and the beginning of our greatest adventures.

WE WANT TO BE THE BEST WILD PEETA EVER! We want to be the Wild Peeta you can trust for tasty, inspiring, and nutritious meals for you and your family. We want to be the Wild Peeta you can depend on to deliver on time. We want to be the Wild Peeta that's capable of becoming a world-class operation.

Risks & Challenges

We've done a risk analysis, and to succeed, we need to ensure we address three key factors:

  1. Can we give our community a good enough reason to believe in us again?
  2. Can we find an operational partner to transform us into a world-class operation?
  3. Can we raise USD 100k to open a small, delivery-focused Dubai store in 2018?

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve worked out a way to bring back a more experienced and operationally sound Wild Peeta. We’ve improved our menu and based it on our award-winning world travel series, Peeta Planet. As always, Wild Peeta was based around people, and your support is valuable. Here’s how you can help:

  1. FOLLOW US on Youtube, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Tell us what you think using #neverstopbelieving. Are we crazy? Should we keep moving forward? Should we just give up?
  2. CONNECT US with food and beverage operational partners who are willing to invest USD 50,000 in Wild Peeta and operate it with us in return for equity.
  3. HELP US crowd-raise USD 50,000 by pre-buying Wild Peeta meals. We'll use that money towards opening the new Wild Peeta. In return, we will issue you store credit equal to the perk you purchase on Indiegogo. You can use your store credit towards buying anything at Wild Peeta when we open. Please note that we are not a charity nor a non-profit and therefore cannot accept any donations from people.

Remember

Wild Peeta was born from the belly of a global recession in 2008. It was a time when people had lost hope and entrepreneurs weren't cool. We were two brothers who invited people to unite over a plate Shawarma. In the process, they guided and supported us every step of the way. Wild Peeta became as much theirs as it was ours.

It's 2018, and the online rhetoric is darker and more divisive than ever. Perhaps this is the soil from which Wild Peeta sprouts, to remind everyone not to lose hope, and that we are stronger when we are united.

Can we count on your support one more time?


#NeverStopBelieving

story:
–––– Take a Closer look at The RIMIT Kit ––––

 

––––––––––––––TIMELINE–––––––––––––

August 2018

  • The vision of RIMIT was born
  • Over 100 hours of research identified a market
  • First prototype was 3D printed 

September - December 2018

  • Concept Development 
  • Perfected the Design of RIMIT
  • Lots of R&D & 3D Printing
  • Started Design & Utility Patent Application Process

January - June 2019

  • The Vision of The RIMIT Kit was Born
  • R&D, 3D Printing and Many Revisions
  • Added The RIMIT Kit Design and Utility Application to Our Patent
  • Filed Trade Mark Application
  • Built a Detailed Business Plan
  • Factory Begins Making Molds for RIMIT
  • Social Media and Website
  • Succefully Executed Kickstarter Campaign for RIMIT
  • Designed Graphics for Packaging

June - August 2019

  • Product Test Runs With New Mold
  • Fulfilled Kickstarter Rewards 
  • Set up Packaging Operations

August - December 2019

  • Officially Launched RIMIT
  • Festivals & Events
  • Gathered Feedback From Customers 
  • Re-designed The RIMIT Kit and Re-submitted Patent Application
  • Rebuilt Website
  • Pitched Keurig Dr Pepper (Mott's Clamato Caesars)
  • Rolled Patent Pending Status into PCT Status for Global Protection
  • Entered into Several Liquor Stores Across Canada

January - May 2020 

  • Launched Mott's Clamato Caesar's / RIMIT Value Added Program in British Columbia
  • Prepared for July 2020 Co-Branded Collaboration with Motts Clamato Caesars Across Canada
  • Initiated Co-Branded Collaboration with Lucky's Speed Sauce AKA Lucky's Rim Job Rimmer
  • Initiated Co-Branded Collaboration with Micheladas Matacrudas (MMC) in California 
  • Collaborated with Original Michesauce in California 
  • Entered into More Liquor Stores Across Canada
  • Packaging & Graphics Designing 
  • Prepared For Kickstarter 
  • Launched Kickstarter

–––––––––––– OUR STORY ––––––––––––

We want to thank you so much for taking the time to check out our kickstarter.

My name is Rob Cox , I am the Founder and President of RIMIT. People ask me all the time, "How did you come up with this idea?" The honest truth is, one day in August 2018, I woke up at 3am and the exact vision of what RIMIT is today was in my head. My guess would be after years of suffering from drinking Caesars from a can without rimmer, the universe worked its magic and gave me the solution to my problem. 

Although my background had been in the Landscaping industry for the previous 15 years, I had always been an entrepreneur, owning  businesses in different categories such as a Real estate Investing in Canada and Nicaragua, Granite Counter Tops and few others so I knew extensive research was needed to determine if we should pursue the idea of RIMIT. We quickly realized there may just be a high demand for RIMIT. The problem that we solved with RIIMIT wasn’t just so that consumers could now add rimmer to there canned cocktails but they could now enjoy a fully rimmed cocktails anywhere, anytime in just seconds. And they can do this without their lips having to come in contact with germ covered cans.

But RIMIT was just the beginning. We quickly discovered that there was another problem that we needed to solve. In order to be able to enjoy a fully rimmed cocktail anywhere, anytime in just seconds, the lime juice and rimmer needs to be readily available. It just takes too much time and makes too much mess to have to get out the bowls, rimmer, lime juice and pour them into the bowls just to rim up a couple of cocktails. Then once your done, you now have rimmer and lime juice that both go to waste and you have dishes to do.

The Solution was The RIMIT Kit. Our patent pending 2 in 1 compact, leak-proof rimmer kit allows you to rim up your cocktails anywhere, anytime in just seconds. 

The idea of The RIMIT Kit was born just a couple months after RIMIT but The RIMIT Kit needed about 18 months of R&D to get it just perfect. The original thought of The RIMIT Kit would be a small compact 2 in 1 rimmer kit that could fit in your pocket and would only be compatible with the RIMIT. After 18 months of R&D, it was clear that we had to make it just big enough to be compatible with any standard household drinking glass and of course, RIMIT. But it still had to be compact, leak-proof and easily transportable. Not like the standard bar top rimmer trays. So we ended up with this! 

 

 

Our patent and Trade Mark pending products both RIMIT and The RIMIT Kit were invented to provide more convenience and a quicker solution for preparing fully rimmed cocktails anywhere, anytime in just seconds. All of our products are Made with FDA approved polypropylene, they are BPA Free, Dish Washer Friendly, Recyclable but more importantly they are Reusable. We encourage our customers to wash and reuse our products to minimize waste.

The RIMIT Kit comes with 130 Grams of co-branded Lucky’s Rim Job Rimmer. All you have to do is add 1 ounce of lime juice to the lime juice compartment. The RIMIT Kit can be easily transported via cooler bags, back packs, purses ect. It loves to be stored in the fridge to keep the lime juice fresh. 

In todays busy world, there never seems to be enough time in a day. To us, it makes more sense to spend less time preparing cocktails and creating dishes and spend more time enjoying your favorite cocktails with friends and family.

So whether your looking to enjoy a Caesar, Michelada, Margarita, Bloody Mary at home, at the cottage, the beach, camping, golfing or backyard get togethers, RIMIT and The RIMIT Kit allows you to conveniently enjoy fully rimmed cocktails in just seconds.

We officially launched RIMIT in August 2019 and sales plus co-branded partnerships have taken off for us including a collaboration with Mott’s Clamato Caesar’s. Now it is time to introduce The RIMIT Kit. We have already selected our Manufacturer and our moulds are currently being fabricated. We are on schedule to be in full production by the middle of August this year and now we need your help to get our first manufacturing run off the ground so please back this campaign so we can launch The RIMIT Kit and Elevate your cocktail experience.

With the help of the Kickstarter community, we will launch not only The RIMIT Kit, but also a company that designs and manufactures products that empower you to create unforgettable experiences.

Cheers,

Rob Cox

 

Risks and challenges

As you can see on the timeline, we have been working on this product for more than a year, and have already completed the design / development and have moved forward on the process of creating all the molds, fixtures, and processes needed for mass production. 
 
Here are a few risks and challenges that we can think of:  

Product Manufacturing Delays  

We’ve produced a small run of samples and we feel confident that a large production order will be successful; however, it is common that factories can have unforeseen setbacks. We plan to stay in constant communication with our manufacturer including working on-site to resolve any challenges that may arise.  

Shipping Delays  

As with any manufactured good, delays can happen -- a typhoon can hit, or a pallet can get stuck in a shipyard. We’ve padded our schedule to accommodate some changes, but will let our backers know immediately if we foresee any updates to the timeline for delivery.

story:
Short Summary

Drip Drop Drink is a coffee bar located in Downtown Muskegon, Michigan. We specialize in handcrafted coffee beverages using high-quality, ethically-sourced coffee beans. We believe the coffee should be the star of the show so we keep all the fancy flavors and syrups to a minimum. You could say that we're coffee focused.

We have been serving Downtown Muskegon for nearly 5 years from our little 200 square foot shop. With the downtown finally starting to grow we have been given the opportunity to open a shop in another building - a much bigger space that we wont have to share with several other businesses. That means that we can really dial-in the coffee experience for each and every one of our customers. 

Our plan is to offer our customers a few breakfast options beyond just pastries. We may even do a little light lunch offering. Rest assured though as our main focus will continue to be to offer the very best coffee around - something that we will never change here at Drip Drop Drink.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $25,000 or more. This cost will help cover the purchase of additional equipment (which includes but is not limited to a new espresso machine, a convection oven, new furniture and fixtures) and build-out costs associated with a new space (electrical, plumbing).

We have a wide array of perks available for all levels of supporters. From coffee to t-shirts to unique classes and experiences.

We chose flexible funding because even if we don't reach 100% our goal, every dollar counts! We estimate the entire project will surpass the $40,000 mark but the campaign goal of $25,000 is what we need to get into the space and operating.  If we don't reach our goal through this campaign we will still strive to find other affordable avenues to generate enough funds to make the new space a reality. 

The Impact

A coffee shop is so much more than a place you can go to get your caffeine fix. It is a place for you to feel welcome, a place for you to be comfortable, it is a place to meet your friends for coffee or make new ones over coffee. We want Drip Drop Drink to be your place.

We need your help to succeed. Your contribution to this campaign is invaluable. Whether you give monetarily or just choose to share on your social media pages, you are helping to make Drip Drop Drink a community place for many years to come. That means the world to us!

Risks & Challenges

We launched Drip Drop Drink in Downtown Muskegon before there was much reason to come downtown. Our first winter was tough and had us questioning whether we made the right decision. It hasn't always been smooth sailing but nearly five years later you have helped prove that Downtown Muskegon is the perfect choice for a specialty coffee shop and we are grateful for your continued support.

Now we find ourselves needing to expand and change (ever so slightly) to meet the demands of a growing downtown. We love our neighbors at the Russell Block building but it's time for our own space. We have shown that we have the determination and the tenacity to face challenges and overcome them.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you aren't able to contribute financially but please consider making a solid effort to help us spread the word. Tell your friends, tell Facebook, tell Instagram and Twitter and all those other social media outlets! Don't forget to utilize all those handy little Indiegogo share tools!!

story:
Short Summary  

#FEEDING NIGERIANS FROM STARVATION AND AVERT  FAMINE.

The World should Intervene Now in Nigeria's Food Crisis. It is true that Nigerians are hungry and starving, due to shortages and high prices of food, arising from past neglect of agriculture.Urgent interventions are thus needed to avert famine in Nigeria, the African nation of over 170 million people.

     A short and long term solution is to develop the country's agriculture, to INCREASE FOOD SUPPLIES to feed the nation and avert a humanitarian disaster.

     My name is Henry, the Promoter of BANKOLE LAOTAN FARMS in Ibadan,Nigeria. The farm has 100 acres of land, to grow corn, rice and cassava, which are staple foods eaten all over Nigeria.

    I appeal to the humane peoples of the world to support Bankole Laotan Farms with their financial contributions, to invest in COMMERCIAL/ MECHANIZED Farming and grow food crops, to increase supplies and reduce the shortage-induced high prices of foods in Nigeria.

 

Bankole Laotan Farms needs $US 32,000 to  realize this project.

We have an awesome Unisex T-Shirt and lovely Ceramic Coffee Mugs on offer for your support

    Our budget, covers a 4-month planting period, as follows :

                                                                         $US

Equipment rental                                          653.6

Maize seedlings                                             915.0

PLEASE RESPOND NOW!  Thank you.

 

 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact 

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary  
#FEEDING NIGERIANS FROM STARVATION AND AVERT  FAMINE.
The World should Intervene Now in Nigeria's Food Crisis. It is true that Nigerians are hungry and starving, due to shortages and high prices of food, arising from past neglect of agriculture.Urgent interventions are thus needed to avert famine in Nigeria, the African nation of over 170 million people.
     A short and long term solution is to develop the country's agriculture, to INCREASE FOOD SUPPLIES to feed the nation and avert a humanitarian disaster.
     My name is Henry, the Promoter of BANKOLE LAOTAN FARMS in Ibadan,Nigeria. The farm has 100 acres of land, to grow corn, rice and cassava, which are staple foods eaten all over Nigeria.
    I appeal to the humane peoples of the world to support Bankole Laotan Farms with their financial contributions, to invest in COMMERCIAL/ MECHANIZED Farming and grow food crops, to increase supplies and reduce the shortage-induced high prices of foods in Nigeria. Bankole Laotan Farms needs $US 32,000 to  realize this project.
We have an awesome Unisex T-Shirt and lovely Ceramic Coffee Mugs on offer for your support
    Our budget, covers a 4-month planting period, as follows :

story:
**TO CLAIM A PERK WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION, BE SURE TO SELECT THE PERK FROM THOSE OFFERED ON THE RIGHT!**

To make a contribution without claiming a perk, select the pink "BACK IT" button above on the right. 

 

Short Summary

Gray Jay Provisions will be a sandwich shop and market like no other in Harrisonburg, VA. Our sandwich menu will change frequently to offer the freshest seasonal and local ingredients. Our market will stock carefully selected goods for your pantry including locally sourced meats, cheeses, honey, and house-made kimchi, krauts, pickles, and more. Once a month we'll offer multi-course pop-up dinners. We will also offer workshop events to educate and inspire.

With your help, we will renovate our space and generate an inventory so that we can provide you with a unique and deeply satisfying culinary experience. 

Our culinary team is lead by Chef Seth Amsden who has 17 years of culinary experience under his belt, including 14 years in the Boston fine-dining scene where he worked as head chef at two establishments: Vee Vee, a neighborhood bistro, and a private arts club at Harvard University. Our front of house manager, Michelle Gagnon, brings a passion for slow food inspired by her travels in Europe and 8 years working at a farmers' market in Austria. Our marketing and communications manager, Soula Pefkaros, brings a vision for expanding the impact of the sandwich shop into a force for building and strengthening community through creative programing and building deep relationships with our providers. 

Gray Jay is special. We are working with purpose, skill, and intention, to cultivate a culture of integrity and respect for food and people; we bring that ethos to all our decisions, from farm-to-kitchen-to-table. You'll always have a quality experience at Gray Jay.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a minimum of $40,000. That money will go toward renovations and initial inventory including: 

  • Painting the building
  • Putting in lighting
  • Putting in seating and tables
  • Building shelving
  • Demo of some walls and putting up new walls
  • A kitchen hood and freezer
  • Procuring our intitial inventory of high quality goods from local growers and makers

We have some FABULOUS perks available including:

  • Gray Jay t-shirts
  • Handmade pottery from Golden Ratio Clay Works
  • Spots in a bread-baking class with our chef
  • Tickets to our launch party
  • Tickets to a multi-course pop-up dinner 
  • Private multi-course dinner for you and your chosen guests

 

The Impact

Harrisonburg has a thriving and growing food scene and we know we will make a significant contribution to the culinary community here. What we will give you: 

  • A deep commitment to local, seasonal food - our sandwich menu changes multiple times each season to incorporate the freshest local food available. 
  • A conscious space - we will make our space available to groups working for a more just and sustainable Harrisonburg and beyond; we will also host workshops, educational events, and cultural events.
  • A one-stop-shop for something special - our market will feature locally sourced items for your pantry as well as housemade items to make any simple meal a little more special. We're the place you'll want to stop by to stock up before the snow storm or your weekend adventures!
  • Seth's 17 years of culinary experience can be tasted in every delicious bite. Whether you're in for a quick sandwich on the go or joining us for a multi-course dinner pop-up, you'll always note Seth's ability to bring out the flavor and quality of the ingredients he works with.

We are passionate about our vision and know that what we are building can be so much more than a sandwich shop. Gray Jay will be a space for inspiration and nourishment. With our focus on relationships and environment, Gray Jay will be a business that supports local farmers and makers as well as the health of our bioregion. Gray Jay will support movements for justice and sustainability in Harrisonburg and beyond. All this while putting uniquely delicious food on your plate!

Risks & Challenges

Opening any business faces risks and obstacles to success. A food business has the added pressure of requiring significant investment just to get the doors open. Acquiring sufficient start-up funds is our largest obstacle and we are working to minimize the amount of loans we need to take out. One way we are keeping our costs down is by operating using counter-service; this allows us to keep our staff size small while sticking to our commitment of only hiring employees when we are able to compensate them fairly. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you'll make a contribution to our campaign, however small or large. Ready to sacrifice that one latte and put that $5 to our campaign? We'll take it! Got a little more flexibility in your wallet? We've got some really fabulous perks for you. 

Here's the truth: what we need more than anything is financial resources to see through our renovations and acquire our initial inventory and necessary equipment. We also know some of you can't make a financial donation. Additional ways to support us:

  • Make some noise! Share our campaign on your social media networks and encourage friends to make a contribution however big or small. Use the Indiegogo share tools. Personalize an email to your friends and tell them why you want to see Gray Jay Provisions open in Harrisonburg and ask them to make a contribution. 
  • Contact us if you have any equipment, time, or skills that you'd be willing to share with us. In July we'll be working hard on renovating our space and it will be all hands on deck.

Thanks for rooting for us - we can't wait to see you in the shop.
