Make some noise! Share our campaign on your social media networks and encourage friends to make a contribution however big or small. Use the Indiegogo share tools. Personalize an email to your friends and tell them why you want to see Gray Jay Provisions open in Harrisonburg and ask them to make a contribution. 
Contact us if you have any equipment, time, or skills that you'd be willing to share with us. In July we'll be working hard on renovating our space and it will be all hands on deck.

Thanks for rooting for us - we can't wait to see you in the shop.

story:
About me...

Hello! My name is Maria Rotella and I am the owner and operator of Maria Eliana’s Cakes!

I’ve been making custom cakes and desserts for families and loved ones in Syracuse for over 10 years. Thanks to my many repeat customers I’ve been able to build up my portfolio, make new connections and have flexible time to spend with my two kids. I have always been known as a worker.  From retail to waitressing, working for big corporations to small businesses I’ve truly done it all. My passion has always been desserts and the food industry. I studied and received a degree in Baking and Pastry Arts. After many long years of practicing and perfecting my skills and learning from others, I am finally able to take the leap and open a storefront. I want my space to be welcoming and inviting for all who come in to grab a quick bite with friends or family. 

I have grown up here in Syracuse NY. I have loved to bake since I was eight. As elementary school kids, my friends and I would go to College For Kids at O.C.C and each pick a class we wanted to take, from book writing to tie-dyeing classes we tried it all. I remember one friend picked a baking class and that’s when it began for me. We learned how to do the basic frosting of cupcakes, how to make cookies and some of the science of baking. That was it, I was in love.  After camp was over, I would lock my entire family out of our kitchen to bake and make a floury mess of my mother's very tidy kitchen.  When my mother had enough of that, she would send me to my aunt's house down the street where together we would bake new creations while keeping to our roots of boxed brownies and ‘Trading Spaces’ Wednesdays. We would sit on her porch tasting our creations and talk about the future. I knew I wanted to make desserts for a living, I would tell her I wanted to move to the most glamorous place I knew of at the time, NYC, and never get married or have children and open in a bakery. I told her when I made it big she would have to come to visit me and paint a picture on my wall. Well I never made it to NYC, and I have two amazing kids who are my world. My amazing rock, my helper, and biggest fan my Aunt Missy has been gone for 3 years and I’m not sure I’ll ever be the same. I want to make her proud of me and I want to finally get out there and stop working 3 jobs at a time and do what I really love. 

2018 My Year of Change 

I met and fell hard for my partner one very unexpected day. She has opened my eyes to a whole world of acceptance love and understanding but most importantly sustainability. My Nessie is very much an environmentalist who has taught me so much about how to help save our planet more than I knew. I have followed in her footsteps to try to be as zero waste as I can be. I strive to not use single-use plastic products such as cups, straws, forks, spoons, knives and plates. We shop at the farmers market instead of the store where we can pick our produce and not wrapped in plastic. I honestly never realized how much plastic I use on a day to day basis and I knew it was bad, but never understood to the degree how serious the issue is in regards to our planet.

 

One of the biggest goal for my business is to be as eco- friendly and as plastic free as possible.  I want to mainly recycle and compost any waste over throwing things into the trash that will end up in a landfill. I also want to give back to the town I love by donating leftover food to the many people in our community who go without food. Cafe Pastel will be  a safe space for anyone who may need it. I want to make a positive change to Syracuse in any way that I can. 

I am looking into Indiegogo as a way to offset the already growing expense. I hope to have things up and running by October 2019. With a location that is perfect for me and construction already underway the expenses of opening a coffee shop are a lot more than I thought!

My Vision 

My hope for Cafe Pastel is to be a welcoming and safe environment for all individuals. I have spent time on my menu and I am looking forward to working with vendors around Syracuse to provide you the best options to start your day. I have a few vendors in mind but am waiting to announce them all so you definitely want to stay tuned!  I want to use all my time and energy on the desserts side of the business so using trusted Syracuse favorites for breakfast allows me to do that! I already use the freshest ingredients in my baking and that won't be changing. 

I really want to be more involved with is our local community. One way I hope to contribute will be by donating my leftover food. There are several places in our town to drop off food to those who may need it most. Hunger in our area is a huge issue that needs to be resolved. While it may not be resolved this week or next I want to help. 

I will be going plastic free. What good is getting rid of the straws if we still have the plastic cups, cutlery and containers? I will be using alternative products that are better for our earth. Bamboo cutlery, to-go cardboard boxes instead of plastic, and paper bags. 

 

 

 

What we need: 

 

 New Oven $4,200- Now that I’m in a bigger space I need a bigger oven! A convection oven is more efficient than a regular home oven. Things cook faster so they don’t have to be in the oven as long. They also heat more evenly than a regular oven so there are no “hot spots” 

 

Espresso Machine $8,000  - Did you know that espresso machines can cost anywhere from $7000 - 20,000, I definitely didn't when I decided to expand my bakery idea to a cafe. I’m really happy to have met and befriend Maria Metthe of Salt City Coffee. She has helped me get together the costs of the coffee side of this business. I am going into this smart and getting a really awesome machine without breaking the bank. This price doesn’t include the cost of a grinder, brewer, decaf equipment, nitro equipment, pour over, kettles for hot water, honestly it goes on. Thanks girl for opening my eyes to the coffee world and steering me in the right direction. 

 

Commercial Mixer $1,700 - For the past 10 years my 5-quart little red mixer has been a champ. I’ve used it for everything! With a growing business I need something much bigger. For example; making one small tiered cake to feed 30 people from start to finish required me to make batter 2 times. It required me to make frosting anywhere from 3 or 4 times. That’s 6 times starting over from scratch (kinda like this indiegogo campaign) to get a final product. Not only was it a long process but it hasn't been the best use of my time and energy. A commercial mixer will allow me to get everything done faster and more efficiently.

 

Custom Wooden Bar $2,300 - Craig Donnelly is a rock star. (Definitely look up his work on IG- @donnellydesigns315) I will be working with him to make a wooden bar for patrons to sit at and hang out. I love to support all the local talent that Syracuse has to offer. I am really happy I got to know him and his family through the “fruit lady” as my children referred to her I can’t wait to see what he has in store for the cafe. 

 

Furniture $3,700 - Along with many soon to be patrons donating tables and chairs to re-purpose we need some basic staple furniture for out guests. We have been looking all over the Greater Syracuse area for tables and chairs to flip and reuse. This really helps our budget immensely. 

 

Grease Trap $1,500 - Gross I know. In brief, this little plumbing device helps trap most greases and solids before they enter the waste water disposal system. We’ve spent many years and a LOT of money to clean up Onondaga Lake. Now the county doesn’t mess around with business that could potentially ruin that hard work, and I get it. I am really fortunate that I am not a full fledged restaurant and don’t need a huge box that can cost up to $9,000. But with cooking breakfast sandwiches *cough cough dat bacon* I need a small one to keep our environment free of the gross grease and crap. 

 

If by any chance I happen to go over my proposed capital I would not only be so grateful, thankful, blessed, shocked, happy, on cloud 9 I would also be able to take my dream a bit farther. I would use the money wisely. I have so many big ticket items I need to purchase to get this dream started. I would love to get a storefront sign you can see from the highway to get more people to see I am here. I would get more of the equipment I need to get started like freezers, and a fridge. It would help me start to pay off the hefty loan I am taking to start my dream. Any monetary contributions 100% go to all the things I need to getting this going!

 

Total Amount Needed $21,400

5% Indiegogo fees + 2% CC fees $1,498

 

Full total  $22,898

 

 

The Impact

 

This project is really important to me. Not only on a “Hey look mom I made it” level but for the environment contribution I hope to make. I really want to change the way people think about single use plastic. Curbing peoples mindset away from always getting the iced coffee in the plastic cup with a straw. Or the plastic clamshell container for the salad that you throw out.  I hope to show people that small changes in habits around the way we consume plastic can greatly impact the environment in a positive way.  Moss Cass is believed to have said: "We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children". I want to start a positive change on a local scale and hope that you'll join me. I'd like to measure my success by focusing on the triple bottom line: people, profit, and planet.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

This is the part I get worried about if I’m being totally honest. I have been actively working on this dream since April and I have my location secure. I will be opening in Township 5 with an opening date tentatively for the middle of October. Not only is this a prime location for what I want but I know what it’s like to work there. I love knowing I'll be 10 steps away from friends who have been supportive from the get-go. From the Movie Tavern where people can stop in for dessert or before a date. From apartments and Medical offices where people may need a pick me up in the afternoon. All these things make me confident in my decision that this is a perfect location. The only setbacks I am nervous about is the time it takes to build out. I don’t want to miss out on every bakers busy season. The Holidays. I really hope to stick to this timeline and open in the fall. 

 

I know it’s a lot to ask, but with your monetary help this dream can and will become my life. If money is tight and trust me I get it, and you still want to help you can help me so much by sharing this link! Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, with your friends and family, with your work friends. Maybe someone will take interest in my project and be able to contribute. Sharing is caring and the more people see this the more I am closer to my dream. If you know someone who wants to contribute but doesn't have social media or are not computer savvy they can contact me directly and make a donation! Thank you, thank you, thank you for taking the time to read this and learn a little bit about me and what I'm trying to do. 

 

If you have other ideas you think might be helpful or may contribute to my mission please let me know I am here and willing to try whatever you got!

 

Thank You For Being A Friend 

 

I am truly blown away by the out pour of love and support I have received by so many during this journey thus far. I owe a HUGE thank you but not limited to these few individuals who have been here since the start of everything in April. 

 

Aubry Panek- I have loved working with you and learning from you the past few years, I remember my first time meeting you at your store opening  in the village for Witty Wicks what feels like forever ago! Through the years making desserts for the store and selling LuLaRoe we became friends. After feeling so defeated, not only did you help make me feel better with your words of encouragement but you really propelled me to where I am today. You gave me the Township 5 property managers personal number and here we are months later! Thank you so much for all your help these past few months. I can't wait to be your neighbor!

               

Danielle Rafte- The most patient listener to my wants and needs for how I want the logo, menu. and website to look. Thanks for sitting in my hot sauna of a kitchen after a long work day to work with me while I was baking. I seriously couldn't have done this without you! I'm so glad we've grown closer outside of high school!

 

Sara Felice- An amazing friend and photographer! Thank you for taking some incredible shots of me to start this campaign and use for my business! Now the Managing Director at Point of Contact Gallery in Armory Square she runs the show and is amazing at it! 

 

Dan Fetter-  Another Westill Alum, thank you for working with me getting my LLC up and running. Looking out for my best interest with lease signing and just overall being an awesome business lawyer. I wanted to make sure I did everything by the book and he was so easy to work with for someone who gets most of their law information from Olivia Benson and her friends. 

 

Katrina Tulloch- Thank you for taking the time to come over and shoot a video for me! You were fabulous to work with. Thanks for understanding I am horrible in front of the camera w my Chander Bing smile and Dory brain always forgetting what I needed to say! 

 

Sue Lepak-  This kick- ass architect not only did what I needed she gave me 3 design ideas to work off of! She was patient and understood my needs. I'm so happy to have met you and have you along for my journey!

 

Maria Metthe- This mompreneur is so awesome I came right home and proclaimed "I want to be her friend!!!" Owner at Salt City Roaster with her husband she will be our main coffee supplier. They are creating a new blend to use just for the cafe, how cool is that? She has really taught me so much about roasting styles and equipment I'll need. I cannot wait to work with their team!

 

Craig Donnelly- I know we haven’t officially met yet but thank you! When I reached out for this project I was really thinking you would not want to be involved. We didn’t know each other, it’s a lot of work, you have a growing business as well! Well I’m really pumped you are on board! I think this is going to be the beginning of a great friendship! 

 

Becca Gonnella-  This dream I have wanted for forever, you knew that. You always know what I'm thinking and how anxious I get about things. You always pushed me to do my dream. Thank you for helping get this started. For being there for meetings and brainstorming. I can't wait to see this dream unfold into my life. For the past 12 years you have watched me grow as a crazy teen to a crazy adult and have always been there no matter what. Thank you for not only believing in me and my vision but telling me too. Sometimes you need to hear it and you my friend, have always given me the confidence to go for it! 

 

Marines Piney- My Nessie. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for being such an amazing rock. This has been a crazy few months of stress, tears, tantrums (this computer part was a true test!) Thank you for taking everything in stride, talking me off the ledge many times and just believing in me. You made me keep going when I wanted to quit and held my hand on the days when I couldn't see the light at the end of the tunnel and get excited. I can't wait for you to see my journey and be there the day I open the doors.
story_txt:
About me...
Hello! My name is Maria Rotella and I am the owner and operator of Maria Eliana’s Cakes!

I’ve been making custom cakes and desserts for families and loved ones in Syracuse for over 10 years. Thanks to my many repeat customers I’ve been able to build up my portfolio, make new connections and have flexible time to spend with my two kids. I have always been known as a worker.  From retail to waitressing, working for big corporations to small businesses I’ve truly done it all. My passion has always been desserts and the food industry. I studied and received a degree in Baking and Pastry Arts. After many long years of practicing and perfecting my skills and learning from others, I am finally able to take the leap and open a storefront. I want my space to be welcoming and inviting for all who come in to grab a quick bite with friends or family. 
I have grown up here in Syracuse NY. I have loved to bake since I was eight. As elementary school kids, my friends and I would go to College For Kids at O.C.C and each pick a class we wanted to take, from book writing to tie-dyeing classes we tried it all. I remember one friend picked a baking class and that’s when it began for me. We learned how to do the basic frosting of cupcakes, how to make cookies and some of the science of baking. That was it, I was in love.  After camp was over, I would lock my entire family out of our kitchen to bake and make a floury mess of my mother's very tidy kitchen.  When my mother had enough of that, she would send me to my aunt's house down the street where together we would bake new creations while keeping to our roots of boxed brownies and ‘Trading Spaces’ Wednesdays. We would sit on her porch tasting our creations and talk about the future. I knew I wanted to make desserts for a living, I would tell her I wanted to move to the most glamorous place I knew of at the time, NYC, and never get married or have children and open in a bakery. I told her when I made it big she would have to come to visit me and paint a picture on my wall. Well I never made it to NYC, and I have two amazing kids who are my world. My amazing rock, my helper, and biggest fan my Aunt Missy has been gone for 3 years and I’m not sure I’ll ever be the same. I want to make her proud of me and I want to finally get out there and stop working 3 jobs at a time and do what I really love. 

2018 My Year of Change 
I met and fell hard for my partner one very unexpected day. She has opened my eyes to a whole world of acceptance love and understanding but most importantly sustainability. My Nessie is very much an environmentalist who has taught me so much about how to help save our planet more than I knew. I have followed in her footsteps to try to be as zero waste as I can be. I strive to not use single-use plastic products such as cups, straws, forks, spoons, knives and plates. We shop at the farmers market instead of the store where we can pick our produce and not wrapped in plastic. I honestly never realized how much plastic I use on a day to day basis and I knew it was bad, but never understood to the degree how serious the issue is in regards to our planet.
 
One of the biggest goal for my business is to be as eco- friendly and as plastic free as possible.  I want to mainly recycle and compost any waste over throwing things into the trash that will end up in a landfill. I also want to give back to the town I love by donating leftover food to the many people in our community who go without food. Cafe Pastel will be  a safe space for anyone who may need it. I want to make a positive change to Syracuse in any way that I can. 
I am looking into Indiegogo as a way to offset the already growing expense. I hope to have things up and running by October 2019. With a location that is perfect for me and construction already underway the expenses of opening a coffee shop are a lot more than I thought!

My Vision 
My hope for Cafe Pastel is to be a welcoming and safe environment for all individuals. I have spent time on my menu and I am looking forward to working with vendors around Syracuse to provide you the best options to start your day. I have a few vendors in mind but am waiting to announce them all so you definitely want to stay tuned!  I want to use all my time and energy on the desserts side of the business so using trusted Syracuse favorites for breakfast allows me to do that! I already use the freshest ingredients in my baking and that won't be changing. 
I really want to be more involved with is our local community. One way I hope to contribute will be by donating my leftover food. There are several places in our town to drop off food to those who may need it most. Hunger in our area is a huge issue that needs to be resolved. While it may not be resolved this week or next I want to help. 
I will be going plastic free. What good is getting rid of the straws if we still have the plastic cups, cutlery and containers? I will be using alternative products that are better for our earth. Bamboo cutlery, to-go cardboard boxes instead of plastic, and paper bags. 
 
 


 
What we need:   New Oven $4,200- Now that I’m in a bigger space I need a bigger oven! A convection oven is more efficient than a regular home oven. Things cook faster so they don’t have to be in the oven as long. They also heat more evenly than a regular oven so there are no “hot spots”  Espresso Machine $8,000  - Did you know that espresso machines can cost anywhere from $7000 - 20,000, I definitely didn't when I decided to expand my bakery idea to a cafe. I’m really happy to have met and befriend Maria Metthe of Salt City Coffee. She has helped me get together the costs of the coffee side of this business. I am going into this smart and getting a really awesome machine without breaking the bank. This price doesn’t include the cost of a grinder, brewer, decaf equipment, nitro equipment, pour over, kettles for hot water, honestly it goes on. Thanks girl for opening my eyes to the coffee world and steering me in the right direction.  Commercial Mixer $1,700 - For the past 10 years my 5-quart little red mixer has been a champ. I’ve used it for everything! With a growing business I need something much bigger. For example; making one small tiered cake to feed 30 people from start to finish required me to make batter 2 times. It required me to make frosting anywhere from 3 or 4 times. That’s 6 times starting over from scratch (kinda like this indiegogo campaign) to get a final product. Not only was it a long process but it hasn't been the best use of my time and energy. A commercial mixer will allow me to get everything done faster and more efficiently. Custom Wooden Bar $2,300 - Craig Donnelly is a rock star. (Definitely look up his work on IG- @donnellydesigns315) I will be working with him to make a wooden bar for patrons to sit at and hang out. I love to support all the local talent that Syracuse has to offer. I am really happy I got to know him and his family through the “fruit lady” as my children referred to her I can’t wait to see what he has in store for the cafe.  Furniture $3,700 - Along with many soon to be patrons donating tables and chairs to re-purpose we need some basic staple furniture for out guests. We have been looking all over the Greater Syracuse area for tables and chairs to flip and reuse. This really helps our budget immensely.  Grease Trap $1,500 - Gross I know. In brief, this little plumbing device helps trap most greases and solids before they enter the waste water disposal system. We’ve spent many years and a LOT of money to clean up Onondaga Lake. Now the county doesn’t mess around with business that could potentially ruin that hard work, and I get it. I am really fortunate that I am not a full fledged restaurant and don’t need a huge box that can cost up to $9,000. But with cooking breakfast sandwiches *cough cough dat bacon* I need a small one to keep our environment free of the gross grease and crap.  If by any chance I happen to go over my proposed capital I would not only be so grateful, thankful, blessed, shocked, happy, on cloud 9 I would also be able to take my dream a bit farther. I would use the money wisely. I have so many big ticket items I need to purchase to get this dream started. I would love to get a storefront sign you can see from the highway to get more people to see I am here. I would get more of the equipment I need to get started like freezers, and a fridge. It would help me start to pay off the hefty loan I am taking to start my dream. Any monetary contributions 100% go to all the things I need to getting this going! 
Total Amount Needed $21,400

5% Indiegogo fees + 2% CC fees $1,498
 
Full total  $22,898
 
 
The Impact This project is really important to me. Not only on a “Hey look mom I made it” level but for the environment contribution I hope to make. I really want to change the way people think about single use plastic. Curbing peoples mindset away from always getting the iced coffee in the plastic cup with a straw. Or the plastic clamshell container for the salad that you throw out.  I hope to show people that small changes in habits around the way we consume plastic can greatly impact the environment in a positive way.  Moss Cass is believed to have said: "We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children". I want to start a positive change on a local scale and hope that you'll join me. I'd like to measure my success by focusing on the triple bottom line: people, profit, and planet. Risks & Challenges This is the part I get worried about if I’m being totally honest. I have been actively working on this dream since April and I have my location secure. I will be opening in Township 5 with an opening date tentatively for the middle of October. Not only is this a prime location for what I want but I know what it’s like to work there. I love knowing I'll be 10 steps away from friends who have been supportive from the get-go. From the Movie Tavern where people can stop in for dessert or before a date. From apartments and Medical offices where people may need a pick me up in the afternoon. All these things make me confident in my decision that this is a perfect location. The only setbacks I am nervous about is the time it takes to build out. I don’t want to miss out on every bakers busy season. The Holidays. I really hope to stick to this timeline and open in the fall. 
 
I know it’s a lot to ask, but with your monetary help this dream can and will become my life. If money is tight and trust me I get it, and you still want to help you can help me so much by sharing this link! Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, with your friends and family, with your work friends. Maybe someone will take interest in my project and be able to contribute. Sharing is caring and the more people see this the more I am closer to my dream. If you know someone who wants to contribute but doesn't have social media or are not computer savvy they can contact me directly and make a donation! Thank you, thank you, thank you for taking the time to read this and learn a little bit about me and what I'm trying to do.  If you have other ideas you think might be helpful or may contribute to my mission please let me know I am here and willing to try whatever you got!
 
Thank You For Being A Friend  I am truly blown away by the out pour of love and support I have received by so many during this journey thus far. I owe a HUGE thank you but not limited to these few individuals who have been here since the start of everything in April. 
 
Aubry Panek- I have loved working with you and learning from you the past few years, I remember my first time meeting you at your store opening  in the village for Witty Wicks what feels like forever ago! Through the years making desserts for the store and selling LuLaRoe we became friends. After feeling so defeated, not only did you help make me feel better with your words of encouragement but you really propelled me to where I am today. You gave me the Township 5 property managers personal number and here we are months later! Thank you so much for all your help these past few months. I can't wait to be your neighbor!

I'm so glad we've grown closer outside of high school!

I wanted to make sure I did everything by the book and he was so easy to work with for someone who gets most of their law information from Olivia Benson and her friends. 
 
Katrina Tulloch- Thank you for taking the time to come over and shoot a video for me! You were fabulous to work with. Thanks for understanding I am horrible in front of the camera w my Chander Bing smile and Dory brain always forgetting what I needed to say! 
 
Sue Lepak-  This kick- ass architect not only did what I needed she gave me 3 design ideas to work off of! She was patient and understood my needs. I'm so happy to have met you and have you along for my journey!

story:
Short Summary

Beyla Meadery was born out of dreams and a love of creating. We make traditional, historically-inspired and unique mead and ciders that are influenced by past traditions, the seasons and from our own imaginations. 

William the mead maker started making mead around 23 years ago. The only mead available at that time was a very sweet mead you got at Renaissance festivals. William worked at a craft brewery and had been a home brewer for sometime. With his vast knowledge and skill special mead and ciders were born.

These delicious creations were well-loved by friends and family. Down the road contests were entered and awards were won.

We create great meads and ciders using fresh local ingredients like quality honey and organic apples. This is the foundation that we build on. Unique mead and ciders are born by adding different spices, fruits, and botanicals. Special varieties of honey are used as well and are expressed in wonderful flavors. All of these come together in an orchestration to create a special product that clearly reflects our love for mead and cider.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need seed money. We need enough money to finish our licencing. After that we will focus on our equipment and production facility through loans and further investment.
  • We want you to become part of the Beyla family! By investing you are helping to bring a dream to life so we can get our creations to you.
  • We will be offering a chance to become active in the Beyla family by offering opportunities to be the first to receive our special creations, help create new ideas and to be the first to be notified about special offers and discounts.
  • Anyone that is interested in making a larger investment is welcomed to contact William to receive additional business information. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • We cannot do this without you.  We want this to not just be about our mead but our community and friends who helped us fulfill this dream.  
  • Making mead is our love and passion. We want to share this passion with you.
  • We are committed to sharing this great ancient beverage with the world.  Be a part of this and know that you are not only a member of our community, but you are also part of the Beyla family!

 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Some of the challenges we will face will be getting the word out about our products. We will be attending different tasting events like craft beverage festivals, bottle store tastings and larger cultural events. This will give us a chance to show the world what we make.
  • The availability of honey will be a challenge. Let's face it almost everyone has heard about the threat to bee colonies. Varroa mites to pesticides have been linked to Colony Collapse Disorder. We are addressing this by using some of our time to teach people about the importance of pollinators and making them aware of ways they can help. We will also be converting some of our acreage into bee-friendly habitats as well as setting up a Beyla apiary. Beyla Meadery will buy honey from local honey producers. This will help sustain local businesses and keep the interest in honey production going.  Beyla meadery will also be donating part of our profits to help non-profit organizations that are working on the preservation of pollinators. This is an investment into the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can give money.  We all work very hard and have to be very careful with where we invest.  If you cannot donate money then let others know about our campaign. 

  • I understand how it feels to work hard and still have to keep a close eye on finances. Not everybody has the extra money to invest. Believe me I get this. You still can be a part of Beyla by sharing our fundraiser page with friends.  Let people know we are here and are asking for help.
  • Sign up for notifications on our web page and come to events that we attend.
  • When you try our products let others know how much you like them.
  • Like our Facebook page and give us your insights and be a part of our circle of support!

story:
Short Summary

 

I'm so excited you stopped by. That's right, the time has come for us to move from food cart to restaurant in Southwest Atlanta!

 

Restaurants have become the Soul of Atlanta and Masons Super Dogs seeks to be on that list.   I did my research on the best places to eat. You cannot think of Atlanta without thinking of its many great places to eat from its street vendors and food trucks or its fast food to its fine dining Atlanta has it all. Mason’s Super Dogs was created to be apart of that legacy. Right up there with Bankhead Fish, Pascal's Restaurant, The beautiful, and This Is It. 

 

What is a Super Dog? It’s a unique twist on your traditional hot dog. First of all, it is a quarter-pound all-beef hot dog, broiled with my special seasoning and onions. Then topped with our gourmet topping. You are going to need a fork to eat these dogs. For you vegan lovers I have you covered.  We provide a huge vegan dog you are going to love.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

And now, I'm ready to come from the cart to a brick and mortar restaurant proving great food and a soulful atmosphere and I need $10,000.00 to make that happen.

 

 

Why Now, Mason?

Why not!  I truly want to be the best restaurant in Southwest Atlanta. 

We want to bring back the excitement of going to your neighborhood restaurant and connecting through food. 

Mason’s Super Dogs Would be a place were students from the historical AUC could eat and study in a safe space. A place was community organizations could come to eat and get to know their neighbors. Simply put we want to be a staple in South West Atlanta.

 

 

I’m Mason Wright A 13-year-old street chef. I grew up in Georgia and had a love for science. Those kits would cost my mom hundreds of dollars. I wanted to earn money so I could buy my science kits myself. On a trip to NYC, I saw nothing but Hot Dog carts and superheroes. After tasting a couple of hot dogs. I knew I could do better. So I took the concept back to Atlanta. I’m here on Indiegogo to build my dream. Help Me Open Mason's Super Dogs 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

With every restaurant, there is a risk of failure. With great customer service,  quality ingredients, an aggressive marketing strategy in place and support from the community, we are optimistic that we will not be one of those restaurants that have to close their doors.

With great customer service,  quality ingredients, an aggressive marketing strategy in place and support from the community, we are optimistic that we will not be one of those restaurants that have to close their doors.

story:
Check out our website AromaChaiTea.com

Find us on Amazon or Etsy

With your support, we want to promote small-scale craft production. We hope to keep the culture alive by encouraging the next generation to continue the tradition.

By contributing to our campaign you share our hope that the centuries-old artisanal crafts will not disappear. 

Ivan Chai is a traditional fermented wellness tea. Ivan Chai is naturally caffeine-free and, unlike regular black, green or white teas, does not contain taurine, purine, oxalic or uric acids.

If you feel stuck in a tea routine and are looking for something a little more out of the ordinary than your average English Breakfast, give our Ivan Chai a try!

One of the differences between our Ivan Chai and conventional teas is that boiling water can be added to the same Ivan Chai brew up to four times and the tea won't lose its health benefits as well as flavor. It sure multiplies the number of servings in the bag.

We work directly with the families that produce our Ivan Chai and other items, which means:

  • We can guarantee that our Ivan Chai is made accordingly to the ancient traditions
  • All our products are 100% hand-made by small family businesses
  • We pay the families that produce our products a fair price
  • We know our products from the inside out because we don't pick what sells, we pick what we believe in. Ask us anything, and we will answer
  • We support, follow, and promote fair trade principles
  • As a small business ourselves, we encourage other small businesses and don't draw the borders, because we firmly believe that united we are strong

Ivan Chai naturally carries 16 amino acids and a significant amount of macronutrients such as potassium, sodium, calcium, and phosphorus. It is rich in vitamins B and C.

Ivan Chai is celebrated for its anti-inflammatory properties, so it is recommended for people with gastritis, colitis, gastric ulcers, and flatulence.

The bioflavonoids in Ivan Chai increase activity of antioxidant enzymes in the small intestines, liver, lungs, and the small bowel, which makes Ivan Chai an effective natural detoxifier. A concentrated brew of Ivan Chai remedies food or alcohol poisoning. 

Because Ivan Chai contains the oenothein B, it was shown to have healing effects on benign prostatic hyperplasia (BHP) and prostatic cancer when used as a complementary supplement.

Rich in magnesium, B vitamins, and flavonoids, Ivan Chai is well known for its ability to reduce anxiety and depression. Some herbalists even praise Ivan Chai as superior to the famous St. John’s Wort.

Going forward we plan to:

  • Launch our website AromaChaiTea.com
  • Bring in more unique medicinal herbs
  • Expand our birch bark crafts' inventory
  • Grow our range of distinct, artisanal teas beyond the few that we have now. 

We are very grateful that you are interested in our Ivan Chai!

If you like our campaign but can't contribute that doesn't mean that you can't help.

  • Share our campaign with your friends and family
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram
  • Email us at Info@AromaChaiTea.com to say "Hi!"
  • Wish us luck in the comments

We are thrilled to have you on board!

We want to thank all our friends and family members whose support and encouragement helped us make it thus far.

We also want to thank small businesses and individuals that volunteered their time, resources and expertize because they share our philosophy and want this campaign to be a success.

Please give a shout-out to Media Fervor, Cakes'N'Bakes, and Cajva.

Whenever a new product launches, there are always a few challenges. However, we did everything we can to limit the risks of this project.

Inventory: 
We believe that we secured enough inventory. Also, we made sure that we will be able to promptly restock. However, if there are any delays we will let you know.

Shipping: 
We will notify you when the product is shipped and provide with the shipping details. We are shipping from New Jersey and a package shouldn't be in transit for more than a week. 

Our target shipping starting date is December 27, 2018, once the Indiegogo campaign is over. We plan to have all perks shipped out before the end of January 2019.

* This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

story:
Oz'NBones has brought bangin' southern barbecue up north to Colchester, CT. Run by Chris & Diane Ozmun. We specialize in authentic and artisan barbecue. Everything is made from scratch using only the finest ingredients including  our barbecue sauces and our own award winning dry rub.  We think it's too good not to share - in fact,  our barbecue rub placed second in the National Barbecue News "Rubs of Honor" competition in the Fall of 2017.   Oz'NBones BBQ was voted 2nd Runner Up in Hartford Magazine's "BEST OF" Awards in Spring of 2019 and 2nd Place in the CTNOW "Best of Awards" in June. An amazing feat considering Oz'NBones Food Truck was only established last year. 

Our  own homemade barbecue sauces are no joke, either. We've got our  original sauce, a sweet and tangy Kansas City style sauce. Then there's  our sweet Maple Bourbon, made with superior bourbon and organic Grade A  robust maple syrup from the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont.  Finally, our  spicy Chipotle Sriracha infused with chipotle peppers and original  sriracha sauce has got a little kick and a lot of flavor.  Because  they're unlike any other sauces out there, we've been told countless  times we need to spread the love -  that's why we're going to have our  rub and sauces commercially bottled and sold at local stores so that  people can enjoy them at home. It's no small task - bottling and  ingredients have to be of the highest quality and making the first run  happen takes a lot of bacon, so-to-speak.

OzNBones  isn't just something we do for fun (although we'll admit that's a big  part of it) - we're serious about our barbecue.  That's why you'll find  our food truck located at the corner of Broadway and Clark Lane in  Colchester serving up our tasty meats and sides, when we aren't catering  or providing food truck service at private events. 

The  demand for Oz'NBones has been nothing short of amazing - we've been in  business since April 2017 and have been smoking' the whole time.  Business has  grown out of Chris’ passion for cooking and especially for cooking  authentic southern BBQ. We fell in love with BBQ when visiting Chris’  older brother while he was stationed in the Army in Tennessee over 20  years ago. Chris learned the craft of smoking and barbecue, and has been  perfecting his recipes since then.  All of our recipes are his own  original creations, and everything is made from scratch using fresh  ingredients.  Some say he's a bit obsessed; we won't argue with that.

Chris  spent his high school, college and grad school years working in  restaurants and in the food industry. He started as a bus boy then  worked as a waiter, bartender, and a cook/chef.  He took a brief haitus  from the culinary world to have a successful career in school  administration, but once he got that out of his system it was back to  the barbecue.

Oz'NBones  caters for graduation parties, birthday parties, rehearsal dinners,  weddings, and many other events. We provide our food truck at several  different food festivals, concerts, microbreweries, and much more.  With  your help, we'll continue to grow and expand, and share our home-grown flavors with more barbecue enthusiasts like you.  

THANK YOU

story: .......

Capital Chicken and Waffles is Expanding

Capital Chicken and Waffles is the area’s premier chicken and waffles food truck and we have been serving the nation’s capital since January 2013 The truck brings the classic combo of chicken and waffles, to a city that was desperate for a taste of the South.

We also cater for many events such as weddings, parties, private functions and many more. We have since grown to work many big events in and around Washington, DC.

We are family owned and operated and have been featured on Fox5, NFL Network and in Black Enterprise.

We just purchased our 2nd truck but it needs a few more modifications before its ready to hit the streets. We only have 6 weeks until we launch so that's why we need your help to get a lot done in a little bit of time.

We are halfway there. We just need a little help so that we're ready to launch by March 2017, and bring you the good food that you love in more places.

We still need, the MD, DC, and VA inspections to be done, a griddle, an extra fryer, food warmers, a fire suppression system, a cash register, a refrigerator and a truck wrap.

We are still needing $7356 to get all of this done. All donations over $20 get 30% off their purchase. Over $45 gets a free meal and over $70 gets a free meal and their name will be displayed on the truck

Please help us so we can keep delivering great service to all our loyal customers, and so we can continue supporting our community.

story:
The impact

If you are vegan, are considering being vegan, want to eat vegan food every now then, then you will be contributing to a cause that is aligned with you. As an architect I have spent the last 4 years creating and help create designs on paper and then manifest them into their physical form. My vision is strong, and I have the character to make it thrive.

We hope our vegan community supports us as we aim to dispel vegan myths and have others who are not yet vegan, get a glimpse into a life they can see themselves living.

The fundraising goal is £90,000, and this is because we want to have a 28 seater, approximately  100sqm with a total of 7 staff members and 4 working per shift. We will be open from 8am to 9pm and serving throughout.

  • The rent of the site will be £35,000 to £45,000 per annum for a site in East london, either Hackney, Dalston or Shroeditch.
  • The refurb and kitchen equipment cost is approximately £35,000 
  • remainder of the contribution will go on first months stock and salaries.

 

The food: chickpea curry

The Beverages: Selection of teas

The Cakes: Chocolate shortbread

 

The perks 'Chick please' Charactures

I have designed vegan and chickpea related memes that we find very amusing and put them on stickers, posters, tote bags and t-shirts. I have a background in art, so drawing up the designs were a lot of fun for me

 

Characture no.1 'Chick please'

Characture no.2 'Chick protection'

 

Characture no.3 'Chick protein'

 

Characture no.4 'Chick peas & legumes'

 

Characture no.5 'Complete protein'

 

Characture no.6 'Chick grabber'

 

Characture no.7 'Chickpea vs Chickpea'

 

Characture no.8 'Chickbae'

 

Characture no.9 'Chick wig'

 

 

Characture no.10 'Mofo'

 

Characture no.11 'Bitch peas'

 

 

Characture no.10 'Pea on a tea'

Sticker Pack

 

Full length Video

 

Risks and challenges 

The restaurant industry sees a lot of start ups go out of businesses within their first year, reasons can vary and be due to a lack of:

  • not managing or mastering the accounts
  • assessment of food, drink production and wasteage
  • community impact and support
  • monitoring and managing maintenance and supply systems
  • consistently create a pleasing interior experience
  • empowering the employees
  • risk assessments and anticipation of the market

We intend on thriving through all theses challenges to bring the public the best possible food, beverages and experience

Even funding a few pound is significant, but if you are not able to. Sharing this link to others, in person or on your social media will do nothing but good for Chick Peas & Teas.

 

Thank you for your time and patience.

story:
So What is Lemonwell?

Lemonwell is vapor distilled water mixed with a hint of freshly squeezed organic lemon juice. Our unique mixture will not only quench your thirst but also provide you with many health benefits. Did you know ¼ cup of lemon juice provides 30% more of your recommended vitamin C daily need. This is one among many reasons why we took that satisfying taste of lemon water and packaged it in a stylish, and aspirational bottle.

Our Mission

At Lemonwell, our mission is to improve society’s health and instill a message that perfection starts from within. We believe in order to reach our personal and health goals, it starts internally – meaning letting external factors weight into our goals can be detrimental. This belief kept us motivated to create Lemonwell. We want society to understand that we’re all perfect, and that feeling of “perfection” is as simple as selecting a health-conscious beverage over an artificial beverage.

So Why Lemon Water?

Lemonwell is a great health-conscious beverage. Lemon water is a simple, refreshing, and a restorative drink. It is best taken first thing in the morning, throughout the day, or during times of illness. It offers a healthy alternative to caffeine-packed tea, coffee, or sugary drinks like soda and juice. The vitamins and antioxidants can add a light but revitalizing boost of energy. The alkalizing and detoxifying elements in lemon water help keep your body functioning smoothly. Drinking lemon water can improve skin, increase your metabolism, and provide a surplus of vitamin C.

Lemon Water Benefits

Bottle Architecture

Lemonwell's bottle structure has been designed to be stylish, aspirational, and to communicate health and well-being. The sculpted bottle signifies a premium positioning. For instance, the bottle shape is ergonomically easier to use while training or playing sports. The wide neck bottle allows for easy consumption compared to competitor bottles. The transparent form allows consumers to see the purity of the drink – meaning nothing is hidden and the clean label reassures consumers of all natural ingredients. The bottle stands at 120 mm high, providing not only maximum visibility in stores and health environments but also fitting into gym and sports bags.

Our Process

Our process consists of four important steps:

  1. PlastiPure-safe validation
  2. Extracting  juice from USDA certified organic lemons
  3. Vapor Distillation process
  4. Cold Press Technology

 

We’re Different – Here’s Why:

What separates Lemonwell from our competitors is our mission, nutritional value, and process. In order to prove were different, we conducted a nutritional variance analysis.

Orange vs. Lemon

In comparison to an orange, lemon juice has lower calories and almost the same amounts of vitamin C production. If your interested in losing weight, lemon juice is a better alternative because it's low calorie level will be a lot easier to burn off. 

 

 

Lemon Juice vs. Sports Beverage

Moving on to another competitor, we compared lemon juice to different sports beverages. We found that lemon juice is (again) the lower calorie beverage. Throughout our analysis, ironically, we found that lemon juice has less calories among our competitors but offers similar benefits. To explain, lemon juice can boost your energy levels because negative ions increase the flow of oxygen - resulting to more energy and a better mood.

 

Why We Need You?

We’re a team that is passionate about improving the health and wellness of our community. We believe that you play an integral role in our mission and development of Lemonwell. By supporting us, you will help build the basis for a clean, all natural beverage that the health industry is missing.

If you are ready to join this exciting journey with us, please support our campaign and spread the word! A few clicks from you will make a big difference for us.

We need your help to get a lot done in a little bit of time.We are still needing $3750 to get it done. All donations over $20 get 30% off their purchase. Over $45 gets a free meal and over $70 gets a free meal and their name will be displayed on the truckPlease help us so we can keep delivering great service to all our loyal customers, and so we can continue supporting our community.

story:
*** Our IndieGoGo Campaign has ended, but the Bature Brewery reward package is still available. Just email baturebrewery@gmail.com for more details***

 

 

The Bature Story

Bature Brewery is Nigeria’s first Craft Brewery. Inspired by the Naija hustle and a passion for creating unique beers using local ingredients, we want to bring great beer to West Africa. 

 Kevin Conroy, Andrew Seward and James Turley came to Africa with a passion for development, boundless optimism and a good dose of innocence. We've invested as much time, effort and cash as we could to build  a craft brewery in Nigeria, and we're asking for a little help from you all for that final push to make it a reality.

We quickly fell in love with Nigeria, it’s flavours and tastes, the country's endless ability to surprise, and a culture of surviving against the odds. Being the beer-lovers that we are, we spent many an hour lamenting the world's problems over a few pints of beer. But we quickly became bored and frustrated with drinking bland, mass-produced lager that gave us nothing but a bad aftertaste and an even worse hangover.

It dawned on us that there was only one solution: build a brewery.

 

The Brewery

Starting with a small home-brewing set-up, we brewed by night and at weekends, experimenting with Nigerian flavours and bringing craft beer to friends and converts around Abuja. 

Realising that we couldn't keep up with demand. we took the step of backing ourselves and investing in the country's first micro-brewery, equipped and established in the nation's capital, Abuja. After renovations, installations and equipment upgrade we're nearly ready to officially launch in our shiny new brew site, but now we need your help to turn the dream of West Africa's first craft brewery into reality.

 

The Campaign

We're asking for your support to help us lead the craft beer revolution here in Nigeria.

We've set an ambitious target of £15,000 which we must reach for the campaign to be successful.  And we only have 30 days to do it!

These funds will help the brewery get off to a flying start and enable us to deliver the following:

i) 2 New Fermentation Tanks bringing capacity up to 7000 bottles per month

ii) 3 x Kegerator units plus Kegs- The FIRST DRAFT CRAFT in NIGERIA

iii) The Bature Promotional Team - Our Marketing Angels will be bringing "hoppiness"  (that is beer with lots and lots of 'hoppy' flavour) to more beer lovers across Abuja

 

The Rewards

Bature fans are global, and we've developed a range of options to reward backers in Nigeria, UK and further a-field.

The Founders' Beer (Ships Globally) -  All our backers, large or small should be in on the action. That's why we've created the Founders' Beer to thank you for your support. Your name will feature on this limited edition brew. All backers in Nigeria will receive a voucher exchangeable for 1 Founders' Beer, whilst our International Fans will receive copies of the label artwork and our latest Bature branding and designs.

Drink Beer, Keep Bottle, Be Part of Something Unique

Bature Gear (Ships Globally) - The design team have been busy creating Bature Brewery merchandise so you can share in a piece of the African craft beer revolution, wherever you are. We'll reward our supporters with a range of Bature merchandise.

The Bature Launch Party

We've been known to throw a decent party in our time, and this is no exception. We're formally opening our new Brew Site in 2017 with a launch party in Abuja. Plenty of beer, BBQ and good times to be had. Ensure you get your invite by pledging £50 or more.

Bature Experiences 

We're the hottest new arrival on the Abuja scene, so naturally we're inviting you - our champions - to join us as the first guests at Bature Brewery. Pledges of over £100 will receive an invitation to an exclusive Brewery Tour and Tasting Session for yourselves and up to three friends.

Aspiring brewers amongst you can join us for a dedicated session on Brew-Day where we walk you through the time-honored tradition of all-grain craft brewing, topped up with a tasting session.

Our UK backers shouldn't miss out. We'll host a Bature Brewing session and BBQ in London, so you can learn the ropes and catch-up on our progress.

Discounts on Bature Beer

We know that many of you have been patiently waiting for great beer that's Made in Nigeria. So we're throwing in a range of discounts so those first beers go down extra smooth.

For backers over £100, you've earnt yourself a cold brew. As part of your reward package we'll ensure you're set-up with your own starter pack to enjoy at home.

 

Challenges

Nobody said doing business in Nigeria was going to be easy, but the reward is in seeing our vision of craft beer in West Africa take shape. Challenges have come from every angle: from sourcing ingredients, to setting up a bank account, to keeping our beers cold, we've had to find ways to build a business in a tough environment.

But by adopting the resourcefulness, work ethic and good humour that's abundant across West Africa, we've overcome these challenges, and are ready to take more on. We expect to be at the forefront of Nigeria's advancing economy, the first-movers in a new artisanal industry which can stimulate new jobs and opportunities.

The Future

This is the beginning of a new era in the African brewing scene. Micro-breweries are popping up across the continent, and beer-lovers finally have a choice in front of them. Bature has ambitious plans for Nigeria and beyond, and we'd love to have you along for the ride.

story:
Short Summary

Offbeat Brewery is run by me, Michelle Shipman - head brewer, sales, marketing, deliveries, bar person, the works!  It was established here in Crewe in 2010 and changes were made to the site in 2016 incorporating a bar with the brewery kit alongside rather than in a separate business unit.  I've been brewing for 11 years, previously at the Failford Inn, Ayrshire, and have a wall of certificates and awards to my name.  I'm passionate about beer, brewing and the community that I love being a part of.

It sounds dramatic but saving the drainage will save the brewery.  

What We Need & What You Get

The total repair bill is looking at around £7000 of which I've got about £2000 so far and some of the local bands that play in the bar are looking at a fundraising acoustic music event on 7th October to help us out.  We're hoping to meet the shortfall here through crowd funding on Indiegogo.

Everyone who makes a contribution to Offbeat Brewery will get recognition on the website  as well as my undying gratitude. You will get first dibs on special events and opportunities at the brewery. You will have access to  a special, limited edition 'thank you' brew that nobody else will be able to get their hands on - it'll probably have a snazzier name by the time its brewed!

For larger contributions, there are T-shirts, beer subscriptions, brewing experiences, parties - and beer. See the list on the column on the right for details.

The Impact

Offbeat has built up a great following in Crewe and a small place in the brewing community, I love being involved in events round the town, my heart belongs here, I can't imagine doing anything else.  We're giving you a chance to be a part of this, to support the brewery and see it continue.  Are you one of the hundreds of people who visit #FirstyFriday and love the bands, beers and some how having a great night drinking in a car park?  Don't lose it.

Risks & Challenges

I've always been really open about things at Offbeat Brewery, it's a bit of a roller coaster at times but I'm determined to pull through this, get through the scary bits for the highs, thrills and good times again.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know financial donations aren't always possible, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help by getting the word out about this fundraising campaign. Please share the link to this page with friends or anyone you think might want to contribute - every little bit counts, even if all you do is read or leave a comment.

story:
After 7 years of Research and Development, we are releasing the Healthiest & Coolest Superfoods!

Our Technology

We have almost 8 years of Research and Development, time we have dedicated to do experiments in the lab, prototypes, and projects! Science is our best friend and it supports all our products! We produce everything you see below with natural and sustainable technology: free of solvents and toxics. 

We have published more than 20 scientific articles in recognized journals such as: Journal of Science of Food and Agriculture, Journal of Bioresource Technology, Journal of Algal Research, International Journal of Molecular Sciences among others. We also have filed 2 patents and received 5 innovation awards.

To keep it short, we cultivate different species of microalgae in Nuevo Leon, México. Microalgae love sun and high temperatures. Also, they clean the air by capturing carbon dioxide and producing oxygen into the atmosphere. After the cultivation process, we procede to harvest the microalgae cells and finally we extract the antioxidants, omegas and proteins you will find below.

Our Products

We have the best and more specialized superfoods you will hear about. And it is not because we say it, but science says it! Below you can find conventional superfoods and ours.

*In fact, Astaxanthin antioxidant activity is 2,800,000!! but it doesn´t fit in the image

These are our products

 

 

 

And finally, we have our most claimed invention, Bursting Pearls! If you are tired of the same old presentation of powder and pills you must try this new and patented product. You will have an explosion of flavors in your mouth with all the benefits of our superfoods!

 

Our Healthy Family

Since we really care about your health and we want to make a huge impact on the way we take care of your health, we are working together with Dietitians, Healthcoaches, Chefs, Health Influencers, Juice Bars, Natural shops, Food companies and Cosmetic companies. Step by step, our products will be accompanied by the expertise of these Health Leaders to make a big change in our nutrition. You can have a glance at them below!

Our Collaborations

We work with national and international universities and research centers to develop our products, but also with different companies and with our government!

 

Our Social Cause

It is very important for us to generate a huge impact in Mexico, not only by improving your Health, but also by supporting people with needs. In this sense, we are planning a collaboration with Rural Spirulina Farmers in San Luis Potosi. The institution in charge of this project is Desarrollo Rural de San Luis Pototsí A.C. They are growing Spirulina to enrich their food and to enrich their nutrition. Soon, we are planning to use the remaining Spirulina to make more products. They will have an extra income and you will have a product that comes from a Rural Spirulina Farm. We are planning to give training and also a harvesting system with one of the items of the rewards. Below you can find a video of how they grow Spirulina!

 

Use of Funding

We will use the money we collect for different purposes. Of course we will produce your reward, that comes first. In second place, we will buy some equipment we need to increase the production capacity we have now. Thirdly, we will make an awsome marketing strategy to change the way we see Health. And finally, we will buy some supplies for our facilities for the production of these superfoods!

 

Our Story

As all the good stories, this also starts at the basement, in this case, in a laboratory located in the basement of a Research Institute, back in 2010. When Gibrán was studying  the production of natural compounds during his Ph.D. program at Tec de Monterrey, he recognized the potential of microalgae as natural source of antioxidants, omegas and proteins. At the same time, Sara was studying her MSc. at Tec de Monterrey and both decided to join their knowledge. They both have been at Arizona State University (USA), Wageningen University (The Netherlands), and in Leuven University (Belgium). In total, more than 3.5 years in the most prestigous universitites on this field.

Our Awards

During this time, our Innovation & Technology has been recognized by 5 different Awards: Genera Monterrey 2011 (by Pase Usted), Hacerlo Mejor 2011 (by CIDAC), Sustainability Innovation Student Challenge Award 2013 (by The Dow Chemical Company), Green Business Award 2013 (by Sustainability Global Institute), and Top 15 Most Innovative Companies (by The Pitch).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
