story:
In head brewer Bill Bartman, software engineer Joel Bartman, and construction managers Aaron and Brian Franks, we have a quartet of highly skilled professionals whose areas of expertise cover all the key areas for this project.

With these skilled individuals and many friends, we’ve begun the remodel of a beautiful 100+ year-old building — the Lebanon Gem Theater — which has a fascinating history: a storied past dating back to before 1910 when it was host to live vaudeville entertainment and silent movies. We’d like to return the “Gem” to its original grandeur.  Up front, we have the pub and kitchen. In the middle is the perfect small-batch brewing area. And the back third is what time has left of the theater: seating with a stage for karaoke, live music and entertainment, big screen movies and sports. 

But to realize this grand adventure, we need your help! Here’s how to be a Founder/Sponsor and get some sweet perks. Check these out. You may choose one or mix and match.

 $10/year – Brewality (For a heightened sense of beer-reality.) Beer has a quality of wonderfulness — a summation of artistic and technical brilliance in liquid form. Help us realize this great adventure of making awesome beer, hearty food, and returning the Gem Theater to its glory. You’ll receive pride in helping launch Barsideous, a Barsideous sticker and a THANK YOU on all our social media platforms. We appreciate all the help we can get, and will show that by giving you a custom vinyl decal. Put it on your car, on your refrigerator, or anywhere else you want to proclaim your support of local craft beer! Not only will we be grateful, but the next time we brew, we will say something like, "Hey! Remember when [your name here] threw us a few bucks to help get this started? That was rad!" And we’ll give you a high-five (also available in firm handshake and fist bump).

 $25/year – The Pride and the Passion (Craft beer is wonderful, mystical, complex and creative.) The Pride and the Passion is a 1957 film starring Cary Grant, Frank Sinatra and Sophia Loren. At Barsideous we craft beer with passion, create food with pride. Show your pride and passion for craft beer and food by wearing your First Edition Barsideous T-shirt. You’ll receive that T-shirt plus all the Brewality swag. Wear your shirt with pride, knowing that you're helping bring great beer to an amazing local market! And it’s so comfy, too!

 $50/year — King Gambrinus Birthday Club  (April 11 is this renowned beer drinker’s birthday. Let’s celebrate!) You receive one free pint of your choice every month on the date of your birthday plus happy-hour-priced pints all day on April 11. Oh, and a Barsideous sticker.

$100/year — The Ben Franklin (“Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.” — Benjamin Franklin) And so do we, so don’t worry, be happy. Let us treat you to happy hour pints all day long, one day a week every week. And receive a set of genuine Barsideous pint glasses that give you two 16-ounce glasses of classy drinking pleasure. These glasses are versatile and can stand up to Imperial Stouts and Double IPAs without blinking. You will be the coolest looking guy or gal at the party sipping delicious beverages in these beautiful glasses! Includes the Pride and Passion and Brewality swag.

$200/year – The W.C. Fields (“Everybody has to believe in something...I believe I'll have another drink.” — W.C. Fields) We believe in teasing the palate and pleasing the purse. Have another on us. You’ll receive a genuine Barsideous pint glass that lives at the brewpub and is magically filled once a week, plus the Barsideous First Edition T-shirt and sticker. Your pint awaits…

$275/year — The Bridge  - (A love of craft beer and food, a sense of fellowship, and a belief in community.) Join the Barsideous Family bridging connections to our community. Because we belong to a world community, it’s a part of the Barsideous mission to bridge connections with our community through service and donations. With this sponsorship, we donate a portion to a local charity. Help us help our community. Receive the Barsideous gift pack of a growler — first fill on us — and 2 Barsideous pint glasses, 2 First Edition T-shirts, once-a-week 20% discounted growler fills and $1 off pints, plus King Gambrinus Birthday Club membership. In addition, for every regular growler fill, $2 will be donated to charity and $1 for every regular pint.

$300/year – The Bogart (“The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind.” — Humphrey Bogart) Time to catch up. What better way than with happy hour prices all day, every day, and all the W.C. Fields swag – all of it.

$350/year – The Barsideous Beer EvangAlelist (Saving souls one pint at a time.) Invite a friend to enjoy a delicious pint of craft beer with you. You’ll receive a set of the W.C. Fields swag for you and a set for your friend. Twice as much fun! T-shirts can be all the same or any of the different designs —you choose.

$375/year – The Saint Arnold Patron (Patron Saint of hop pickers and Belgian brewers.) Gotta love those Belgian beers and hop pickers. You get all of The Bridge, and 20% off all additional growler fills, merchandise purchased and all ticketed events in the theater.

$450/year — The Barsideous Fellowship (Truly an amazing, serendipitous beer-wonderful world.) The range of qualities that beer displays is truly dazzling. That’s one of the things that makes our relationship to beer so compelling — no matter how schooled we become, there is always more to discover. And so, as a Fellowship sponsor, you’ll discover and receive all of the St. Arnold swag, PLUS, we all know “Winter is Coming.” Never fear, we’ve got you and Jon Snow covered! Whether braving the elements in Winterfell or the Willamette Valley, you and a friend will stay warm and toasty in your soft and comfy Barsideous zip-up hoodie sweatshirts. Cool people like yourself need a way to keep warm. Perfect for outdoor beer festivals, camping, and long walks on the beach.

$650/year – The Dude (“Buy a man a beer and he’ll waste an hour. Teach a man to brew and he’ll waste a lifetime.”) Be the Dude. The ultimate brewery experience! You and a friend will join us in the brewery to help design a recipe, brew the beer, name it, take it through our in-house and Founder's Club tasting panels and follow it through introduction into our tasting room! We will even host you and 10 friends in a private tasting party before we put the beer on tap, and if the beer is as cool as you are for backing us, we will scale it up and give you all the well-deserved credit. Plus 2 Limited Edition hoodie sweatshirts, 2 Barsideous gift packs (includes our pint glass and one growler), and 2  quarter kegs brewed by you for that special event – wedding, New Year’s party, etc. We can't wait to work with you!

$750/year – Barsideous Founders Club - (“Pizza alone won’t fill the emptiness of your soul …. You’ll also need beer.”) What a wonderful show of support! This short list of 15 distinguished people will receive EXCLUSIVE 1-year membership into our Mug Club. You'll get your own Barsideous pint glass kept at the brewery and magically refilled once a week, a Barsideous zip-up hoodie sweatshirt, a T-shirt, invitation to our Mug Club members-only parties, 20% off all merchandise purchases and ticketed theater events. At the end of the year, you get to take your mug home! Membership definitely has its privileges.

BUT WAIT! - Have a Seat — literally! With this additional perk, you sponsor one of our barstools. The seat will have a plaque reading, “generously donated by [your name here].” Come in and enjoy a pint on your personalized seat!    

$1,000/year – The Siduri Romance (Siduri — the Babylonian Goddess of Beer.) Beer has a language all her own, and she gives up her secrets only if you approach her the right way. Treat her with respect and gaze deeply into her amber, bubbling depths; if you listen very carefully, she will speak volumes to you. So we offer you the ultimate romance package. We have four beautiful 3-barrel fermentors. According to federal licensing, they need names. For breweries, fermentors are somewhere between children and sports cars, so names are a crucial part of making amazing beer in them. Like naming a comet after that “special someone” or marking a special date, you'll get to pick a name (with minimal restrictions) and we will engrave it into your tank. "Larry, Moe Curley," "R2-D2, C-3PO," “Lucyale." Get creative!!! Every day when we walk through the brewhouse and see your tank, we will think of you and give thanks for your generosity! And so will the thousands of people a year who’ll see it! … PLUS you’ll get The Backstage Pass: You and your sweetie and up to 4 other couples of your choice (or 10 folks) will enjoy a private tour of our facility with our head brewer, a dinner for 10 afterward and a special commemorative Barsideous pint glass and T-shirt for each guest. You and your special someone then receive 20% off all ticketed theater events plus happy hour beer and food prices for those events.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can donate financially; don't sweat it. Here are some other ways you can show us some love!

Share this campaign page with your friends, neighbors, grandparents, former roommates and anyone else who supports craft beer.

Follow us at barsideousbrewing.com or on Facebook.

Send words of wisdom and any questions to bill@barsideousbrewing.com

Drink some tasty local beer and send us some good vibes. (We aren't sure if this will help with the campaign, but we still recommend it.)

Risks & Challenges

Startup breweries are labor and capital intensive, and our plan is to avoid any commercial debt. We’ve done our due diligence researching every possible roadblock we can think of but, as with any new business, unforeseen expenses and delays could be a challenge. October 2017 is our tentative opening and we’re working towards that goal in every spare moment. Lots of great people are behind us — and we hope to include you in that merry band! We pledge to keep all our Founders informed of our progress. Thank you!

CSB - Community Supported Brewing (CSB) is like Community Supported Agriculture (CSA). We need you to support your local micro — as beer customers we need to make our choices carefully. We can surrender our dough to some vast industrial conglomerate, or we can help support a dedicated brewing entrepreneur who’s a part of our community, who is crazy for good stuff — just like you — and who isn’t trying to water it down to utter blandness. Buying genuine microbrew isn’t just a matter of being nice — it’s self-interest. If we don’t support them, they’ll be gone, and then what will our choices be like?  Consider who you’re giving your money to. Turn your friends on to the pleasures of craft beer — it matters.

Barsideous Brewing is one of a handful of CSBs. We see it as a “bridge brewpub,” bridging connections to you and our Community. A gathering place that draws people in with handcrafted beer and hearty food that invites great conversation with friends. Quality beer is part of a lifestyle that values the experience of living, of making every moment an adventure, every taste worth tasting. 

In the same way that CSA was created to help our neighborhood farmers and ranchers fund the hard work of growing our food, your subscription to our CSB helps us brew artisanal, locally-sourced, unique small-batch beers, which in turn helps us support local farmers by buying their hops and barley, fruits, vegetables and meats. 

Barsideous Brewing sprang from a passionate desire to save our planet from bland industrialized products, to salvage the authentic flavors of the world’s great beers, and restore the artistry in the making of this beloved beverage. 

Farm to table, grain to glass — at Barsideous every beer tells a story about its agricultural roots, its historical context.

At Barsideous our goal is nothing less than keeping beer, a 12,000-year-old cultural treasure of humanity, from slipping into a coma of mechanized industrial anonymity.

At Barsideous we are passionate about the flavor of great beer — brewing up fresh, character-filled beers of all strengths, shades and sensibilities.
story_txt:
In head brewer Bill Bartman, software engineer Joel Bartman, and construction managers Aaron and Brian Franks, we have a quartet of highly skilled professionals whose areas of expertise cover all the key areas for this project.
With these skilled individuals and many friends, we’ve begun the remodel of a beautiful 100+ year-old building — the Lebanon Gem Theater — which has a fascinating history: a storied past dating back to before 1910 when it was host to live vaudeville entertainment and silent movies. We’d like to return the “Gem” to its original grandeur.  Up front, we have the pub and kitchen. In the middle is the perfect small-batch brewing area. And the back third is what time has left of the theater: seating with a stage for karaoke, live music and entertainment, big screen movies and sports. 
But to realize this grand adventure, we need your help! Here’s how to be a Founder/Sponsor and get some sweet perks. Check these out. You may choose one or mix and match.
 $10/year – Brewality (For a heightened sense of beer-reality.) Beer has a quality of wonderfulness — a summation of artistic and technical brilliance in liquid form. Help us realize this great adventure of making awesome beer, hearty food, and returning the Gem Theater to its glory. You’ll receive pride in helping launch Barsideous, a Barsideous sticker and a THANK YOU on all our social media platforms. We appreciate all the help we can get, and will show that by giving you a custom vinyl decal. Put it on your car, on your refrigerator, or anywhere else you want to proclaim your support of local craft beer! Not only will we be grateful, but the next time we brew, we will say something like, "Hey! Remember when [your name here] threw us a few bucks to help get this started? That was rad!" And we’ll give you a high-five (also available in firm handshake and fist bump).
 $25/year – The Pride and the Passion (Craft beer is wonderful, mystical, complex and creative.) The Pride and the Passion is a 1957 film starring Cary Grant, Frank Sinatra and Sophia Loren. At Barsideous we craft beer with passion, create food with pride. Show your pride and passion for craft beer and food by wearing your First Edition Barsideous T-shirt. You’ll receive that T-shirt plus all the Brewality swag. Wear your shirt with pride, knowing that you're helping bring great beer to an amazing local market! And it’s so comfy, too!
 $50/year — King Gambrinus Birthday Club  (April 11 is this renowned beer drinker’s birthday. Let’s celebrate!) You receive one free pint of your choice every month on the date of your birthday plus happy-hour-priced pints all day on April 11. Oh, and a Barsideous sticker.
$100/year — The Ben Franklin (“Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.” — Benjamin Franklin) And so do we, so don’t worry, be happy. Let us treat you to happy hour pints all day long, one day a week every week. And receive a set of genuine Barsideous pint glasses that give you two 16-ounce glasses of classy drinking pleasure. These glasses are versatile and can stand up to Imperial Stouts and Double IPAs without blinking. You will be the coolest looking guy or gal at the party sipping delicious beverages in these beautiful glasses! Includes the Pride and Passion and Brewality swag.
$200/year – The W.C. Fields (“Everybody has to believe in something...I believe I'll have another drink.” — W.C. Fields) We believe in teasing the palate and pleasing the purse. Have another on us. You’ll receive a genuine Barsideous pint glass that lives at the brewpub and is magically filled once a week, plus the Barsideous First Edition T-shirt and sticker. Your pint awaits…
$275/year — The Bridge  - (A love of craft beer and food, a sense of fellowship, and a belief in community.) Join the Barsideous Family bridging connections to our community. Because we belong to a world community, it’s a part of the Barsideous mission to bridge connections with our community through service and donations. With this sponsorship, we donate a portion to a local charity. Help us help our community. Receive the Barsideous gift pack of a growler — first fill on us — and 2 Barsideous pint glasses, 2 First Edition T-shirts, once-a-week 20% discounted growler fills and $1 off pints, plus King Gambrinus Birthday Club membership. In addition, for every regular growler fill, $2 will be donated to charity and $1 for every regular pint.
$300/year – The Bogart (“The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind.” — Humphrey Bogart) Time to catch up. What better way than with happy hour prices all day, every day, and all the W.C. Fields swag – all of it.
$350/year – The Barsideous Beer EvangAlelist (Saving souls one pint at a time.) Invite a friend to enjoy a delicious pint of craft beer with you. You’ll receive a set of the W.C. Fields swag for you and a set for your friend. Twice as much fun! T-shirts can be all the same or any of the different designs —you choose.
$375/year – The Saint Arnold Patron (Patron Saint of hop pickers and Belgian brewers.) Gotta love those Belgian beers and hop pickers. You get all of The Bridge, and 20% off all additional growler fills, merchandise purchased and all ticketed events in the theater.
$450/year — The Barsideous Fellowship (Truly an amazing, serendipitous beer-wonderful world.) The range of qualities that beer displays is truly dazzling. That’s one of the things that makes our relationship to beer so compelling — no matter how schooled we become, there is always more to discover. And so, as a Fellowship sponsor, you’ll discover and receive all of the St. Arnold swag, PLUS, we all know “Winter is Coming.” Never fear, we’ve got you and Jon Snow covered! Whether braving the elements in Winterfell or the Willamette Valley, you and a friend will stay warm and toasty in your soft and comfy Barsideous zip-up hoodie sweatshirts. Cool people like yourself need a way to keep warm. Perfect for outdoor beer festivals, camping, and long walks on the beach.
$650/year – The Dude (“Buy a man a beer and he’ll waste an hour. Teach a man to brew and he’ll waste a lifetime.”) Be the Dude. The ultimate brewery experience! You and a friend will join us in the brewery to help design a recipe, brew the beer, name it, take it through our in-house and Founder's Club tasting panels and follow it through introduction into our tasting room! We will even host you and 10 friends in a private tasting party before we put the beer on tap, and if the beer is as cool as you are for backing us, we will scale it up and give you all the well-deserved credit. Plus 2 Limited Edition hoodie sweatshirts, 2 Barsideous gift packs (includes our pint glass and one growler), and 2  quarter kegs brewed by you for that special event – wedding, New Year’s party, etc. We can't wait to work with you!
$750/year – Barsideous Founders Club - (“Pizza alone won’t fill the emptiness of your soul …. You’ll also need beer.”) What a wonderful show of support! This short list of 15 distinguished people will receive EXCLUSIVE 1-year membership into our Mug Club. You'll get your own Barsideous pint glass kept at the brewery and magically refilled once a week, a Barsideous zip-up hoodie sweatshirt, a T-shirt, invitation to our Mug Club members-only parties, 20% off all merchandise purchases and ticketed theater events. At the end of the year, you get to take your mug home! Membership definitely has its privileges.
BUT WAIT! - Have a Seat — literally! With this additional perk, you sponsor one of our barstools. The seat will have a plaque reading, “generously donated by [your name here].” Come in and enjoy a pint on your personalized seat!

Treat her with respect and gaze deeply into her amber, bubbling depths; if you listen very carefully, she will speak volumes to you. So we offer you the ultimate romance package. "Larry, Moe Curley," "R2-D2, C-3PO," “Lucyale." Get creative!!! Every day when we walk through the brewhouse and see your tank, we will think of you and give thanks for your generosity! And so will the thousands of people a year who’ll see it! … PLUS you’ll get The Backstage Pass: You and your sweetie and up to 4 other couples of your choice (or 10 folks) will enjoy a private tour of our facility with our head brewer, a dinner for 10 afterward and a special commemorative Barsideous pint glass and T-shirt for each guest. story:
Hey there!

I am Luca and I have a dream: bring to your home the best wines that Italy has to offer, helping small and medium size wineries to keep the tradition of Italian wine alive.

Among our team of 4 we share a couple of things: passion for wine and for working together.

We understood how much passion and devotion lie behind wine and we realized that those are the stories that we want to know in order to deeply appreciate what we drink. 

To offer rare and high qualities wines we decided to rely on the experts we’ve met – great connoisseurs of wine culture – and to their fantastic knowledge. 

We designed Sommelier Wine Box to surprise you with a 3-wines Box per month, selected by a different sommelier each month, according with a special theme. Two Boxes will be available: “Enthusiast” and “Expert”, both with high quality wines, diversified by price. 

In order to achieve our goal, we need to create a digital community that engages and promotes the small Italian enterprises that cannot compete in the mass market.

Do you want to be part of this dream supporting Sommelier Wine Box?

Winemakers

In Italy there are about 10,000 wine companies and around 1,300 wineries for a 72,300 hectares under vine. Several of those winemakers produce small quantities of excellent wine and dedicate their life since their passion leaves them no alternatives. Their work on the vineyards preserves secrets and traditions kept within wineries for generations and hidden in their wine.

For not being in the mass market many winemakers struggle to survive, with Sommelier Wine Box we want to support them while spreading their stories and unique products.

What this opportunity involves

With Sommelier Wine Box you’ll get a 3-wine box per month while entering in direct contact with small and special Italian winemakers, discovering their lives and stories. In those wines you’ll find wine producers’ work and character - a slice of Italy will come to your home, with all fragrances, colors and secrets of the region.

But that’s not all! Buying Sommelier Wine Box you’ll be concretely supporting those small and excellent winemakers, who have wine as a reason to live.

How it works and benefits for you

 

Why we are doing this

We have a strong passion for Italian winemakers and we want to help small wineries to emerge and be known, spreading the fruit of their work. That’s why we created Sommelier Wine Box, to build a wine-lovers community, passionate about nature and wine, and willing to get in direct contact with those people, beyond the label, beyond the brand.

We need people

  • Who go deep without stopping at the surface.
  • Who have a passion for continuous learning.
  • Who are ready to climb mountains to see a landscape.
  • Who are eager to look for authentic tastes and go against the tide to find them.
  • Who want to discover stories and are not settled for products only.
  • Who love connecting with real people.

Packaging

We designed Sommelier Wine Box’s packaging to convey the quality of the wines that we want you to discover

Christmas Box

We designed a special perk for those who want to support us donating a Sommelier Wine Box as a Christmas present, available at a discounted price. 48h after the contribution, you’ll receive a postcard via email to be printed for your friend: there, we’ll explain how helpful was your support for our project, and that the Box will be delivered at the beginning of March.

In the Christmas Box there will be 3 high quality Italian wines selected by a famous Italian expert, along with a gift pack as shown in the photo below. The Box can be delivered to you or to your friend, depending on your preference.

Why we are asking for help

We need your pre-orders to buy supplies and materials for the 3-wine boxes to be delivered. Without your help we can’t make Sommelier Wine Box come to life.

What we need from you

We need your support!

  • Pre-order your Sommelier Wine Box
  • Support us with a donation
  • Tell friends our story
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter
  • NEW: A special gift for all backers if we reach goal

An opportunity to cut the middleman

We’ll deliver from winemakers directly to your home, cutting any middleman’s costs and proving a fare profit to producers.

Why we are using Indiegogo

Because we need to create a community of passionate wine-lovers willing to discover what’s beyond wine’s bottle to support winemakers and help them promote their work and preserve wine tradition.

Risks and challenges

For Sommelier Wine Box, the challenge at hand is to become a player able to make a real difference in promoting Italian territory. But without your help we can’t buy materials at a lower price and Sommelier Wine Box won’t come to life. The risk is that we are not able to support small and excellent wine producers that are hidden throughout Italian regions.

The risk is that we are not able to support small and excellent wine producers that are hidden throughout Italian regions.

story:
Short Summary

I grew up in Novato and always had a passion for great hospitality and delicious food. I have lived around the country and traveled to different parts of the World, but Novato is where I have wanted to be. Working in the restaurant industry gave me the passion and drive to want to open my own restaurant. Craft & Vintage comes from that passion. I love places that exude warm hospitality and want that in Novato. I love trying new things when it comes to food and libations. I want to offer that to others as well. We want to give you the opportunity to try an awesome craft beer from New England or an amazing wine from Croatia. Our delicious cuisine is going to be farm to table, using locally sourced meats, cheeses, vegetables, etc. We want you to not be limited to one dish while you are out eating. Come out with friends and order 5 things to share. Hang out for an hour before you head to a movie or hang out for four hours with your friends or family laughing and having a great time. That is what Craft & Vintage is all about. Come and Enjoy!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000. When we raise this money, we will be able to finally secure a lease and move forward with construction and opening the doors. 

We are offering wonderful perks to all those who contribute to our campaign. They include brand specific swag as well as delicious meals and fun events. 

Even if we don't reach our goal of $10,000, we will using the money towards our lease when we are able to get a business loan to get the remaining amount. 

Risks & Challenges

Opening a restaurant is always very risky. Will I get enough money to pay for the overhead costs? Will I find the right people for the right positions? Will everything be completed in time? What if? These are all things that scare me and I question on a daily basis. I have the education and experience to make this passion of mine become a reality and will work through the obstacles that come my way with the support of my friends and family. The money will come. I just know that enough people believe in my project and abilities that it will happen. It may not happen in the time frame that I originally hoped for, but I know it will happen. I also know that I will find the right people to work at Craft & Vintage. I already have a great core started and believe that they have the same vision for the restaurant as I do. As there are always risks, when it comes together, it is an even bigger reward.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, we ask that you please let us know if you have a service to provide or are able to assist in another way. We also ask that you share our campaign with your friends and family.

story:
PLEASE JOIN OUR HEALTHY CHOCOLATE REVOLUTION

Our mission is to create the best tasting chocolate ever, whilst keeping the ingredients as organic and healthy as possible. We believe we have achieved this and want you to help us turn this into a global brand by helping us build a factory to keep up with our huge demand. We are currently selling hundreds of bars a day but cannot keep up with demand so need bigger equipment, premises, and more staff.

Why is our chocolate so popular?

Imagine the tastiest milk chocolate without all the downsides! There is up to 55g of sugar in major brands of chocolate. This equates to 11 teaspoons of sugar. The recommended daily allowance is 6 - 9 teaspoons, so one bar of chocolate can be double your allowance. We have all seen the headlines about the health concerns related to sugar, but we all want a treat, and who doesn’t love chocolate.

Heavenly Chocolate is unique in that it is free from dairy, soy, gluten, palm oil, and GMO ingredients and yet mimics the best milk chocolate that you can buy. Best of all it has only 1 teaspoon of sugar in it. So it is good for you and good for the environment.

Does it taste good though? No - it tastes AMAZING!

We are a brand new company that started with an idea less than 12 months ago when I tried to find healthy chocolate that my whole family would love the taste. Unfortunately, despite multiple purchases, I could not find a brand that met all of our requirements.

The challenge I found was that chocolate was either full of dairy products, sugar or both, and so-called healthy versions just didn’t taste that great. 

Normal brands of chocolate just caused my kids to become hyperactive and then crash later being irritable and restless or even having problems sleeping. They also caused more visits to the dentist because of the high sugar content.

My wife who has suffered from Rheumatoid Arthritis and Chronic Fatigue (but changed her life through diet) also cannot eat 'normal' chocolate either without having stiff joints and mood swings the next day.

And as I watched friends struggling with obesity and their own health issues, these were all catalysts for creating my own range of healthy chocolate. Well - I never realized that decision would take me on a crazy year-long journey of working with incredible chocolate experts to crack the code, but we have finally done it! 

Heavenly is everything you’ve always wanted from a guilt-free treat –without sacrificing any of the creamy, ‘milky’ delectable taste in every bite. It is also made from a majority of organic ingredients and my secret blend of high quality cocoa beans.

So the question is – if we aren’t using dairy or sugar – what are we using?

We have replaced the dairy element of the chocolate with organic rice cream which mimics the creamy nature of milk but without the antibiotics, growth hormones, pesticides and lactose issues of commercial bulk milk powder used in most chocolate in the United States.

Our sweeteners are a unique combination of several ingredients derived from plant-based natural sources, such as inulin, xylitol, and erythritol.

Xylitol and erythritol have zero calories and are recommended by dentists, due to their ability to stop the bacteria that causes tooth decay from happening. Indeed in Scandinavia schools give out xylitol sweets in order to keep kids smiles healthy and white.

We also use a range of prebiotic fibres such as organic inulin from the agave plant which feed probiotics in your gut to create a healthy microbiome, which are the building blocks of good health.

We have launched with 12 different flavors – Salted Caramel, Original, Mint, Orange, Hazelnut, Almond, Fruit & Nut, Toffee, Coconut, Strawberry, Ginger and Dark – all so beautifully creamy, you’ll be amazed they don’t contain dairy products or large amounts of sugar.

We now need to expand and build a new factory as we need to make 10,000 bars per day, such is the demand.

And this is your chance to be in the launch of this exciting new brand.

If you do decide to invest - I want to thank you in advance for being part of the healthy chocolate revolution and helping us make history. We have some very exciting future plans for new products (hot chocolate, white chocolate, chocolate spread and ice cream) that we can't wait to share with you, so I look forward to being on this journey with you.

We have some incredible rewards such as:

Personalised Heavenly Chocolate Bars (name / logo / photo)

VIP family trip to the chocolate factory near Stonehenge, England

5 Star Overnight Accommodation during your visit

A video of your visit

A personal 'Thank You' video from me - the Founder of Heavenly Chocolate

Your name on a plaque at the chocolate factory forever!

Your name and photo on our website "VIP supporters" page

A personal video of your visit to the chocolate factory

A portrait of yourself by world-class artist Hazel Morgan (luckily also my wife!!) - check out her paintings here: HazelMorgan.com

Heavenly Chocolate Mugs

Heavenly Chocolate T-Shirts

Lunch with the Heavenly Chocolate Team

I hope that you like what we have to offer and send you best wishes for the healthiest (and tastiest) year ever!

Yours sincerely, 

Stephen

Stephen Conway, 
Founder, Heavenly Chocolate

story:
About Us

As you've probably guessed by our name, we serve delicious vegan junk food. Our focus is on taste and recreating classic junk food that's 100% cruelty free.  We have been following a vegan lifestyle for five years now with a passion and enthusiasm but the one thing that we have missed was a decent junk food fix!  We made it our mission to create the perfect vegan fast food and we are convinced that we have done that. 
You will never need to worry about cross contamination or being served animal products by mistake as there will not be any in our premises.
We will be offering all our classics from our pop-up menus, along with several new additions which you are going to love!
 
What We Have Achieved So Far

We created vegan junk food for ourselves in our own home but the feedback we received from our family and friends suggested to us that there could be a genuine need in the market for a vegan takeaway. We thought a great way to test how well Greazy Vegan would do and to get feedback on what people thought of our food, would be to hold a pop up event. We spoke to the owner of a local Pontcanna pub and they let us take over their kitchen on a Sunday evening. We instantly had a great response to the event, with all 100 places being booked within days. Every pop-up we held after that followed suit, and a couple of events were fully booked within hours of announcing the dates! We had such amazing feedback about our menu, perhaps expectedly from fellow vegans but also from their meat eating friends. These pop ups were more successful than we ever hoped they would be.  Due to demand and people desperate to taste our food, we quickly gained a waiting list of over 800 people!! At this point we decided we needed a permanent home.
Since then, we have featured on many several local, national and international media outlets, with support and interest from around the globe. We have been genuinely surprised and overwhelmed by the best wishes we've received and in particular from people we've never met - we are totally and utterly committed to make Greazy Vegan a success.
 
What We Want To Achieve

We are passionate about animals, their welfare and our environment.  We want to create a takeaway restaurant that is simple, inviting and 100% cruelty free.  We want Greazy Vegan to be accessible to people of all ages, and to appeal to vegans, vegetarians and meat eaters. We hope to show people that you don't have to miss out on your favourite junk food when you give up animal products.

Our plan is to open a vegan takeaway in a central Cardiff, UK location as it would be more accessible to potential customers. We aim to create a simple, bright and welcoming restaurant that can appeal to everyone. We believe that our proposed site will benefit from being opposite the castle as tourists will be able to easily find us too.
 In due course, we also plan on using Deliveroo delivery service.

What We Need

After having to make an ethical choice with our main investor, we are now looking to raise the rest of the funding to complete the work and to open our restaurant as soon as possible. We are passionate about being 100% vegan and aim to be the market leader of veganism in Cardiff; we will not compromise on this vision. We have had to take the difficult decision to part company with our main investor as they were not able to commit to the 100% vegan standards that we aspire to. This was a difficult but ethical decision and as a result we are now looking for crowdfunding to take the next steps in the Greazy vegan journey.
Having invested our own time and funds to date, we now require additional funding to get the business open. The funding would be used for;
⦁ Fit out costs (kitchen equipment fixtures and fittings), decoration
⦁ Costs of initial stock of food, packaging
⦁  Launch costs of branding and some advertising

Finally, if you are unable to donate, we would be very grateful if you could share this with your friends and followers to get the word out there!

Testimonials

"Omg @greazyvegan what is this witchcraft!? Everything was so delicious! I brought a meat eater and he was also blown away. Plssss open a delivery shop soon I swear I will have a Big Moc Burger for tea everyday" Instagram user.

"Best burger I've had in my entire life! Had to get seconds. Seriously it tasted exactly like a Big Mac and I don't think anyone would be able to taste the difference" Instagram user.

"Best vegan kebab ever, this is the only photo of it due to the speed at which I required it to get in my face" Instagram user.

"Craving this amazing Big Moc made by Greazy Vegan right now. Such a big turn out at the event that we waited hours for this, but it was worth it" Instagram user.

"Waited 4 hours for this vegan kebab, would I do it again?...f**k yeah!" Facebook user.

story:
Short Summary

We're just a few local boys trying to make good beer for good folks.

  • We at Edgewise Eight pride ourselves on making delicious beer. Over the years we've honed our skills by brewing hundreds of times and competing in some of the nation's largest beer competitions. The feedback we've gotten has allowed us to hone our brews down to something we feel is both delicious and accessible and with over 20 awards under our belts we feel like we're justified in trying to make a product for the people of Weatherford. Our unofficial motto is "beer is meant to be drank" and we strive to achieve the highest levels of drinkability in our beer.
  • We started this campaign as not only a way to raise money but also to foster a community. Beer halls have served as meeting grounds for good times for hundreds of years and we want to bring that experience to Weatherford.
  • Your contributions will go towards helping fund Weatherford's first brewery in living memory. We're very excited at this prospect and hope you'll help us with this journey.

What We Need & What You Get

  • While a tasty brew may only set you back a few bucks, the equipment and infrastructure needed to produce it requires substantial funding. All proceeds will be going toward the purchase of a brew system, fermenters, a bar, glassware, ingredients, etc.
  • We hope that our perks go beyond the normal funding rewards of something like this. We tried to keep everything reasonably priced but still able to help us reach our goals.
  • If we don't reach our final goals then we do still intend on having a party and giving out beer and merch that was purchased to all those who believed in us enough to contribute.

The Impact

The impact of your donations would help in a tremendous way.

  • We want to make our brewpub the most inviting place to go in Weatherford. Contributions will help to make that experience even better buy helping us buy more and better amenities (we'd love to have a beer garden for example).
  • We'd love to be able to share our beer with the world, but especially with our local community. Your contributions can help make that happen.

Risks & Challenges

The costs of opening a brewery are many. There's always the chance that we won't reach our financial goals. Here's what we're doing to mitigate that risk:

  • We are actively seeking investors outside of this crowdfunding source to ensure we can get all the funding we need.
  • We're also speaking with local officials and industry leaders in the area to get tips and advice so we don't fail.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but would still like to help then we always appreciate recommendations to your friends, loved ones, people you know, or even random strangers you run into every day.

The Fine Print

  • While we appreciate everyone's enthusiasm we will not be awarding any rewards containing alcohol vouchers to anyone under the age of 21.
  • To help keep costs down we are not currently planning on shipping any of the rewards. You're coming in to have a beer anyway, right? We'll send out vouchers that you can redeem whenever you choose to come in. If that's not possible for you then please let us know and we'll see what can be done.
  • Unfortunately we don't have actual pictures of the rewards yet (we're working on it). Everything shown is at least equivalent/similar to what will be given out though and we'll update the site as we get the actual photos.

story:
Why Zuzu's is Asking for Your Support

Hi, my name is Tim Smith. Right now and for the last couple of years I have been Zuzu's Bakery. I make interesting, delicious and nutritious bread. There is more demand for it than I am currently able to produce. While customers browse and munch our produce, they also browse our gallery space, pitched to showcase local artists for affordable hanging fees.


Zuzu’s Bakery is the result of my 54 years of real world experiences, named after my late daughter Zuzu. Parenting my very disabled little girl took us through times when I had to decide whether to spend money on healthcare or food. 


I was lucky, I had some support and was able to work. So, I only had to make this financial call occasionally. Many people have much less luck. Many people have to live day-to-day with such financial and decisions. This isn’t right.


Zu’ and I had a good, fun, active and happy life. Zuzu’s Bakery is fuelled by the lessons I learned through that beautiful period of parenthood and my relationship with Zu'. Lessons about love, about nutrition, and about not having much money in a world where good, nutritious food costs, are present in every aspect of the business. Zuzu's Bakery works, and we’d like your help to continue.

  • Zuzu's is based in Malton, North Yorkshire, which has a mixed demographic ranging from the very wealthy to the very poor. We want to sell our food to our community and – ‘Bread by Mail’ – beyond it
  • Zuzu's bakery will use the money that you contribute to continue selling our food  at realistic prices. By this we mean 'realistic for all abilities to pay'
  • How do we do this? We sell our food to people who can afford our high quality produce at a price reflecting the time, skill, and high quality ingredients. This allows us to subsidise the same delicious, nutritious, interesting food for people who can't normally afford it for themselves and their children. 
  • We want to make more, to sell more, to more people
  • At 54 years old, with a wealth of experience in catering and other spheres of life, I know this approach to making and selling food and nutrition works. It is grounded in reality; Zuzu’s has already proven it is not a pipe dream nor a phase for the business to move through to open more shops and "make a name" with. This is the business. This is Zuzu's Bakery's heart and soul

What We Need from You

All the lovely plans in the world come to dust, however, if some realism in the form of money isn't included. Living with Zu' made me a very hard-visioned realist. So, let's get to where you, your support and your money come in.

Zuzu's is looking to raise up to (or beyond) £25,000. This will enable me to provide good bread to a wide range of pockets – including people who cannot afford nutritious food to feed themselves or their families. We intend to use the money to achieve at least some of this: 

  • Escape the Catch-22 of needing an additional oven and one more person in order to expand production while at the same time needing to expand production to employ and additional person and oven
  • Employ one more person (Debra by name - who is already working for the bakery on a voluntary basis) to look after the shop and to organise events such as our ongoing gallery of Art by Women. We charge our artists no hanging fee and only take a small commission on any sales to support Zuzu's Bakery. Debra has been essential in getting Zuzu's to where we are now. We think she deserves more than our love and a loaf a day
  • Cover the next two quarters of rent so we can purchase good quality ingredients to make good quality bread. That's £7k all on its own
  • Buy an additional oven with at least 70 loaf capacity. This will enable me to make more bread, faster. Kind of essential to providing it to more people. That's in the region of £4k
  • Buy an big sign for the front of the building to attract more customers. Signage is important, it is also highly regulated by our landlord. We need a good sign that faces out and is supported by smaller hanging signs that face up and down the road. That's around £400 — or - let us know if you fancy making one!
  • Lay down a new bakery floor and refit the currently derelict staff changing room (a massive 4 foot wide by 8 foot long)

What Your Contribution Means to Us

At Zuzu's, Debra and I want to make delicious, nutritious and interesting food for people who can afford to pay for quality produce in order for us to pay ourselves and to subsidise those people who can't. Here's how we make this work:

  • We already provide at least one ‘Wonky Bread Day’ per week. We sell two or three day old bread at a heavy discount or even for free to people who want and need it. We like to make this is regular, daily experience
  • Zuzu's would like to expand to provide ‘Bread by Mail’ so we can use the Internet to expand our reach, our method and our message of "Bread for All – Zero Waste"
  • All of the items – and yes, the cash we need to get them – will contribute to these plans

Risks & Challenges

OK, the possible pitfalls and - let's be up front here — risks are...

  • I started Zuzu's with my own money and a loan from the local branch of the government enterprise fund. All sensible fiscal stuff. I then moved to the new premises a year ago in Malton. Full of joy and hope...
  • Then the bakery floor collapsed; three of the ovens I bought died and had to be replaced; the gas, electricity supplies required upgrades; so did the extraction - this is now fixed, legally compliant and unexplodey. None of this was expected, so it ate up our emergency reserves.

  • Then a bunch of family issues involving dementia and cancer (yup... you couldn't write it) meant I had to stop work in order to help with life. Rent still needed paying at the bakery 

  • All this meant that money ran short

  • I kept going. Making and selling bread. And, with the help of good friends, tiling, building, plumbing and more

  • Then Debra arrived and made life 100% easier. We sold bread. We made more bread. We sold more bread. Simple but not quite enough. We are making money but we need to make more bread (and money) to see us through to Christmas

  • We want to keep going. We’re dedicated. We're working all hours possible while maintaining quality, vision, our integrity and a sense of humour. 

Other Ways You Can Help

What if you can't give cold, hard cash? Well, you can help by...

  • Contributing art for the ongoing gallery shows. We'll try to sell some for you at a reasonable commission.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
  • Pop in and say, "Hiya!"
  • Provide us with a sign for the front. Wooden. Classy. Says 'This is a top notch bakery'
  • Provide us with paper or otherwise recyclable bags — boy they are an ongoing cost, but we hate waste.
  • Share some more via Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, Snapchat, Messenger Pigeon, Tumblr, WhatsApp, Instagram, Shouting Loudly from the Top of Tall Buildings (safely using a harness).

Thanks to much for even bothering to read this. I really appreciate it. Now, money would be really great too.

Best wishes and lots of hope, 

Tim - Zuzu's Bakery

There is more demand for it than I am currently able to produce. While customers browse and munch our produce, they also browse our gallery space, pitched to showcase local artists for affordable hanging fees.
Zuzu’s Bakery is the result of my 54 years of real world experiences, named after my late daughter Zuzu. Parenting my very disabled little girl took us through times when I had to decide whether to spend money on healthcare or food. 
I was lucky, I had some support and was able to work. So, I only had to make this financial call occasionally. Many people have much less luck. Many people have to live day-to-day with such financial and decisions. This isn’t right.
Zu’ and I had a good, fun, active and happy life. Zuzu’s Bakery is fuelled by the lessons I learned through that beautiful period of parenthood and my relationship with Zu'. Lessons about love, about nutrition, and about not having much money in a world where good, nutritious food costs, are present in every aspect of the business. Zuzu's Bakery works, and we’d like your help to continue.

Zuzu's is based in Malton, North Yorkshire, which has a mixed demographic ranging from the very wealthy to the very poor. We want to sell our food to our community and – ‘Bread by Mail’ – beyond it
Zuzu's bakery will use the money that you contribute to continue selling our food  at realistic prices. By this we mean 'realistic for all abilities to pay'

How do we do this? We sell our food to people who can afford our high quality produce at a price reflecting the time, skill, and high quality ingredients. This allows us to subsidise the same delicious, nutritious, interesting food for people who can't normally afford it for themselves and their children. 
We want to make more, to sell more, to more people
At 54 years old, with a wealth of experience in catering and other spheres of life, I know this approach to making and selling food and nutrition works. It is grounded in reality; Zuzu’s has already proven it is not a pipe dream nor a phase for the business to move through to open more shops and "make a name" with. This is the business. This is Zuzu's Bakery's heart and soul



What We Need from You
All the lovely plans in the world come to dust, however, if some realism in the form of money isn't included. Living with Zu' made me a very hard-visioned realist. So, let's get to where you, your support and your money come in.Zuzu's is looking to raise up to (or beyond) £25,000. This will enable me to provide good bread to a wide range of pockets – including people who cannot afford nutritious food to feed themselves or their families. We intend to use the money to achieve at least some of this: 


Escape the Catch-22 of needing an additional oven and one more person in order to expand production while at the same time needing to expand production to employ and additional person and oven

Employ one more person (Debra by name - who is already working for the bakery on a voluntary basis) to look after the shop and to organise events such as our ongoing gallery of Art by Women. We charge our artists no hanging fee and only take a small commission on any sales to support Zuzu's Bakery. Debra has been essential in getting Zuzu's to where we are now. We think she deserves more than our love and a loaf a day

Cover the next two quarters of rent so we can purchase good quality ingredients to make good quality bread. That's £7k all on its own


Buy an additional oven with at least 70 loaf capacity. This will enable me to make more bread, faster. Kind of essential to providing it to more people. That's in the region of £4k

Buy an big sign for the front of the building to attract more customers. Signage is important, it is also highly regulated by our landlord. We need a good sign that faces out and is supported by smaller hanging signs that face up and down the road. That's around £400 — or - let us know if you fancy making one!

Lay down a new bakery floor and refit the currently derelict staff changing room (a massive 4 foot wide by 8 foot long)


What Your Contribution Means to Us

At Zuzu's, Debra and I want to make delicious, nutritious and interesting food for people who can afford to pay for quality produce in order for us to pay ourselves and to subsidise those people who can't. Here's how we make this work:

We already provide at least one ‘Wonky Bread Day’ per week. We sell two or three day old bread at a heavy discount or even for free to people who want and need it. We like to make this is regular, daily experience
Zuzu's would like to expand to provide ‘Bread by Mail’ so we can use the Internet to expand our reach, our method and our message of "Bread for All – Zero Waste"
All of the items – and yes, the cash we need to get them – will contribute to these plans


Risks & Challenges
OK, the possible pitfalls and - let's be up front here — risks are...

I started Zuzu's with my own money and a loan from the local branch of the government enterprise fund. All sensible fiscal stuff. I then moved to the new premises a year ago in Malton. Full of joy and hope...

Then the bakery floor collapsed; three of the ovens I bought died and had to be replaced; the gas, electricity supplies required upgrades; so did the extraction - this is now fixed, legally compliant and unexplodey. None of this was expected, so it ate up our emergency reserves.
Then a bunch of family issues involving dementia and cancer (yup... you couldn't write it) meant I had to stop work in order to help with life. Rent still needed paying at the bakery 
All this meant that money ran short
I kept going. Making and selling bread. And, with the help of good friends, tiling, building, plumbing and more
Then Debra arrived and made life 100% easier. We sold bread. We made more bread. We sold more bread. Simple but not quite enough. We are making money but we need to make more bread (and money) to see us through to Christmas
We want to keep going. We’re dedicated. We're working all hours possible while maintaining quality, vision, our integrity and a sense of humour. 


Other Ways You Can Help
What if you can't give cold, hard cash? Well, you can help by...

Contributing art for the ongoing gallery shows. We'll try to sell some for you at a reasonable commission.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
Pop in and say, "Hiya!"
Provide us with a sign for the front. Wooden. Classy. Says 'This is a top notch bakery'
Provide us with paper or otherwise recyclable bags — boy they are an ongoing cost, but we hate waste.
Share some more via Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, Snapchat, Messenger Pigeon, Tumblr, WhatsApp, Instagram, Shouting Loudly from the Top of Tall Buildings (safely using a harness).

Thanks to much for even bothering to read this. I really appreciate it. Now, money would be really great too.
Best wishes and lots of hope, 
Tim - Zuzu's Bakery

story:
We're two dudes who want to share their love of food with everyone.

We're two guys who love LA and show it through our passion for our food! With a combined experience of over 14 years in the food industry, we're finally ready to expand the Johnny Pacific brand to the greater Los Angeles area! We've worked hard to build good will within our Canoga Park / West San Fernando Valley community and we take pride in serving up our house made fillings and sauces, hand folded empanadas, and refreshing agua refrescos! Our goal has always been to bring the best tasting empanadas to the greater Los Angeles area (and beyond) and by helping fund Johnny Pacific LA, not only will you become a part of a 14 year old pipe dream to expand beyond the San Fernando Valley, but you also will get some exclusive, once in a lifetime kind of perks from a REALLY good empanada spot in Downtown Los Angeles (don't believe us, see what our friends on YELP have to say).

So, how can you be a part of Johnny Pacific's history in the making? We're looking to raise $50,000 ​to complete the build out of our space in Chinatown's newest food hall, POTLUCK! We're going to use this money for build-out and necessary equipment.

We thank you for checking out our page and we look forward to serving you in the future!

- John & Rayson

story:
I am craving for Exotic (but authentic) Korean Chicken sauce, Are YOU? 

  • Our Co-founder has a passion for food & his unique background (born & raised in S. Korea but living in US for more than half of his life) keeps leading to launch this new sauce that can fulfill both sides of culture  
  • KOCHI sauce (Korean Chicken) can make Anyone enjoys Tasty Hot & Sweet Korean Style chicken at anytime anywhere.  

If you LIKE Fried Chicken, we will make you to LOVE it !!

 

Why is it good?

  • Very First & the Only authentic Korean Chicken Sauce. (you wouldn't find anything like this: unless you go to some special Korean chicken restaurants) 
  • "Convenience doesn't need to sacrifice great taste".

Here is what we need

  • We need funds to make this happens! (funds will cover includes, but not limited to)
    • Minimum Production cost (Perfect recipe is ready by R&D now~)
    • Packaging & Marketing cost
  • When we reach out the Goal (funds), we will surely consider for "Thank you" expression to those who help us. (could be small/memorable gift, discount, and more)
  • If we somehow don't reach out to the goal, still the fund will be fully used for production.

    Risks & Challenges

    Since this is a new sauce, lack of brand-recognition would be the weakness. (Well,  eventually "Taste speaks louder than any word", we believe) 

    • We are working on developing another New Great Sauce for meat & having more SKU will bring some power to be recognized by food-lovers 
    • Aggressive marketing activities (SNS, media, etc) will be following to promote & present. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Your contribute (fund) is highly appreciating, but if you like to help us out with other ways, 

    • Please get the word out and make some noise about our new KOCHI sauce.
    • Please share our Indiegogo campaign. 

    Thank you very much for sharing your valuable time with KOCHI. 

    TASTING IS BELIEVING~!!

story:
My names are Joseph Ndugu Uwumugisha. I have the privilege of leading this campaign on behalf of Living Again Coffee,llc. 

I grew up on a lavish beautifully green village in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Spread on several hills that border the Kahuzi Biega Forest, coffee was part of us just like all types of fruits and plants. After school, with the kids my age, when it was plowing season, I will join my mother on the farm to plow.  For the planting season? Weeding? Etc. Many things including coffee trees, planting, trimming, sucking on sweet juicy red cherries in between kids playtime or filling a basket of red ripe cherries to take to the Catholic mission, and later when I grew up hours on wood-fired coffee roaster at the Catholic Mission; I did it all without knowing that life was preparing me for something much bigger and important. 

Then years of war began. The Tutsi Genocide in Rwanda took close to a million lives with destructions beyond any description. The war spread over to the Democratic of Congo where an estimated 10 million people have died, millions are still displaced. My village completely destroyed. 

I survived in many ways and simply found myself helping or working with different non-profits organizations including the United Nations professionally participating in efforts to rebuild, to help. Rebuild? Our Region is being rebuilt: Rwanda, for example rising from the ashes of the genocide, is the fastest growing economy in Central Africa. 

Farmers are also being helped, including coffee beans farmers. To boost productivity and achieve marketable qualities and quantities, farmers work in cooperatives providing a great practical platform for governance and business management. The help comes in form of access to input, farming skill improvement, access to finance such as working capital. 

Unfortunately, access to the market is still limited and several of these coffee farmers are still making losses year after year. 

That is what this campaign is all about: Farm to Market/ to your table. 

With your support, we will build a roasting facility, start bringing coffee beans from our cooperatives in Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo, roast them here in the USA for quality standard purposes and distribute the ready product to the consumers and thus achieve more income for the farmers. 

Achievement

- Coffee consumers will buy some of the best freshly roasted coffee beans at very competitive prices (almost 30% less)

- Farmers will earn extra $3 to $6 per kg of coffee beans instead of the currently proposed $0.97. With that, we hope to achieve the dream of several families to rebuild or better their lives through their very hard work. 

What We Need  & Our Way to Say ''Thank You''

Your contribution will go toward the purchase of a full coffee roasting equipment, and its professional set up in North Carolina, USA. 

With much gratitude for helping us, depending on your level of support (1) you will enter a sweepstake for a full week sponsored/paid visit to Rwanda during the upcoming coffee harvest season FOR A COUPLE (2) you will enter a sweepstake for a full week sponsored/paid visit to Rwanda during the upcoming coffee harvest season  FOR AN INDIVIDUAL. (3) you will receive 2 kg of freshly roasted Rwanda and/or DR Congo coffee (4) you will receive 1 kg of freshly roasted Rwanda. 

As the campaign leader, I am starting this journey hoping to reach deep down the heart of several good people I have met or not, but I am so sure they are out there. It is about that lady or man, somewhere in the DR Congo or Rwanda, who survived an ordeal of human cruelty but still gives life to her/his children and dreams for a better tomorrow as she/he tends on her/his coffee farm, her/his family.  She/he does not quit and so I will pray that you join us till we reach this goal, please. 

The Impact

It is unfortunate that, regardless of their hard labor, in Rwanda and the DR Congo the majority of the poorest in any given community are farmers.

Members of our cooperatives are trapped in cycles of poverty partly because they are unable to generate enough revenue to meet their families basic needs of nutrition, education, health.  These have serious, lifelong effects,  especially for children, robbing them of their full potential as they grow up.

These challenges are not insurmountable, and much has already been achieved with the coffee farmers. Poverty is a solvable problem. This campaign is among the last nails to offer around 1,100 families tools to prosper. 

It is known that when farmers earn better and prosper, their communities also fair well. Living Again Coffee working with farmers will allow thousands of farmers to have more income and thus build more businesses in their communities, and they help themselves.  

Two years ago, in the effort to secure more funds to finance several social projects, after years of successfully selling coffee beans in more than 20 countries, DeLosAndes , a cooperative of  3,600 members coffee farmers from Antioquia in Colombia decided to do the same! 

We are asking for the same opportunity, please. 

Risks & Challenges

The Eastern part of the Democratic of Congo where the cooperatives we are working with grow coffee is still a very fragile region with more than 70 active rebel groups that, alongside the Congolese Army, could wreak havoc displacing or killing thousands of farmers and their families.

The upcoming December presidential election could trigger bloody conflict again cutting access to our coffee beans. The current spread of the EBOLA virus could do the same. 

In that case, we will only bring in to roast our current stock from Rwanda. 

It is understandable that the experience is new. We will solely rely on the market knowledge, roasting, packing and distribution experience already existing here in North Carolina. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Tell everyone you know.

story:
JAZZEDY is a multi-tiered culinary enterprise consisting of: Catering services, Culinary instruction, and with YOUR help, a local Bistro. 

JAZZEDY, which is a contraction of Executive Chef and Owner, D.C. Bland II's two daughters, Jasmine and Kennedy (and he is a gospel and jazz bass guitarist), started as a vision while he was still a student at the prestigious and world-renowned Le Cordon Bleu College of Culinary Arts - Scottsdale. His desire was to create a culinary organization that combined the "art on a plate" approach used by upscale restaurants with the re-interpretation of comfort food served by mom and pop establishments.

A member of the American Culinary Federation and the Personal and Private Chefs Association, Chef D.C. brings over 30 years of experience "on the line" and in the management suite. He has won culinary competitions such as Le Cordon Bleu's "Titanium Chef" and  was a member of the 2011 Scottsdale Culinary Festival's winning team while still a student! Chef D.C. has cooked for numerous professional football, baseball, golf, and hockey athletes, gold record awarded musicians, Olympic gold medalist, Dan O'Brien, members of Congress, and even President Bill Clinton!

Chef D.C. has been responsible for the management and operations of numerous culinary establishments in Scottsdale, Boston, and Central Iowa and has been instrumental in many staff morale and financial turnarounds for other owners and will wield that same expertise in his own establishment.

We are seeking Indiegogo crowdfunding support in the amount of $7,000 which will go to toward down payments for a full commercial kitchen. finish tile work in the Art Culinaire studio, remove peeling ceiling paint, and seal exposed brick. These funds will also be the lynch pin in obtaining Government grants and low-interest Targeted Small Business loans which will be used for dining room furniture, tableware, and general operating expenses for the first few months until revenues are sufficient enough to run in the black.

In exchange for your generous pre-opening support, we have an amazing incentive program filled with various perks as our way of saying "Thanks for supporting our campaign!!"

Sound intriguing so far??? Good!

We have great friends and supporters who want us to succeed and we fully anticipate reaching our goal of $7,000 with this incentive program, but in the (unlikely) event we fall a bit short, we'll use whatever pledges we've collected to address the kitchen and dining room issues first and save the Private Dining Room and Art Culinaire studio for when things slow down a bit, but even if YOU can't make a pledge, you can still help out by spreading the word and contact your family and friends to let them know of our campaign...and then ALL of you joining us at the bistro when when we plan to open in time for the festive Holiday season!

Thank you, God Bless, and see you at JAZZEDY Bistro!

 

​

​
