story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is John Thomas.   I have been a teacher for the past 17 years and a competitive BBQ Pit-master since 2014.  In 2018, I moved back to my home state of Montana after 20+ years in Virginia with my wife and family.  We moved home to be closer to my parents and sister.  While in Virginia, my best friend and I competed 2 or 3 times a year in BBQ Competitions.  While we were strictly amateurs, it was fun to go up against the power house BBQ teams such as Jack's Old South, Cool Smoke, and Aporkcalypse Now.  When we got to Montana I decided 1.  I would continue to compete in BBQ Competitions and 2. I wanted to teach my high school students the art of smoking meats competitively. 

That first year we did not have a lot of members, but it created a nice foundation for this year.  This year, with more advertising and a lot of BBQ, our numbers have swelled to 15 members.  Every other week - in an attempt to practice for competition BBQ, I make up some BBQ treats for the club and we feast on pulled pork, St Louis Ribs, BBQ Beans and Mac N Cheese, beef short ribs, or whatever I have been practicing on.  We discuss rubs and sauces and regional style of BBQ.  My hope is to have the kids compete against each other in a BBQ competition before the end of the school year.

As a teacher, it became clear that our community has a lot of people in need.   It hit home when I found out one of my wife's students and her family were living at the homeless shelter.  I decided we should help out the community if we can.  I approached our group  about raising food for the shelter.  They decided we should spend a couple weekends this spring (once it warms up a bit) smoking some BBQ for the people in the shelter.  It is the perfect opportunity for them to work on their skills, but also help people in need.

I hope to raise money to pay for the shelter, but also to keep feeding my students in an attempt to teach them various styles of BBQ.   My wife and I are both teachers. We do not make a lot of money, but we enjoy BBQ and love to share it with friends, family and of course my students.  This will continue whether our goal is accomplished or not.

By donating to this cause you will be supporting the education of students in the art of BBQ skills and possibly a future in the food service industry, the teaching of charitable work for those kids and the donation of food to those less fortunate.    I look forward to working with the kids this spring and hope you can be part of this wonderful experience.

What We Need & What You Get

Donations will help pay for the meats, wood and supplies for producing BBQ.  

Feeding my kids BBQ twice a month - showing them different types of BBQ styles costs between $50-75 each time.  

Feeding the homeless will  cost around $125  each time we do it, which should feed about 50 people.  I would like to bring food to the shelter 3 or 4 times during the spring.  More if possible.  

If you choose to help, you can earn various perks for your donations from Bengal BBQ recipes to BBQ Club T-shirts, to BBQ meals.  Hopefully these will inspire you to donate.

Now, if we do not reach our goal - 100% of the donations will still be used to offset costs.  The primary goal for this campaign is to feed the kids and the homeless.  No matter what - I will continue to feed my students BBQ as part of their learning and we will donating to the shelter this spring either way.  You can help pay with your donations and help.  If we reach our goal - all other funds will be used to continue to feed the homeless shelter.

The Impact

  • Your donation helps feed the homeless in Helena.
  • Your donation helps teach high school students skills that they can use once they leave school and provide them with valuable work experience, learning teamwork, philanthropy and responsibility.
  • Please help me teach these kids how to BBQ and help others by doing it.

Risks & Challenges

This is really a low risk and high reward campaign.  I will continue to bring food for my students twice a month and introduce them to various BBQ styles.  Before we decided to raise funds, the students and I both agreed that we would buy whatever meats we were cooking for the shelter ourselves.  If we don't raise enough money - we will do it by ourselves.  And I am more than happy to continue cooking for my students - but it would be nice to have some help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with anyone you think might want to help.  

If you are local to Helena, follow BIg Boyz BBQ on Twitter and keep an eye out for upcoming Fundraising BBQ events  (@BigBoyzBBQ).

If you are local to Helena and have wood you can donate - we use hard woods only such as apple, oak, hickory, pecan, cherry or maple.

We can also use charcoal donations.  You can contact us @ Bigboyzbbque@gmail.com.

 

Thank you for considering donating to our BBQ Campaign.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, my name is John Thomas.   I have been a teacher for the past 17 years and a competitive BBQ Pit-master since 2014.  In 2018, I moved back to my home state of Montana after 20+ years in Virginia with my wife and family.  We moved home to be closer to my parents and sister.  While in Virginia, my best friend and I competed 2 or 3 times a year in BBQ Competitions.  While we were strictly amateurs, it was fun to go up against the power house BBQ teams such as Jack's Old South, Cool Smoke, and Aporkcalypse Now.  When we got to Montana I decided 1.  I would continue to compete in BBQ Competitions and 2. I wanted to teach my high school students the art of smoking meats competitively. 
That first year we did not have a lot of members, but it created a nice foundation for this year.  This year, with more advertising and a lot of BBQ, our numbers have swelled to 15 members.  Every other week - in an attempt to practice for competition BBQ, I make up some BBQ treats for the club and we feast on pulled pork, St Louis Ribs, BBQ Beans and Mac N Cheese, beef short ribs, or whatever I have been practicing on.  We discuss rubs and sauces and regional style of BBQ.  My hope is to have the kids compete against each other in a BBQ competition before the end of the school year.
As a teacher, it became clear that our community has a lot of people in need.   It hit home when I found out one of my wife's students and her family were living at the homeless shelter.  I decided we should help out the community if we can.  I approached our group  about raising food for the shelter.  They decided we should spend a couple weekends this spring (once it warms up a bit) smoking some BBQ for the people in the shelter.  It is the perfect opportunity for them to work on their skills, but also help people in need.
I hope to raise money to pay for the shelter, but also to keep feeding my students in an attempt to teach them various styles of BBQ.   My wife and I are both teachers. We do not make a lot of money, but we enjoy BBQ and love to share it with friends, family and of course my students.  This will continue whether our goal is accomplished or not.
By donating to this cause you will be supporting the education of students in the art of BBQ skills and possibly a future in the food service industry, the teaching of charitable work for those kids and the donation of food to those less fortunate.    I look forward to working with the kids this spring and hope you can be part of this wonderful experience.

What We Need & What You Get
Donations will help pay for the meats, wood and supplies for producing BBQ.  
Feeding my kids BBQ twice a month - showing them different types of BBQ styles costs between $50-75 each time.  
Feeding the homeless will  cost around $125  each time we do it, which should feed about 50 people.  I would like to bring food to the shelter 3 or 4 times during the spring.  More if possible.  
If you choose to help, you can earn various perks for your donations from Bengal BBQ recipes to BBQ Club T-shirts, to BBQ meals.  Hopefully these will inspire you to donate.
Now, if we do not reach our goal - 100% of the donations will still be used to offset costs.  The primary goal for this campaign is to feed the kids and the homeless.  No matter what - I will continue to feed my students BBQ as part of their learning and we will donating to the shelter this spring either way.  You can help pay with your donations and help.  If we reach our goal - all other funds will be used to continue to feed the homeless shelter.

The Impact

Your donation helps feed the homeless in Helena.
Your donation helps teach high school students skills that they can use once they leave school and provide them with valuable work experience, learning teamwork, philanthropy and responsibility.
Please help me teach these kids how to BBQ and help others by doing it.


Risks & Challenges
This is really a low risk and high reward campaign.  I will continue to bring food for my students twice a month and introduce them to various BBQ styles.  Before we decided to raise funds, the students and I both agreed that we would buy whatever meats we were cooking for the shelter ourselves.  If we don't raise enough money - we will do it by ourselves.  And I am more than happy to continue cooking for my students - but it would be nice to have some help.

Other Ways You Can Help
Share this campaign with anyone you think might want to help.  
If you are local to Helena, follow BIg Boyz BBQ on Twitter and keep an eye out for upcoming Fundraising BBQ events  (@BigBoyzBBQ).
If you are local to Helena and have wood you can donate - we use hard woods only such as apple, oak, hickory, pecan, cherry or maple.
We can also use charcoal donations.  You can contact us @ Bigboyzbbque@gmail.com.
 
Thank you for considering donating to our BBQ Campaign.

story:
About JOY food vintage camper

This 1968 Fireball Meteor food vintage camper will be an original one of kind and unique in it’s own way. The vision for this camper is to provide full service catering from "Out of the Box'.  Her name is JOY.  She will include a full on commercial grade kitchen that will be able to server over 200 guests.  JOY will also include a full bar set up for Mixologist to bartend. Included will be a great sound system with an old school record player for guest to spin vinyl’s.  It will have beautiful windows on all sides that will open for food and cocktail service.  There will seating for 12 guests on the out side. The interior of JOY will be full of colors. It is a mini restaurant on wheels with a modern vintage, southern eclectic style

In every JOY experience, will include a chef, server and bartender based upon your needs.  We will have themes and customized menus for you to choose from to assist you with and your JOY RIDE. She will offer full catering for private dinners, weddings, reunions, social mixers, non-profit & profit events, tail gate or block parties, resident retentions, corporate events, movie night, or businesses that offer food trucks for there staff. The list is endless and permit permitted. But wait there is more ... JOY will be available to rent. This detail is still in the making however just another great perk of bringing JOY to the party. 

As we continue, this working journey together your contribution and support is needed to put JOY together. 

 

 What JOY Needs:

  • YOU!
  • Trailer conversion from "Dent Unlimited" from Ben Wheeler Texas, this company is my "Fixer Upper" they will transform the camper into JOY the food vintage camper. 
  • Kitchen equipment "Mission's Equipment": Stove, Oven, Refrigerator, Hoods, and Sinks 
  • Permits" Dallas, Frisco, McKinney, Addison, Carrollton, Flower Mound 
  • Interior Details: Cabinets, Flooring, Tiles, Lights, etc.,
  • Exterior: Generator, Windows, Paint

What You Get:

 

We are raffling off a JOY ride!  For contributions of select amounts you will be entered into the raffle to win a private catering event for up to 25 guests in the Dallas Metro-plex area with JOY, as well as other great perks!  The winners of the raffles will be announced at the viewing and launch party for "JOY". This event is scheduled at the end of October 2019, TBD.  You will not have to be present to receive your perk, there will be a celebration event for the grand arrival of JOY.  Donating contributors please take look at some of the perks, that JOYwill have to offer. 

Luxury Lounge serving up to 25 guest:

A modern vintage vibe luxury lounge with southern eclectic hospitality!

This vintage camper will be spinning vinyl’s, with a beautiful display of crudities on the out side and appetizers, cocktails will be served from the inside of “JOY” bringing more “JOY “ to the out side. Great for happy hours and night affairs! All menus will be customized with you and Chef Dorisa Jenea to meet your needs.

Casual Concessions serving up to 25 guest:

Great for graduations, tail gate, office and birthday parties.

For this theme, make it FUNDAY  with your choice  of Taco Tuesday, Burger and Brats, Gourmet Pizza/ Stonehenge, or Movie Night. Bring out Joy for a causal catering and quaint gathering for friends and family. 

Farm to Table Intimate Dinner for 12 guest:

This Farm to Table theme has an intimate sexy setting with a fun twist. It is an interactive dinner for up to 12 guests. We will provide each guest with a basket to pick out his or her Farm ingredients from the Mini Farmers Market that will be provided from the JOY window.  Chef Dorisa Jenea will customize, create and prepare on site a 2-course dinner from the ingredients each guest chooses. The courses will be served with a crafted cocktail from our Mixologist. 

JOY Speak Easy on Wheels for 25 guest:

Add on a Speak Easy to your event. We will provide the Mixologist and create 2 signature handcraft cocktails. Don't forget to bring your vinyls, as JOY will be mixing it up.  This would be a fun addition to any event. 

You get an unbelievable humble person that can't do it by her self.  You get a woman who will make you proud. A woman who would give the shirt of her back to make sure you are eating right and you sprits are well.  You get a self-taught chef, creative business owner with over 25 years of experience. A woman “who knows a thing or two, because she has seen and been through a thing or two.”You get a little black girl, with giant heart, a woman that just wants to make a difference by bringing YOU; JOY.  You get Chef Dorisa Jenea, hard working, dedicated and child of God.  I need your help to continue my journey. 

I also give great HUGS!

story:
Who I am

I have worked for many years in Restaurants, 5 Star Hotels and catering events in London, Paris, NYC, Vancouver and Toronto. I have been train in silver service, offering Service excellence. 

Recently while working an at home dinner for a catering company I saw that the other servers did not know how to approach the client, they were so use to working large events that the 5 star service the client wanted they simply could not do. They were not trained to know how to give great service. I created Festa Fete to focus on training and giving the service needed.

Every hostess/host  would like to enjoy their party, talk with their guests and know that all the little details that matters to them will be done.  And after the event they want to go to bed knowing the next morning they will not be cleaning all day. Our Party Assistants will make it happen. "We have got you". 

Festa Fete is Party Party in Italian and French. Well trained, 5 star servers able to manage small events in homes and offices.  

Funding will allow Festa Fete vision to expand using the technology of today to drive the growth of the company with the creation of the App.

What We Need 

Festa Fete is currently a word of mouth business, slowly building clientele and training staff to offer

service excellence. We would like to grow and expand and therefore need funding. To do so we have

created the phases we will be following over the next 6 months.

Phase 1 - 

 Create training manual,  uniform designs, equipment, tool. 

Advertising , legal and increase branding          - $50,000

Phase 2-

Creation of the App

App management,  Office and office staff          - $200,000

Phase 3-

Merchandise online sales                                        - $50,000

The Impact

Most good ideas die because there is no funding. Your donation will help our brand become international. 

Risks & Challenges

All new businesses will have challenges, finding clients and the right staff. Making sure that legal rights and protections are in place for property, staff and clients. Safety. Not rushing too quickly to accept work,. Finding the right staff and making sure they are trained and ready. Having enough funds and anticipating possible financial set backs..

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, family, coworkers. All your social media. We are not looking for you to give so much but if a few people give $10 and then tell their friends, social media followers and do so and so on. Suddenly a little idea will become a reality and you will be walking pass a Festa fete server on their way to a party and recognize the logo on their equipment bag and know you helped make it happen!! All it took was $5, $10, $100 and telling others.

story:
Mola Foods BBQ sauce is simply an awesome barbecue sauce born in New Hampshire with the help of an awesome intern. We wanted to put a twist of the Cameroonian culture in a barbecue sauce and ended up creating this fantastic sauce. It gives you the best of both worlds.  We do not use artificial colors or flavors, artificial preservatives, or added water and thickeners.  Our BBQ uses organic ingredients. What started as an idea has grown to a full blown venture.

Available in glass jars, Mola Foods products are the perfect option for flavor aficionados who appreciate BBQ sauces, seasonings, relishes, and marinades that have the ability to transform even the most common meals.

Our uncompromising commitment to taste, texture, and quality reflects in our selection of only the finest and naturally sourced ingredients, delivering a flavor-packed experience for both flavor novice and connoisseur.

 

By the end of 2019, the goal is to expand the Mola Foods line and introduce other cultures and flavors and launch a tasting bar where people will be able to taste the various cultures in one place.

 

 

 

Mola Foods prides itself on creating tastes and flavors from around the world. The company uses recipes that have survived from a rich heritage and have been passed down from generation to generation. 

 

At Last, ready-to-use culture in a bottle

Our vision is to change the food industry and become the kitchen staple in every household with our culture in a bottle. Mola products are made from real natural ingredients without any added preservatives.

Mola Foods produces what we believe to be an iconic line of spices, sauces, and condiments derived from a variety of authentic African recipes. We control the quality of the ingredients that go into our products as well as the mixing and packaging process. This contrasts with our competition who focus on mass-market goals rather than authentic, heritage-based recipes.

The reason for this is simple: we create a culture in a bottle. This means that with each use of the assorted flavors, customers can feel like they have been transported to a new country. 

The company’s end goal is to continue to create new flavors, satisfy each customer’s craving for something packed with flavor and to become an essential item in kitchens all over the world—all the while maintaining an affordable value.

 

WHY buy many spices, herbs, seasonings, AND THEN GO THROUGH THE GUESSWORK OF BALANCING FLAVORS WHEN ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS OPEN THE BOTTLE AND THEN SPRINKLE TO ENJOY?

We use natural ingredients because we care about quality, health benefits and -- of course -- taste:

  • Natural ingredients
  • Authentic Recipes
  • The right ingredients for a delicious meal
  • Vegan Certified
  • Meets Organic standards
  • Secret Spices

The ingredients are all-natural and have no additives or preservatives.

OUR STORY

I launched Mola Foods in 2016 with 4 chili relishes and one spice blend.  Since then,  we have grown to a full flesh business with 13 new products total. Thanks to dedicated fans of Mola Foods (see the testimonials below), sold to people all over the United States, Now it's time to take Mola Foods to the next level: established it as "the culture in a bottle" brand.

Hitting our target goal of $5000 will allow us to increase our presence in the United States in so doing create an inside marketing position to position our brand in the USA.

Hitting our stretch goal of $10000 will allow us to rent a small retail space to house our tasting bar allowing people to experience various cultures in one single place.

Hitting our second stretch goal of $25000 will allow us, in addition to opening a tasting bar, create job opportunities and increase inventory. 

By supporting this campaign, you will be among the first to get Mola Foods 4 additional upcoming flavors before they are commercially available. We'll also hook you up with some unique Mola Foods' swag.

If we aren't able to achieve the campaign's financial goals, we will still put the money raised towards flavor development and you will still get to have the flavors before anyone else. 

The Impact

My goal, from the beginning, has been to help people experience the culture and inspire them to use more spices when cooking as well as creating new jobs, hiring people, teaching professional skills to the next generation of workers and leaders, and creating a positive impact in the community. the backing of this campaign will bring that goal one step closer to fruition by helping pave the way to grow distribution in a way that many will be provided opportunities to expand their wings in so doing expand our company.

Other Ways You Can Help

"But Jeannette," you may be asking, "what if I can't help with this campaign right now" What a good question. Here's how else you can help:

Share this campaign far and wide, with everyone you know. The more people that see it, the more likely we'll find people who can back it.

"Like" us on Facebook

Follow us on Instagram

Thank you, thank you, a thousand times thank you for helping.

 

 

Meet Jeannette Bryant founder of Mola Foods, Inc. Cameroonian born. She offers spice blends and chili relishes inspired by exotic locations and exciting cooking styles like Morocco, Ethiopia, India and more. “We hope to create awareness about a revolutionary way of adding spices into cooking and bringing life to dishes,” Bryant said. I started Mola Foods as a way to help people experience the culture and inspire them to use more spices when cooking. We create what I call culture in a bottle by mixing all the spices used by each country in one bottle. In turn, we create flavor profiles that people are able to use and create delicious meals as they get transported to each cultural destination.

 

The Mola Foods unisex T-Shirt

 
Testimonials

"But Jeannette," you may be asking, "what if I can't help with this campaign right now" What a good question. Here's how else you can help:
Share this campaign far and wide, with everyone you know. The more people that see it, the more likely we'll find people who can back it.
"Like" us on Facebook
Follow us on Instagram
Thank you, thank you, a thousand times thank you for helping.
 

 
Meet Jeannette Bryant founder of Mola Foods, Inc. Cameroonian born. She offers spice blends and chili relishes inspired by exotic locations and exciting cooking styles like Morocco, Ethiopia, India and more. “We hope to create awareness about a revolutionary way of adding spices into cooking and bringing life to dishes,” Bryant said. I started Mola Foods as a way to help people experience the culture and inspire them to use more spices when cooking. We create what I call culture in a bottle by mixing all the spices used by each country in one bottle. In turn, we create flavor profiles that people are able to use and create delicious meals as they get transported to each cultural destination.
 

The Mola Foods unisex T-Shirt


 
Testimonials

story:
THE BREW HA

Banjo Cold Brew Coffee™ is a slow-brewed coffee, hand-crafted by steeping our specialty-grade beans in cold filtered water for nearly 24 hours; thus producing a more flavorful, more caffeinated, and less acidic drink (as compared to auto-drip hot coffee or espresso). All-natural with nothing artificial (see the amazingly short ingredients list). Banjo is awesome straight out of the refrigerated bottle, “on the rocks”, or “fine-tuned” to your liking.  It’s even delicious when heated!

Our delectable cold brew comes in two flavors: Original and Sweetened. Banjo is bottled in 32oz recyclable, amber glass howlers for the fridge with a single serve bottle soon to follow. Launching in Atlanta this Spring; we plan to strategically expand nationwide as we grow!


TEAM

Banjo Coffee is a three person band out of Atlanta, Georgia. We are comprised of Billy & Chasidy Atchison (husband and wife) and Sebastian Kegel (German coffee lover). Combining our love of coffee, decades of marketing and product knowledge, and logistic and financial backgrounds, not to mention our keen senses of wit and creative extracts, we bring multiple levels of experience to this product launch.

Our vision is to create and maintain a sustainable and ethical company while crafting the most delicious cold brew coffee ever!

                     


WHAT IS A BANJO COLD BREW

Banjo Cold Brew is a libation for the most perceptive of palates. Produced with artisan-roasted, specialty-grade beans from exotic origins by lovely human beings. Here's how specialty-grade beans rank in the bean world: 

                        

By cold brewing our quality beans (top 10% of beans in the whole world) from South and Latin America you can recognize a sweet, distinctive difference from the first sip. Our Original (Latin American blend) has notes of nutty, caramel flavors, and our Organic Sweetened (Peruvian) has a smooth, chocolate balance. We're proud to note that all of our beans are sourced from farmers at, or above, Fair Trade pricing. 


There are many other benefits to our cold brew, including the following:

  • All-natural, vegan, gluten free, and lactose free. 
  • Typically more caffeinated than your average cup of hot coffee due to the cold brew method.
  • Smooth overall taste!  Some people compare it to a strong tea profile. The coffee doesn’t need any milk or sweetener, but there are those that insist on “fine tuning” to their liking. Hey, everyone’s different. We get it. 
  • Less acidic and easier on the old tum-tum and esophageal region, because we don’t add hot water to the beans while brewing - thus allowing the coffee time to naturally brew with little to no “bite.” 
  • Versatile. You can mix it in recipes - add it to an alcohol for killer cocktails, or use it when cooking rich desserts, like tiramisu.
  • You can even heat it up to satisfy your need for a hot coffee. 

That’s it... a way to revolutionize your coffee routine in one small pour. 


CAFFEINATE RESPONSIBLY

We have a responsibility to our palates to provide delectable tastes whenever possible, but we also strive to be responsible in our approach. Banjo prides itself in being part of the craft coffee movement where there is an emphasis on quality products and quality process. Creating our cold brew in small batches ensures that each batch is perfect. As a consumer you should have a high-quality, crafted coffee ready-to-drink, and it’s part of our company’s mission to deliver that to you, consistently, every time. 

We also believe in doing business responsibly.  This means:

  • Taking time in our process to ensure that we have ethical standards for ourselves and our suppliers, vendors, and ingredients. 
  • Staying as local as possible with all our business dealings. 
  • Repurpose leftover grounds into compost or other products, such as body scrubs. 
  • Recycling and reducing our footprint at each step of the process. 

                                           

We have partnered with a local organization to donate $2.50 per every pound of beans we buy (or $0.25 for each 32oz howler) directly to a food and farming-based charitable project. So every bottle you buy makes you that much more of a super hero! 

Most people drink coffee as a necessity, but we CAFFEINATE RESPONSIBLY.


WHY DO WE NEED INDIEGOGO

  1. Expand manufacturing – we anticipate by summer the need for nearly triple the amount of kitchen hours to produce and bottle Banjo for larger order/stores. 
  2. Buy bottles in bulk supply. 
  3. Launch single serve bottle size so customers can pick up an on-the-go version at stores. 
  4. Event Fees for farmers markets and festivals. 
  5. Sales and Marketing materials to spread the word. 
  6. Retailer fees, demonstrations, and materials.
  7. Food testing and certifications. 
  8. Lawyers fees to assist in the whole ™, ® and other necessities.

                         


HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

Thanks for helping in any way you can...even if you can only contribute a few BUCKS! We have awesome Banjo swag to send your way for those big spenders! Please share the product and this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, smoke signals.... 

www.facebook.com/banjocoldbrew

www.twitter.com/banjocoldbrew

https://instagram.com/banjocoldbrew/

#banjocoldbrew

We look forward to seeing and hearing what you think! Thanks again from team Banjo!

 Retailer fees, demonstrations, and materials.
 Food testing and certifications.

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP
Thanks for helping in any way you can...even if you can only contribute a few BUCKS! We have awesome Banjo swag to send your way for those big spenders! Please share the product and this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, smoke signals.... 
www.facebook.com/banjocoldbrew
www.twitter.com/banjocoldbrew
https://instagram.com/banjocoldbrew/
#banjocoldbrew
We look forward to seeing and hearing what you think! Thanks again from team Banjo!

story:
We want to give you the best cheese experience possible! 

I'm Bruce Younger, owner and Head Cheese at Wholly Cheeses.   After 2 years selling cheese at the Rochester Public Market as a year-round pop-up venue in all kinds of weather, we are getting ready to build out a permanent home inside the new Market Hall! We're really excited about this for a number of reasons:

  • No more moving around – you'll always know where to find us!
  • Weather won't matter! A more comfortable shopping environment  for you... and us!
  • More variety than ever – we'll be able to bring in more delicate products because...
  • REFRIGERATION! Plus storage and display. And this is where YOU can help.

Here's our plan:

  • We need to raise $7500. Here's the breakdown:
    - Refrigerated deli case: $3000
    - Double door refrigeration: 1800
    - Stainless steel prep table: $300
    - Materials for built-in counters and cabinets: $700
    - Storage cabinet: $150
    - Incidental equipment (floor mats, sanitizer dispensers, display trays): $350
    - New signage: $250
    - Construction labor: $950
  • Contributors will receive some awesome rewards (detailed to the right) including product, discounts, swag, special events... even a signed art print!
  • ALL FUNDS will go to improving the customer experience, either in new or better equipment or – if we exceed our goal – into NEW & DIFFERENT product.

Wholly Cheeses is all about the CUSTOMER

Cheese is not just a product we sell, it's a passion. In some ways, cheese is even more varied and nuanced than wine (our favorite thing to pair with). And all of our customers know that we LOVE to talk about cheese. Whether it's the point of origin, how it's made, the various flavor profiles, how to pair it or how to use it in recipes, we enjoy sharing the information.

By contributing to our build-out, you'll be helping us with our mission to bring you the freshest, best overall variety of cheese at affordable prices and excellent customer service.

Updated Perk: Limited Edition Art Print by Bruce Younger!

Drawing on his background (pun intended) in Fine Arts and Graphic Design, Bruce has created this special art print as part of the fundraising campaign that all contributors receive above the $15 level. 

Can't Invest? You Can Still Help!

Maybe you can't afford to invest in us right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Share this campaign with your friends on social media, or patronize us at the Public Market. Every purchase gets us closer to our goal, and your support means a lot to us!

story:
Short Summary

Technically, a group of goats is called a Tribe. Eloise, Cocoa, Dee, Pearl, Penelope, Bee, Thelma, Ella, Rosey, Tippy, Dorothy, Ellen, Ponyo, Bonni, Tiny, Tink, Eve, Ellie, Brownie, Beyonce, Pepper, Penny, Rizzo, Beauty, Princess, Paprika, and a few yet to be named doelings along with the Hall Family, all live on the beautiful property that is Razzbourne Farms in Rockbridge County. In 2014, Emily Hall founded the micro goat dairy and creamery with her husband, CJ, which allowed her to pursue her passion and stay home with their two children. Did we mention they moved the dairy and creamery to their new property in Kerrs Creek in 2017? A lot of obstacles were met and defeated. Just take a look for yourself:

Pre Excavation of building pad and moving the building from Fairfield.

Pad excavation complete!

The entire Razzbourne Farms creamery placed on the completed pad by a 19-year-old employee of Helmuth Builders (Halloween 2017).

Razzbourne Farms has produced fresh CHEVRE weekly and delivered one day fresh to local retailers and restaurants.  The micro goat dairy and creamery's bloomy rind cheeses, KICK ASH and LUCY ROUGE, can be found in downtown Lexington restaurants and small groceries in the area. Emily, the cheesemaker, found herself experimenting at the new property and the results have concluded with semi-hard cheeses bathed in local Rockbridge Vineyard wine or Halcyon Days cider. She hopes to add a beer washed cheese, a brie type cheese, and goat feta. Each Razzbourne Farms product is hand made and in very small batches. This tribute to the terrior that is Rockbridge County is one of a kind.

Two TIPSY rounds before their 48 hour bath in Rockbridge Vineyard Syrah.

 

What They Need & What You Get

Space for Affinage

Temperature and humidity play a role but SPACE is the main issue. The many deep freezers have become inadequate for the type of raw milk aged cheese Razzbourne Farms wants to produce. This campaign will help fund the following:

  • The Cheese Cave Building
  • Excavation & Utilities
  • Interior
    • Locally milled reclaimed Ash shelving best suited for affinage (aging)
    • Wall and floor resurfacing
    • Thermostat and humidity control
  • Equipment & Supplies
  • Indiegogo Fees & Marketing

*Any additional funds raised will go toward perimeter fence building because with goats, there is ALWAYS fence to build.

*Razzbourne Farms will still plan on building the cave, it will just take MUCH longer.

*All perks will be received whether the campaign is funded in full or not.

 

If this campaign is successful Razzbourne Farms will have so much more to offer. Excavation and construction will begin immediately with plans to put the first batch of raw milk cheese in the new cave in March of 2020. If the campaign does not reach the goal, the funds raised will go toward the prefabricated building that will house cheese in the future.

Cheese Cave location to our milking and cheesemaking building.

The cheese cave space - 12x20 Helmuth Building prefabricated building. The interior will be modified to be ideal for aging cheese.

The Impact

Razzbourne Farms has always sold wholesale to promote local business. With the help of some amazing neighbors, they have been able to have a storefront close to home which will be utilized more in 2020. Private cheese tastings are available at predetermined locations by appointment only. Please JoinTheTribe on social media @razzbournefarms to stay up to date on new adventures!

Some facts for you:

  • Razzbourne Farms is the only micro goat dairy and creamery in Rockbridge County.
  • They produce small but delectable batches of farmstead, artisan cheese.
  • The protein structure and lower levels of lactose of goat cheese make it a better choice for people with an intolerance to cow's milk.
  • Razzbourne Farms strives to produce a healthy product that everyone will enjoy. Goat cheese is a low-calorie product at just 75 calories per ounce.
  • Goat's milk is richer in essential nutrients vitamin A, vitamin B, riboflavin, calcium, iron, phosphorus, magnesium, and potassium.
  • Since they're smaller than cows, they require less space and less food. Goats can also survive in places where other dairy animals literally can't: They're opportunistic foragers who happily munch on a wide variety of plants that other ruminants won't eat, like desert scrub, weeds, trees, shrubs, and aromatic herbs.

 

Risks & Challenges

The emerging micro goat dairy and creamery has never had a sophisticated cheese cave and there are expected obstacles to arise but that has never stopped them before.

  • Producing small, handcrafted batches of cheese does possess a quantity issue but Razzbourne Farms has always chosen quality over quantity.
  • Razzbourne Farms will take risks with new recipes and creating new products but how awesome is that!?
  • Affinage is a new concept for the micro goat dairy and creamery since it has only focused on fresh and ripened cheese until now.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Join the FaceTribe and share the campaign on Facebook!
  • Tag Razzbourne Farms in supportive posts on Instagram, #jointhetribe or @razzbournefarms!
  • Join the email list and stay up to date on the campaign progress.
  • Buy local products from producers who genuinely care about you!

Eat Local. Be Local.

Yearling doe, Princess, will be a three-year commitment until she is part of the permanent Tribe that is Razzbourne Farms.

Join the FaceTribe and share the campaign on Facebook!
Tag Razzbourne Farms in supportive posts on Instagram, #jointhetribe or @razzbournefarms!
Join the email list and stay up to date on the campaign progress.

story:
Short Summary

 

  • Smokin' Angels Q is a food truck in the making. The name comes from my dad and grandfather who both introduced me to BBQ done by smoking; they are my angels.  I am Dorian Barr, a seasoned Nationally Registered Paramedic, that has been honing my skills at cooking and smoking meats since the age of 8 with my dad and grandfather. I am a simple man of few words with a dream to start my passion in life. 
  • This campaign will allow my dream and passion for cooking and feeding people to come to fruition. With this I will be able to bring a whole new dining experience to my community and surrounding communities. 
  • The ability to start this food truck will not only change my life, but, the lives of my family and community. As an owner of a locally owned and operated business this opportunity will allow the company to give back. As a first responder, giving back has been a part of my life for 28  years. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The funding for the entire project $186,400. For the campaign I am asking for the seed money of $100,000, which will secure the SBA loan for the rest of the cost and allow for the purchase of the start up foods, seasonings, wood, and serving products. 
  • Perks! Everyone loves a perk! As a contributor you will receive a car decal.  A contribution of $50 you will receive a Smokin' Angels Q T-Shirt. When you contribute $100, 2 pounds of pulled pork BBQ , which can be frozen and shipped in dry ice if you are not in the local area. At the $1000 level a day with the chef to include how to select, prep, smoke, and pull the BBQ; This will be a local experience and the contributor would provide transportation to the food truck.  Should you feel lead to contribute $10,000 or more a catered dinner of all of the specialties of Smokin' Angels Q to feed 20. This will be offered once the food truck is running and able to travel within 500 miles of the local area here in South Carolina.
  • Should the goal not be met to allow Smokin' Angels Q to receive the loan from the SBA (Small Business Administration) the contributions will be held for a period of 6 months in order to run a second campaign to meet goals. After that 6 months if the goals have not been achieved contributions will be returned. 

 

  • This project will allow a completely new dining and food experience in my community and surrounding communities. This will allow BBQ to be available on a whole new scale. Smokin' Angels Q will bring BBQ to the consumer in a fun and exciting way. 
  • While I do not own a food truck or restaurant as of yet, the demand for the food I produce keeps growing. The only way to expand from gatherings at my home and provide for my community is to begin this food truck.
  • I have spent years perfecting my unique seasoning, affectionately known as "Angel Dust". Much time has gone into fine-tuning my food. At this time I am ready to bring amazing BBQ to the public in a fun new platform.

Risks & Challenges

As with any new venture there are risks and challenges. With a food truck that is a completely new and untested platform in this area, we perceive our risks are the short term excitement and turning that into long term customers and longevity on the whole. Our challenges include keeping pace with demand, keeping the products quality the same each time, and over coming any possible saturation of the market.

  • Hurdles come and are meant to be overcome, as a Paramedic, I was taught to improvise, adapt, and overcome. I have the help of other proven restaurants to rely on for advice and guidance. I have a CPA who keeps all of the fiances on track. 
  • I work with local purveyors of foods to keep supply available. The ability to be mobile and go to festivals and street fairs as well as advertising will assist in making and keeping customers as well as keeping Smokin' Angels Q current. The food will prove the main solvent to longevity. A good product at a reasonable price keeps business.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word! Talk Smokin' Angels Q up! Share to any and all platforms you can. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! Any little bit helps.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 

Smokin' Angels Q is a food truck in the making. The name comes from my dad and grandfather who both introduced me to BBQ done by smoking; they are my angels.  I am Dorian Barr, a seasoned Nationally Registered Paramedic, that has been honing my skills at cooking and smoking meats since the age of 8 with my dad and grandfather. I am a simple man of few words with a dream to start my passion in life. 
This campaign will allow my dream and passion for cooking and feeding people to come to fruition. With this I will be able to bring a whole new dining experience to my community and surrounding communities. 
The ability to start this food truck will not only change my life, but, the lives of my family and community. As an owner of a locally owned and operated business this opportunity will allow the company to give back. As a first responder, giving back has been a part of my life for 28  years. 

 

What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

The funding for the entire project $186,400. For the campaign I am asking for the seed money of $100,000, which will secure the SBA loan for the rest of the cost and allow for the purchase of the start up foods, seasonings, wood, and serving products. 
Perks! Everyone loves a perk! As a contributor you will receive a car decal.  A contribution of $50 you will receive a Smokin' Angels Q T-Shirt. When you contribute $100, 2 pounds of pulled pork BBQ , which can be frozen and shipped in dry ice if you are not in the local area. At the $1000 level a day with the chef to include how to select, prep, smoke, and pull the BBQ; This will be a local experience and the contributor would provide transportation to the food truck.  Should you feel lead to contribute $10,000 or more a catered dinner of all of the specialties of Smokin' Angels Q to feed 20. This will be offered once the food truck is running and able to travel within 500 miles of the local area here in South Carolina.
Should the goal not be met to allow Smokin' Angels Q to receive the loan from the SBA (Small Business Administration) the contributions will be held for a period of 6 months in order to run a second campaign to meet goals. After that 6 months if the goals have not been achieved contributions will be returned. 


 

This project will allow a completely new dining and food experience in my community and surrounding communities. This will allow BBQ to be available on a whole new scale. Smokin' Angels Q will bring BBQ to the consumer in a fun and exciting way. 
While I do not own a food truck or restaurant as of yet, the demand for the food I produce keeps growing. The only way to expand from gatherings at my home and provide for my community is to begin this food truck.
I have spent years perfecting my unique seasoning, affectionately known as "Angel Dust". Much time has gone into fine-tuning my food. At this time I am ready to bring amazing BBQ to the public in a fun new platform.


Risks & Challenges
As with any new venture there are risks and challenges. With a food truck that is a completely new and untested platform in this area, we perceive our risks are the short term excitement and turning that into long term customers and longevity on the whole. Our challenges include keeping pace with demand, keeping the products quality the same each time, and over coming any possible saturation of the market.

Hurdles come and are meant to be overcome, as a Paramedic, I was taught to improvise, adapt, and overcome. I have the help of other proven restaurants to rely on for advice and guidance. I have a CPA who keeps all of the fiances on track. 
I work with local purveyors of foods to keep supply available. The ability to be mobile and go to festivals and street fairs as well as advertising will assist in making and keeping customers as well as keeping Smokin' Angels Q current. The food will prove the main solvent to longevity. A good product at a reasonable price keeps business.


Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Spread the word! Talk Smokin' Angels Q up! Share to any and all platforms you can. 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools! Any little bit helps.

story:
Who We Are

Hello. We are Laurel Cook and Antonio Bonilla, owners of Spirit Bar. We are a liquor infusion and bitters company in Portland, Oregon and we need your help to launch our business! 

       Spirit Bar is a return to the original use of alcohol and spirits as medicine and connection to the land. Spirit Bar infusions and bitters can be used as herbal remedies and as a simple way to make a complex cocktail with less ingredients. Through sourcing local spirits and herbs we strive to support local farmers and distillers. Our infusions educate our customers on the history of alcohol as a vehicle for plant medicine. Our goal is to bring intention back to imbibement.

We are minority business owners raising money to get our company off the ground. Portland is a town where small businesses thrive, but only a small percentage are minority owned. After working in the service industry for at least a decade each, we are prepared to make our own way with an idea we care about deeply. 

For over two years we have been developing recipes, educating ourselves in herbal medicine, and creating a buzz though tasting parties. Our local market is eagerly awaiting our products. Your contribution will help us turn this dream into a reality. 


 

What We Need

We need your help to assist with basic start up costs including:

-Licensing 

-Work Space rental

-Bulk herbs and liquor

-Production supplies

-Branding and Marketing

Perks!

As well as the opportunity to support two minority business owners and help two passionate people achieve their dreams of creating delicious infused liquor, we are also offering you:

  • A hand crafted charm featuring a medicinal herb
  • A hand screen printed tote bag featuring an original illustration by Laurel
  • A ticket to our amazing launch party that includes delicious food, cocktails, and a special gift bag with samples of our products. This party will you give you an opportunity to meet us and taste our products in person!
  • A private tasting of our infusions and bitters in your home.
  • A custom infusion made to your taste and wellness needs
  • A private dinner party with paired cocktails

Please see our perks section for details and combinations.

In the unlikely event that we do not reach our funding goal, every penny donated will still go straight to our business. Meeting our funding goal would ensure that we do not have to take out a loan. 

Why We're Different

We realize as cocktail enthusiasts that your local liquor store already has a whole shelf of flavored vodkas and traditional bitters. We feel that our products are unique enough to stand out. Spirit Bar infusions aren't created from artificial flavorings and don't contain added sugar. They are an exciting option for those with mature palates who are ready for something new and exciting.

Take our Wild Weed Blend, for example. Starting with a gluten free neutral spirit, we infuse chamomile, lemon balm, and dandelion root to create an herbaceous, easy to drink liquor that soothes your stomach and nerves. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute to our campaign financially, please consider:

  • Sharing our campaign with 2 or 3 of your friends and asking them to do the same. 
  • Following our Social Media pages and leaving encouraging comments. @spiritbarpdx
  • Joining our email list to receive future updates and track our success.  https://mailchi.mp/4ca42c222b86/spiritbar 
  • Thinking good thoughts and sending good vibes our way as we strive to achieve our dreams.

story:
Overview

Wow! That’s the reaction we’ve gotten so far from the previews of our new coffeehouse space, as well as from those who have already tasted and/or ordered our in-house roasted coffee! Vibe Coffeehouse & Café is about 80% ready to open its doors, but we realize now, we need a bit more help to truly make our space and our business the place that our community deserves. That’s why we’ve opened this campaign to raise funds to assist with the remaining start-up costs, so that the anticipation (ours and those awaiting our opening) toward opening our doors, can make way for actually opening. This coffeehouse, coming soon to the heart of downtown Lima, Ohio (as well as via our online store) will truly be an amazing space where all can come to enjoy the relaxed, urban, industrial space fit for a modernizing, growing, downtown! As you get into the holiday spirit, please consider help us get there! We’ll make it worth your while!

 

Short Summary

Vibe Coffeehouse & Café is opening in the heart of downtown Lima with the intention of being the community’s chosen space to come to relax, socialize, or work, all while being exposed to world cultures and people over a delicious, locally roasted cup of coffee or other beverages and/or small food items. We will provide a unique, comfortable, and cool atmosphere, where learning also occurs, by utilizing the globally universal love of coffee (and tea), to expose the community to world cultures and people. We source our green coffee beans from responsible wholesales, distributors, farms, and cooperatives; and we specialize in African origin coffees, but we also have coffees from all over the world. Our focus on African coffees will be unique to the area, and we will utilize the owners direct connections to the Continent, to make sure we have the best, quality, and delicious African coffees available! Equally important, we roast our own coffee in-house, treating them gently and with care, so that you get fresh, flavorful coffee like you’ve never had before!

 

The Coffeehouse was started by Carlton McLellan, a lover of coffeehouses as places for social engagement, relaxation, reflection, and inspiration. Joining Carlton in this dream, is long-time friend, William “Bill” Steward, who shares the commitment to the community and the wonderful things the coffeehouse can do for and in the community.

 

Carton has spent time in hundreds, perhaps thousands, of coffeehouses on four of the world’s seven continents (and he hopes to do so on the remaining three continents that he has yet to visit) and he has enjoyed great coffees and diverse and engaging people and atmospheres in everyone one. He's recently spent a lot of time on the African continent, and as such, he's discovered a love of African coffees that he'll bring to Vibe and the community! This love and appreciation for the coffeehouse as a space, as well as for the coffee (and other beverages and foods served) itself, will be evident in Vibe’s space. Vibe, located in a large, remodeled, yet comfortable warehouse space, will invite the community in to enjoy “The Place, the Space, the Taste!”

 

We tried to get the space ready using our own resources, and some great support from a couple of small business lending sources. After overcoming some hiccups along the way, we are as committed as ever to getting the space ready to open, and we are about 80% there. With your help, you can push us over the to! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Vibe Coffeehouse & Café isn’t looking for charity…we’re looking for support from, and partnership with the community we seek to serve – our hometown community and lovers of great coffee and coffeehouses. We’re looking for you to donate/invest in us as we prepare to invest in you! For your support, you will not only have the satisfaction of knowing you have helped bring a vibrant, relaxing, and cool community space to downtown Lima, but you’ll also be rewarded with some amazing perks! Our perk structure is tiered and each tier builds off the previous one, so the more you donate/invest the more you get in return.  For instance, at the mid-range level ($200) you receive 1 pound of Vibe Roasted Coffee (single origin), a Vibe Family Member decal, a coupon for your first drink free in Vibe (drink of your choice, once we open), 15% Off Online Orders for Six Months, 15% Off In-House Orders, every Monday and Wednesday, for Six Months, and a Vibe Coffeehouse & Café T-Shirt. The more you donate/invest, the better and better the great perks get! 

 

  • Vibe Coffeehouse & Café is hoping to raise $25,000 to help with start-up costs. Start-up costs include the following:
    • Cost associated with the leased space (rent, utilities, etc.)
    • Completion of renovations in the space including:
      • Instillation of updated electrical, HVAC, and plumbing systems and infrastructure
      • Point of sales system
      • Drive-Thru window resources (menu board, communications system, etc.)
    • Two weeks of operating costs (inventory, wages, etc.)
    • Soft Opening Community Preview Event
  • Even if Vibe Coffeehouse & Café does not reach our goal of $25,000 by the target date, the raised funds will still go towards the previously mentioned items. Whatever we don't raise through this campaign, we will continue to seek out ways to raise the needed funds to get the space open and ready to serve the community!

 

About the Leadership:

  • Carlton McLellan – Carlton was born and raised in Lima, graduating from Lima Senior High School in 1992 (Go Spartans!). By profession, he is a diplomacy and international affairs expert, having worked for over 21 years developing, managing, and evaluating international people-to-people exchange programs across the world for small and large nonprofit organizations, the U.S. government, and international development agencies. Through this work, he has traveled extensively across the world and been exposed me to many different cultures. This work and these travels have allowed him to sample coffees all over the world; visit and frequent coffeehouses/coffee shops globally (in over 30 countries); and, study and learn about the global coffee industry first hand. He is combining this global exposure and love for travel with his love of coffee and coffeehouses, and his commitment to giving back to his hometown through opening this exciting new business in the heart of downtown Lima!

 

  • William “Bill” Steward – Bill was also born and raised in Lima, and graduated from Lima Senior High School in 1992. As an active member of the Lima community, and an employee of one its most well-known companies (Proctor & Gamble), Bill possesses invaluable insights and experiences on company operations, customer relations, and marketing that he will put to use on behalf of Vibe. He also shares Carlton’s passion for coffeehouses, and particularly for the key role Vibe can play in providing our hometown community with a place of inspiration where they can come to relax, socialize, or work while enjoying a delicious cup of locally roasted coffee!


  Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute with funds today, you can still help Vibe Coffeehouse & Café by getting the word out about this donation drive, as well as our coffeehouse coming to the community. Share this campaign on your social media, as well as via word of mouth, and when/if we can tie a donator or supporter directly to you, we’ll make sure we show our gratitude!  

 

You can also jump online (vibecoffeehouse.com) and visit our Online Store and place an order of one or more of our great coffees or other products!

 

Extra Special Gift for Holiday Season Contributions:

**If you contribute at the $200 level or higher by 9:00 PM on December 15, 2019, you’ll also receive our special Vibe Holiday Coffee Treasure Box, filled with delicious, freshly roasted coffees including the special “Winter Grogg”; “Peppermint Mocha”, and our own in-house crafted “Bourbon Barrel Aged coffee”. All perfect for the holiday season!

story:
Honey is the one sweetener that doesn't need processing.

Honey is ready to eat right out of the hive

 

But that purity is being challenged

Syrups from starch are being added to honey. These syrups have none of the richness of natural honey. None of the flavour and character – none of why people call honey “the nectar of the gods”

It's time to stop this. People deserve to know what they are eating

We are Jerry and Peter Awram, long-time beekeepers.  Jerry starting in 1956 and his son, Peter, grew up in the business. We’ve spent countless days searching for queens, splitting hives and pulling honey. We know bees and we know honey. 

 

Real honey is like wine. It differs depending on the flowers the bees visit, the time of year and the weather.  All these combine to give a delectable flavour that can't be matched. People should be able to taste the sharp flavour of honey from Maple trees, the light taste of Fireweed and the pungency of Buckwheat. 

Starch Syrups have none of the richness of honey

For well over a decade now, honey adulteration has been increasing at an alarming rate. The biggest food fraud case in history involved fraud in honey of over $80 million in 2010, but it didn't stop anything. Honey fraud has been getting worse since then.  Some countries have more than doubled the amount of honey they export with no increase in hive numbers. This is while hive yields in North and South America and Europe have declined. 

The numbers don't add up. The data show that up to 40% more honey is being sold than is being made by bees.

There is a new technology that allows detection of these Starch Syrups

Magnetic Resonance is one of the most powerful analytical methods available today. MRI machines in hospitals use the same technology to image people's bodies. With magnetic resonance you can make an "image" of honey. You can see everything making up that richness. The images from starch syrups are flat and lifeless.

 

True Honey Buzz has one of only a handful of Magnetic Resonance Machines in the world for testing honey.

We can now image honey and challenge the scammers head on.

Our Honey Screener is a research quality Magnetic Resonance capable of examining a wide range of materials. It is currently set up to look at honey, wine and juice, but would not be out of place in top university labs. We are collaborating with several researchers at the University of British Columbia to compare the data generated with our machine to with that of Raman Spectrophotometry  and Mass Spectrometry. 

Magnetic Resonance uses a super-conducting magnet to "ring" the honey sample like a bell - or a whole orchestra. Then you listen to the "sound" or resonance that comes back. Honey sounds like a rich symphony, while starch syrup is like the annoying buzz of the alarm clock in the morning.

The image that is generated by Magnetic Resonance is like a fingerprint. Unique to the flower and where the honey came from.

But like a fingerprint, you need a database to compare it against and the larger the database the better. And our test is more like a DNA fingerprint. We can see the related samples as well as the identical matches. We need good honey samples to generate the database. That's where we need your help. Beekeepers and Honey Lovers around the world need to send us samples. This will help us expand the honey database and we will give you an analysis report of the sample you sent in. 

We are able to identify sugars, amino acids and other organic compounds allowing us to give you a good idea of the content of your honey. As the database grows it is possible to re-examine the data and find out more about the sample. 

More samples means more data. We need samples from around the world.  Everywhere that bees make honey and from every flower that they gather nectar.

All beekeepers need to worry about adulterated honey

Starch syrups are too easy to get. A quick internet search will yield a dozen in a few seconds, 

 

All Beekeepers need to fight this - the purity of honey is being destroyed by these scammers. 

 

You can help!

 

The evidence is clear. We live in a world of fake honey. It needs to be stopped at all levels. You can support us by buying a test and sending us a sample of honey. 

Don't have your own honey?

Find honey from someone else - your local beekeeper or off the store shelf and get the data we need to convince the government that we need to crack down on this phoney honey.

Can't afford a full test - then hit the donate button - we will put your donation to good work and let you access the map showing our results.

Once samples start coming in we will show you what we are finding and keep you up to date on our successes in fighting honey fraud.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let others know about this problem

  • Send a letter to your government official telling them that you don't like what is happening
  • Share our campaign on Facebook and other places

This is a problem for everyone. Whether you eat honey or not. Bees are so much more than honey.

Our Honey Screener is a research quality Magnetic Resonance capable of examining a wide range of materials. It is currently set up to look at honey, wine and juice, but would not be out of place in top university labs. We are collaborating with several researchers at the University of British Columbia to compare the data generated with our machine to with that of Raman Spectrophotometry  and Mass Spectrometry. 
Magnetic Resonance uses a super-conducting magnet to "ring" the honey sample like a bell - or a whole orchestra. Then you listen to the "sound" or resonance that comes back. Honey sounds like a rich symphony, while starch syrup is like the annoying buzz of the alarm clock in the morning.
The image that is generated by Magnetic Resonance is like a fingerprint. Unique to the flower and where the honey came from.

But like a fingerprint, you need a database to compare it against and the larger the database the better. And our test is more like a DNA fingerprint. We can see the related samples as well as the identical matches. We need good honey samples to generate the database. That's where we need your help. Beekeepers and Honey Lovers around the world need to send us samples. This will help us expand the honey database and we will give you an analysis report of the sample you sent in. 
We are able to identify sugars, amino acids and other organic compounds allowing us to give you a good idea of the content of your honey. As the database grows it is possible to re-examine the data and find out more about the sample. 
More samples means more data. We need samples from around the world.  Everywhere that bees make honey and from every flower that they gather nectar.

All beekeepers need to worry about adulterated honey
Starch syrups are too easy to get. A quick internet search will yield a dozen in a few seconds, 

 
All Beekeepers need to fight this - the purity of honey is being destroyed by these scammers. 
 
You can help!
 
The evidence is clear. We live in a world of fake honey. It needs to be stopped at all levels. You can support us by buying a test and sending us a sample of honey. 
Don't have your own honey?
Find honey from someone else - your local beekeeper or off the store shelf and get the data we need to convince the government that we need to crack down on this phoney honey.
Can't afford a full test - then hit the donate button - we will put your donation to good work and let you access the map showing our results.
Once samples start coming in we will show you what we are finding and keep you up to date on our successes in fighting honey fraud.

Other Ways You Can Help
Let others know about this problem

Send a letter to your government official telling them that you don't like what is happening
Share our campaign on Facebook and other places

This is a problem for everyone. Whether you eat honey or not. Bees are so much more than honey.

story:
Us: WELCOME! You have entered THE SURENTO FAMILY CAMPAIGN! We are- one rock-star mom and one art-king dad with a three-sibling-offspring-ring and one grand-baby-little-lady. 

After lifetimes of playing the cards we were dealt (so-to-speak) we have decided to quit playing games and start a doughnut business! 

You: Um what?

Us: DOUGHNUT BUSINESS!

You: Why?

Us: The idea came about one sunny morning on our way to the springs. We moved to North Central Florida almost 10 years ago to be closer to the rock-star mom’s family, Fort White, FL to be exact. Only to discover that one of the LARGEST aquifers (underground water supply) in the world lives right here! So as you may guess, tourists come from all over the world to visit the area to scuba dive, kayak, stand up paddle board, and float on tubes;) The latter happens to be the most popular activity and we live just a 5 minute drive from the most popular tube rental place around! 

You: Oh yeah?

Us: Yeah! (see above video)

We started going tubing a lot and (of course) brought snacks and drinks with us every time. (You need some sustenance in the great outdoorsy swampy wilderness.) Those of you who know the art-king dad (Shooter) know that he LOVES SWEETS, well we all do but he especially, and we also all love COFFEE (who doesn’t).  NO ONE is selling snacks or drinks at these prime locations where an average of 1800 people a day are coming through. 

You: Woah ! That's a lot.

Us: I know right?

Shooter has witnessed the success of mini donut stands at bike rallies all over the country while vending his airbrushed artwork. These guys were racking up big bucks on these tasty little things, SOOOOOOO we talked to the tube rental owners and a few locals and we all decided it would be a GREAT idea to open a mini doughnut and coffee stand!!!! That way you can come get your tubes and on your way to the water enjoy a sweet, fresh made snack!!

You: How would you go about doing that?

Us: By gathering together a community of supportive art and doughnut lovers and raising the funds needed to get this thing going!

story:
Deadline Brewing Project

Hi there.  My name is Jason.  I'm co-owner of Deadline Brewing Project in Virginia Beach, Virginia.  We are a start-up craft brewery located a block from the Chesapeake Bay.

 

 

I'm the goofy looking one on the right.  My wife Erica is in the center.  Erica and I are TV news people here in the area.  

There on the left is Darrell, our head brewer.  Darrell is a former brewer for another local brewery and has won numerous awards in local and state beer competitions.

Darrell is also a former newspaper reporter.  When we sat back and thought about what we'd like to name the brewery it was a no brainer:  Deadline.  You'll see that news theme sprinkled in our brewery and beer names. You might even see a pattern with the perk levels! 

Now we find ourselves literally under deadline.  Our goal is to provide our customers with an experience that will keep them coming back for more.  

We decided to start this campaign to help get us over the hump.  We are trying to fund this brewery by ourselves.  We could have gone out and gotten some financial backers,  but we didn't want to do that.  We really wanted to make this thing work on our own.

For the most part we have reached our goal, but we are a bit short.  With your help, we can live out our dream and get to brewing.

What We Need & What You Get

Another $15,000 would go a looooong way.  Over the past 8 months we've been renovating two parcels which make up 2,000 square feet.  We've been doing most of the work ourselves and there has been a lot of money going out and nothing coming in.

Here's what the place looked like before we took over in December:

 

And here is what it looks like today:

 

We think we are a month away from opening, but as you can see there are still things we need to buy.  That includes tables and bar stools for starters.  We haven't purchased cash registers.  And yes, we have the brewing equipment, but we haven't bought kegs.  All of this adds up very quickly.

Our goal is make unique craft beer.  We plan to use a lot of fresh fruits to give each one the flavor that beer deserves.

As you'll see, we are offering several unique perks for contributing.   Of course we have t-shirts and stickers and koozies,  but how about getting to brew with Darrell for the day.  He looks like a fun guy to hang with.  A gig where drinking on the job is encouraged!!!

If that's not your thing, how about being forever immortalized with beer named after YOU.  You might even enjoy sipping on that brew at private party for you and your closest friends.

Every little bit helps and we really just appreciate the fact that you've read up to this point.  Even if we don't reach our goal it will definitely help us get closer to getting the doors open.  

If you can't contribute, no worries.  How about letting your friends know!  We hope they'll be just as excited as we are.

Cheers.

story:
Why a 'cargo-van'?

Since I have all the necessary equipment and already operate sporadically as a 'pop-up' operation, with a 'cargo van' my business hours will less likely be affected by weather and can be made operational immediately. Also, with a 'work-place' I will be able hire a team and exponentially increase production, and service customers in a timely manner. 

Please help me acquire a van, I will continue this campaign and inform you by 'updates' of the investments and improvements made.  Thank you for your continued support!

Also, with a 'work-place' I will be able hire a team and exponentially increase production, and service customers in a timely manner. Please help me acquire a van, I will continue this campaign and inform you by 'updates' of the investments and improvements made.  Thank you for your continued support!

story:
Imagine....

A soft serve truck roaming the streets of Eugene, bringing nondairy happiness in the form of "nice cream" cones, cups, shakes, floats and sundaes to the people. And it's all Vegan! Our soft serve is:

100% Dairy Free

Gluten Free

Made with Non-GMO ingredients

Fat Free

Cholesterol Free

Peanut and Tree Nut Free

Made with fairly traded ingredients

Kosher Certified

we will also have gluten-free cones available!

and it

TASTES AMAZING!!!


tentative menu

To keep it all balanced out, and to provide alternatives for everyone, we will also serve organic smoothies, blended to order. They will be made with only organic fruit-no added sugar or pre-made smoothie mix- with a variety of healthy add-ins available.

Why nondairy?

Consumers have become increasingly interested in nondairy products! In fact,

"The dairy alternatives market is projected to grow globally from $8.2 billion in 2014 to $19.5 billion in 2020, with 15.5% growth from 2015-2020", according to a July, 2016 study by the firm MarketsandMarkets.

The study cites several market factors driving the growth:

  • Growing consumer health awarenes
  • Increasing global vegan population
  • The nutritional benefits of dairy alternatives compared to dairy products
  • Increasing consumer rates of lactose intolerance and dairy allergies
  • Increased demand for fortified dairy free food and beverage products
  • Increasing awareness of cruel dairy industry practices

In short, there is overwhelming demand for nondairy frozen dessert products, especially soft serve, which can be very difficult to find.

That's where we come in...and YOU!

With our shared vision, your financial support, and our elbow grease, we will bring delicious and healthy Nice Cream to Eugene...and beyond!

 

We are ready to bring Bambi & Roxy's Nice Cream Truck to the streets of Eugene........almost!

We put a partial down payment on this awesome truck:

The truck has almost everything already, but we do need to modify it to meet our specific needs.

We are asking for your support to fund this amazing truck! All the money we raise will go toward:

-tune up for Truck

-miscellaneous mechanical expenses needed

-removal of some existing equipment

-purchase and  installation of freezer

-installation of our soft serve machine

(so generously donated to us by Cornbread Cafe in Eugene, Oregon)

-purchase Vitamix blender and small wares

-securing all equipment and getting it all ready to pass inspection

-Graphic wrap with logo

-insurance/permit/license fees

-inventory/product/supplies

-POS system

-pay remaining truck loan

-Indiegogo fees

 

A little bit about us:

We are Jeff, heather, Grace and Luka. We run a small animal sanctuary and educational center here in Eugene, called Free Spirits Farm, and Bambi & Roxy are two bovines who live here with us.

Bambi is a Jersey who was born on a dairy farm. As a male born to a dairy cow, he is of "no use" in the dairy industry, so he was destined to be raised to be slaughtered at 18 months. Roxy is a Miniature Hereford who was destined to be used as a dairy cow. She would have had her babies take from her one by one, over many years, only then to be slaughtered herself after she was no longer breeding.

However, Bambi & Roxy found their way here, to Free Spirits Farm, and they will live free and happy for the rest of their lives!

Profits from Bambi & Roxy's Nice Cream Truck will help support Bambi & Roxy, and Dolly, Zoe, Daisy, Pepper, Shadowfax, Nutmeg & Alpine here at Free Spirits Farm!

We have named our truck in honor of them and to help bring awareness that Ice Cream can be cruelty free and taste delicious! We recognize that nondairy "Nice Cream" is the healthiest and kindest way to enjoy amazing desserts and treats.

 

 

 

Our goal is to be funded, permitted and ready to roll in

May, 2017, with our pre-launch party May 26th.

 

Please take a look at the perks we have put together for you. There are some sweet rewards! Some of the perks include an invitation to our pre-launch party, which will be on our property, at Free Spirits Farm, where you might have a chance to say hello to Bambi & Roxy!

From the bottom of our hearts,

we thank you for your support!

xoxo
